story:
Short Summary

Together, we can create an amazing music video to accompany the release of my new, upcoming single "Electricity"! My team and I aim to pay homage to a classic '50s film (one of my favorites) to play off of the throwback vibes of the song.

Never one to sacrifice for my vision, I have aimed high for the concept of this music video, because I know that when it is completed, with your help, it can and will be exactly what I've always envisioned. Together, we will make something great.

What We Need & What You Get

All of the money raised will go towards:

  • Film Gear Rentals - to make this the best it can be, we need to rent some high-quality film gear to ensure that this looks just as good on your screen as it does in our heads.
  • Car/Prop Rentals - the film the video is based on focuses on a classic car that will play a major role in the music video (This will be only a one-day rental as we want to maximize every dollar raised.)
  • Permits/Insurance - in order to both legally and safely film in the locations for this shoot, film permits and insurance are necessary for both legal reasons as well as the safety of the cast and crew.
What You Get - Make sure to check out the awesome Perks section to see what I will give you as a thank you for your contribution!

The Impact

This is only the beginning of the release of lots of new music! I aim to bridge the gap between multiple genres and invite listeners of all walks of life.

Any extra money raised will go towards the creation of more new music/music videos/content for you to enjoy!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute monetarily, there are still plenty of ways you can help!

You can SHARE this campaign on any and every social network you use, as well as tell your friends/family/enemies via word of mouth! Any kind of help is greatly appreciated, as everyone you tell about this campaign/my music is a new pair of ears to sing to.

story:
Yes, We're Making A New Album.

Here's the deal

It's been nearly 4 years since we starting recording our debut album 1994, which would go on to make several top album lists of 2013 and be streamed/sold in over 30 different countries. Needlessly to say, we're absolutely proud of what its accomplished, considering that we had no help from any management group, label, or publicist - everything we did ourselves with the support of amazing fans.

Since then, we've learned a lot about what to do and what not to do. At the end of 2014, we decided maybe we should do what other bands were doing: release an EP and hire a publicist to help promote it - the result being our self-titled EP released in July 2015. Because of what little we could afford, we went with a smaller company in hopes that we could still get the impact we were wanting. This turned out to be a giant waste of money and time, as it virtually did nothing for us. 

Point being - you pay for what you get!

We also felt that releasing a short EP as opposed to a full album naturally didn't generate as much excitement among our fans. Don't get us wrong, the love and support we have received from it has been great - all I'm saying is, we hear you.

So, after taking some time away from the group and allowing ourselves to be without it for awhile, we're coming back revitalized to make things right: record a brand new full-length album and include you all (our fans) in the process.

Every dollar contributed will not only go toward your rewards, but will also be key in partnering with big name industry insiders, producers, publicists, and promoters.

We know you want to see the band succeed, and you can help us make that possible.

All You Have To Do Is Pre-Order.

That's it!

We've heard it time and time again - "Any chance of your music getting a vinyl or cassette release?"

Now we're saying YES, there IS a chance and all you have to do is pre-order.

Vinyl-pressing is expensive and hard to produce up front. However, pre-ordering our new full-length album will help us make it possible - plus, there'll even be an opportunity for you to get your very own personal copy of our debut album 1994 on vinyl (the only to ever exist).

Not to mention the more you contribute, the more awesome goodies you'll receive exclusively - exclusive vinyl/cassette releases, album updates, t-shirts, posters, buttons, private live-stream shows, etc.

What If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

We'll still love ya anyway...

We're hoping to use this as a platform to progress in our career and further get the word out about what we do via radio, TV, and touring.

The truth is we literally can not do this on our own.

What we're wanting to do is something that normally a record label would help fund but since we release everything independently, we have no buffer for such things - everything comes straight from our pockets.

We thought this would be a cool way for our fans to get their hands on some AWESOME merch that otherwise wouldn't be possible, while helping Noiseheads move forward - making it a win-win for both parties.

But even if we don't make the goal, we'll still fulfill every pre-order we receive :)

Let's Make It Happen.

We can do this.

We've never done anything like this before and have no idea what to expect. But believe us when we say this can be the turning point in Noiseheads career, and YOU can be responsible for making that happen.

Thank you for all of the support over the years, and here's to many more :)

- Noiseheads

story:
Dearest friends, i am creating an album, a compilation of songs that have birthed out of deep love in me thinking about the future of my children and great grandchildren. 

I feel really inspired to create this, and i am just so grateful you are taking the time to consider being a supporter!

I know that there are so many causes, so many deserving places in need of contribution, and i am someone who donates to a lot of different things...  I had to sit with it for a while before i put a call out for support in a world filled with much need,  And yet when i dream't about the world i wanted for my children, i wanted there to be art in it, i wanted there to be a place for the creative process and the artistic visioning potential within our humanity to have a place in the world. i have always felt that there always needs to be a place for visionary art on this planet. Art and music in its nature reflects the creative force that lives inside of us as human beings. I want my great grand children to inherit a healthy planet, and i also want them to inherit a life that is full of love and spirit that is rooted in a relationship with all living beings, as a tool to build a relationship and connection and reminder to that inherent connection we all share. 

Though i am not formally trained in music, i have been studying sound and the use of music in a very unique way for over 7 years now. Learning from masterful healers who have harnessed the power of sound and using ancient songs that have literally come from the earth to help aid the healing process. 

I also am working alongside my husband who is a professional musician who majored in Jazz in university and has been teaching music for over 15 years.  As well as other talented guest musicians and vocalists who are supporting the project. 

The album will also be sharing a few sound bites from an amazing native drumming group who are part of my family.  They carry a truly beautiful authentic and ceremonial energy as they support in local ceremonies, vision quests, and sundance  in the Eastern part of Canada. 

The album is devoted to every woman who is seizing courage to follow her dreams and dream in and vision a new world for our futures. Every woman who is afraid and doing it anyway. And of course to the Great Mother.... Who is always with us, but who has been forgotten of for far too long. 

It is also deeply devoted to my grandmothers and grandfathers, living and passed on, and the deep gratitude i feel to be alive and all those who walked before me to get me to this moment in time.  

The songs that we want to record are beautiful lyrical compisitions and Piano and Drum. They are powerful and potent, haunting and inspiring. 

One song, is called water is life. And it is written for the water protectors at standing rock, and all the protectors and guardians of the water. Anthems for protests, environmental protection, and spiritual connection. 

All songs have been offered to be used in all and every capacity to different environmental and activist organizations working towards the protection of our peoples and planet. 

This campaign will help with the primary costs of the creation of the album. 

Studio recording Costs ---5000

Mastering process  -- 2000$ 

Paying musicians the album estimate --- 1000$ 

Material Production 500$  -Cds, Visionary Art Prints 

Production is between 7-9,000$ with video creation

Which adds up to be a good chunk of change. So we are very very grateful for any help in this creations process. 

Thank you so much for your support! 

All my love and boundless blessing

Athena

story:
About Us

Hey guys and gals!  Thanks for coming to our Indiegogo page!!  We started our band, The Danberrys, in 2010 and have released two records and two singles since then.  Both of our records were nominated for Independent Music Awards ("Best EP" and "Best Americana Album"), but since we've always funded our projects on our own, we didn't have the extra funds to properly publicize those albums & only a limited number of people got to hear them. This time we need some help getting this album into the ears of as many listeners as possible!  

Our new record, "Give and Receive", was recorded at Zac Brown's Southern Ground studio here in Nashville, TN.  It's one of the best studios in town and we were thrilled for the opportunity to record our music in such a historic room with some of the most talented musicians and engineers on the planet.  

We have already spent over $15,000 out-of-pocket to record and print our new album.  Now we need help to properly publicize the record.  Without proper exposure, our music will unfortunately not reach many listeners.  Publicizing the album is the next step in making music our day job.

Our video costs for this release will amount to around $3,000, and our publicist fees will be over $8,000.  In order to cover these costs, we are raising money through a pre-sale of our new record and offering exclusive content that will only be available to Indiegogo contributors.  We hope you'll check out the different contribution levels (i.e. perks) and find one that makes you feel fuzzy inside.

The Impact

We make music because we're called to make music.  For independent artists like us, recording records is a labor of love and time with a hefty financial burden thrown in for good measure.  Your support allows us to continue sharing our gifts with you, the music lovers.  Through the years we've been honored to experience the healing power of music, and we know this is what we're here to do.  We're very thankful for the talents we've been given and for the opportunities that continue to be presented every day.  We would like to send a humongous THANK YOU for your time and consideration!

Ben and Dorothy

story:
Qui sommes-nous ?

Jeunes musiciens du monde (JMM) offre des cours  de musique gratuits à des jeunes issus de milieux populaires. L’école de Montréal est située dans le quartier Hochelaga-Maisonneuve où les défis sociaux sont nombreux. Notre mission est de contribuer au développement du  potentiel musical, personnel et social des jeunes. L’approche préconisée par Jeunes musiciens du monde dépasse largement l’enseignement traditionnel de la musique. Il implique aussi un encadrement  et l’octroi d’une attention toute particulière aux jeunes inscrits aux programmes. Les professeurs de Jeunes musiciens du monde sont attentifs aux situations  vécues par les élèves. Cette activité de type parascolaire contribue à la persévérance de l’élève tant à l’école que dans la vie.

Notre projet 

La création d’un disque s’inscrit dans cet esprit : offrir à plusieurs  jeunes la possibilité de vivre une expérience musicale et humaine qui permettra de cultiver leur estime de soi et leur confiance. Tous nos jeunes chanteront une des chansons du CD qui sera enregistrée ici à Montréal. Les chansons ont été écrites par les élèves et la musique a été composée par les professeurs de JMM. Ce sera une expérience de groupe au caractère pédagogique constructif.  Déjà les répétitions vont bon train et les jeunes sont disciplinés et très motivés par ce projet. Tout cela contribue largement à développer leur sentiment d’appartenance et le plaisir de créer ensemble de la musique. Nous avons la possibilité d’enregistrer ce recueil de six chansons au mois de juin 2016.


À Valcourt, en studio

Au début des vacances scolaires, nous prévoyons amener une quinzaine d’élèves au studio B-12 à Valcourt pour compléter l’enregistrement du CD.  Nous passerons trois jours en Estrie avec des professionnels de studio. Cette expérience bonifiera la création musicale de ce disque. Le studio B-12 offre toutes les commodités pour accueillir les artistes qui désirent un contexte de création inspirant. Tout y est rassemblé pour en faire un lieu de prédilection. C’est dans ce magnifique endroit que nos jeunes, accompagnés de leurs professeurs, pourront vivre l’enregistrement du disque “Comme une étoile”.

story:
Short Summary

Hey everybody! Thank you for taking a minute to look over my Indie GOGO crowdfunding campaign! I am ramping up to create my next music video to accompany the release of my long awaited single "Gold." Many of you may know me personally and other's have been keeping up with my work, I am happy to have you all in my life. With your continuous support, encouragement, and help, you allow me to go after what I love to do. The music industry is not easy, it is tough and very cutthroat. But, creation should be easy and fun and thus will continue to do what I do regardless of the outcome. If you find yourself in the position, any amount of support will help. If you are not able to contribute at this time, no worries, just subscribe to my channels and enjoy!! Thank you for being part of my world and lets get this party started!

What I Need 

I am looking to raise $3,200. All the funds will go directly to create the music video. The equipment rental, production crew, and location travel in itself will cost $1,500. That leaves me with $1,700 for costumes, make-up, dancers, food, actors, choreography, and rehearsal time. 

To see it more clearly: 3 Dancers @ 200 for their rehearsal time and shoot date (and that is on the Omie-is-my-Homie rate) = 600 + Main actress (200) = 800. Now, costumes, including mine, say 8 costumes total for the dancers, myself, and the main actress, @ 60 bucks each = 480. Now I want to feed my people of course! :) Good thing we are all on a diet = 200 for food and beverages. Make up and hair stylists (2 @ 200 each) = 400. And there you have it, how the budget can easily just go. So your contribution will help tremendously on providing me with a beautiful opportunity, and also jobs for all those beautiful and talented people I the industry! 

What You Get

You will get some really cool stuff for helping out!!!! Any donations of $1 or more will get an autographed picture!! Donations of $25 or more will get an autographed picture plus a copy of my EP! Donations of $100 or more will get an autographed picture, a copy of my EP, and a OMARVELUZ Official T-SHIRT! Donations of $250 or more will get an autographed picture, a copy of my EP, a OMARVELUZ Official T-Shirt, and a Scarf Wizzard (find out what it is on FB. Facebook Search "Scarf Wizzard"!! Donations of $500 or more will get you everything plus a big THANK YOU phone call from yours truly to personally thank you for your contribution! Donations of $1000 or more, you will get it all plus an invitation to rehearsals and the shooting of the Music video! Thank you all for reading this!!! Truly!

Risks & Challenges

There are no real risks besides the fact of whether you like the outcome of my work. I encourage you to google my name Omarveluz and see the things I have out already. They are racy and maybe not necessarily your cup of tea. I am polishing my style and image and am creating a more all-age and all-gender friendly persona. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Those of you that are in the LA area, and have talents such a make up, hair, costume construction, a dance studio, restaurant, grocery store, a PR Firm, distribution contacts, or even a HUGE online following where you can help blast my project!!  Please let me know! :) You don't have to fiscally contribute, as their are many other elements you may be able to help out with!

Donations of $500 or more will get you everything plus a big THANK YOU phone call from yours truly to personally thank you for your contribution! Donations of $1000 or more, you will get it all plus an invitation to rehearsals and the shooting of the Music video! Thank you all for reading this!!! Truly!
Risks & Challenges
 There are no real risks besides the fact of whether you like the outcome of my work. I encourage you to google my name Omarveluz and see the things I have out already. They are racy and maybe not necessarily your cup of tea. I am polishing my style and image and am creating a more all-age and all-gender friendly persona. 
    Other Ways You Can Help Those of you that are in the LA area, and have talents such a make up, hair, costume construction, a dance studio, restaurant, grocery store, a PR Firm, distribution contacts, or even a HUGE online following where you can help blast my project!!  Please let me know! :) You don't have to fiscally contribute, as their are many other elements you may be able to help out with!

story:
HIPHOP UNIVERSITY

¿Tiene cabida el HipHop en la universidad? ¿Y si ese encuentro tuviese como protagonistas a 4 artistas y las artes de la comunicación, la poesía, la cultura, la música, y el marketing? Ya no tendrás que imaginarlo más, porque el próximo 4 de Mayo en Salamanca tendrá lugar el evento "OnlyReal, HipHop University".

 
  • OnlyRealHH es un programa radiofónico sobre la cultura hip hop, que se emite cada martes a partir de las 19h a través de CVB radio (Madrid). Tras 4 temporadas se encuentra en el top 3 de los mejores programas del género en la plataforma ivoox, y a un solo paso de llegar a su emisión nº100.
    •  

  • La idea principal de este crowdfunding es conseguir la financiación suficiente para celebrarlo por todo lo alto en el lugar que vio nacer este proyecto hace casi un lustro, en la Facultad de Comunicación de Salamanca. La prioridad del encuentro es traer a 4 artistas nacionales de primer nivel, entre los que se encuentran Zpu, Tosko, Cres y Dj Mesh.

  • El evento estará marcado por un ambiente puramente festivo. La entrada será completamente gratuita, pero con vuestra ayuda podremos ofrecer sorteos y regalos de todo tipo, realizar llamadas en directo, ofrecer la posibilidad de que participéis como público, grabar las entrevistas como en TheOtherFace, retransmitir el programa en directo etc. 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

Financiación y recompensas:

  • El mayor problema de la financiación del evento pasa por traer a los artistas, la mayoría de ellos afincados en ciudades lejanas a Salamanca. Por comodidad y rapidez los desplazamientos se realizarán en AVE, mientras que las pernoctaciones tendrán lugar en hoteles céntricos de la ciudad. Las marcas de ropa, tiendas, discográficas y el resto de interesados podrán "apadrinar" a los artistas, costeando sus desplazamientos o estancia en la ciudad.
  • Además, podrás ganar recompensas exclusivas, conocer a tus artistas favoritos en persona, cenar con ellos, conseguir sus últimos discos o libros firmados con dedicatorias especiales etc.
    •  
  • En el caso de no conseguir los fondos suficientes intentaremos realizar el eveto de igual forma, solo que renunciando a ciertos aspectos anteriormente mencionados, y reduciendo evidentemente la espectacularidad y calidad del mismo. 

 

Otras formas de ayudar

Sabemos que algunas personas no pueden permitirse gastos económicos, por eso mismo abrimos opciones para que puedan disfrutar del evento desde dentro, mediante la colaboración activa de los preparativos, o de apoyo con los medios técnicos y humanos:

  • Recordad que la intención de esta campaña es favorecer el hip hop, conseguir crear un punto de encuentro cultural y musical en nuestra ciudad con algunos de los mejores artistas del país, y para lograrlo vamos a necesitar vuestra ayuda, que deis eco a este crowdfunding, y sobre todo que tengáis ganas de disfrutar de un día inolvidable.

Y eso es todo amigos, si tenéis alguna pregunta no dudéis en poneros en contacto con nosotros, estaremos encantados de poder ayudaros. 

#EatDaHit

story:
UPDATE JUNE 3: We're delighted to report that the Flory Jagoda Sephardic Music fund of the VA Foundation for the Humanities has offered us a 1:1 match to help fund our new Sephardic CD. Until midnight June 11th it will match all contributions up to $3000 with an equal amount.  SO IF YOU DONATE $3000 WE'LL receive $6000  and MAKE OUR $11,000 GOAL. 

If you've been busy, procrastinating, indecisive, preoccupied, we'd like to encourage you to step up and help us out. Now's a good time. 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

"Trio Sefardi’s beautiful harmonies and skilled accompaniment movingly translates the joy and soul of the lost world I remember so well.  ... I am proud to call them my musical heirs."  Flory Jagoda

                                      

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Join us in celebration of the life of a delightful, dedicated, generous, talented woman, Flory Jagoda,  whose music has brought such joy to generations of listeners! To perform and record her music is truly an honor and privilege, and we're asking for your support so we can continue sharing it.

                                     

Trio Sefardi is a confluence of three performers who share a love of, and a wide-ranging expe­ri­ence with Sephardic music. The Sephardim were Jews exiled from Spain in 1492 and dispersed to Greece, the Balkans, Turkey, Palestine, North Africa and South America. Wherever they went they kept their language, Ladino (a mixture of Spanish, Hebrew, and the local dialect) and their customs.


Sephardic music, like traditional music everywhere, is home-made;  now performed in concert halls, it was originally created by and for family and community, shared around the hearth or in the kitchen.  The repertoire includes romanzas (story-songs), holiday songs, songs of love lost and found, lullabies, and songs about day-to-day life. 

We're lucky to have learned our craft from Flory, a living master of the Bosnian Sephardic tradition. Her story is a compelling one.

                               

If you asked Flory what's most important in life, she would say, "to continue," thinking of her family and village destroyed in World War II. 

Teenage survivor of an epic solo train trip from Nazi-occupied Zagreb to freedom in 1940 without the yellow star Jews were required to wear, Flory evaded detection by playing her accordion non-stop for the whole voyage. The conductor was so enchanted that he forgot to ask for her ticket! Reunited with her parents and interned on the little island of Korcula, she escaped with them to Italy where she met and married American army sergeant Harry Jagoda.

They settled in Northern Virginia, where they raised four children. It was many years before they learned that her whole family was massacred with all the Jews in their village, buried in a ravine marked by a lone tree. Flory has made it her lifetime mission to recreate in song and story the community that she so dearly loved.

                        

Flory became a composer and performer, singing songs learned from her Nona (grandmother) and writing new ones; a beacon for the Sephardic community, a “Keeper of the Flame.” As her children grew she brought them on stage with her, telling stories that brought her village to life for audiences all over the world. Flory received a National Heritage Award, she stars in the 2014 documentary Flory's Flame, and Jews everywhere sing her Hanukah song, Ocho Kandelikas.  And she has shared her knowledge with the many musicians who have come to her, seeking that which she has so carefully, so lovingly preserved. 

                              

Our singer, Susan Gaeta, became her apprentice in 1992 through the Virginia Foundation for the Humanities Master Apprentice program. Guitarist and lutenist Howard Bass completed an informal apprenticeship of his own to become a member of Flory’s touring ensemble, and Tina Chancey became a frequent guest on viola da gamba and fiddle. For a quarter century we've worked together, and now our group Trio Sefardi is ready to help her legacy thrive and grow, “to continue.”

ABOUT THE TRIO SEFARDI: Veterans of Sephardic music performances with La Rondinella, Hesperus, The Western Wind, and cantor Ramon Tasat as well as with Flory, we "combine respect for tradition with a creative approach to arranging and scoring dedicated to bringing the vibrant past into the living present." The Washington Post calls our music “lovely and luminous.” Founded in 2010, the group has played at concert halls, festivals, schools and synagogues throughout the United States, most recently at the Kennedy Center and Southern Methodist University. 

                                              


Our first CD, Sefardic Celebration, was released in 2011.  Here's our version of a favorite Hanukah song. The new CD, will feature eight of Flory's songs, and four from another tradition bearer, Isaac Azose of Seattle, with a budget that comes in at just under $11,000 (details upon request). We'll record in June and release the CD by September. 

 Our work with Flory is a touchstone that connects us all to the beating heart of a living tradition, a responsibility that we take very seriously. Please help us keep this music alive.

                             
And Flory has the final word: 

"It gives me the greatest pleasure to hear Trio Sefardi play the music that I taught them and to know that the cherished musical culture and traditions of the Bosnian Sephardim will continue to thrill listeners well into the future.  Trio Sefardi’s beautiful harmonies and skilled accompaniment movingly translates the joy and soul of the lost world I remember so well.  Along with my own family, I am proud to call them my musical heirs."  Flory Jagoda

story:
What is this about?

Great music is like air and water. It surrounds everything we do. Our earliest childhood memories -- close friends and family. Lying on our floor alone, or standing hot and sweaty in a huge crowd. We make new friends. We fall in love. Our hearts break when we lose things close to us. 

Music winds its way through all of these, beyond our lives and into human history. Poets don't always understand it. Pastors think it comes from God. Scientists think that music came before speech and was how the beginning of civilization was built. We can't stop making it! We depend on music to soothe us and save us, providing comfort in hard times, whether those hard times were the physically demanding stone age or the more moral hardships of modern life.

The demand for songs is simply universal. It helps us face fear -- feelings of being out of place, the fear of rejection, the yearning for human connection, the desire to explore. And these songs are at the intersection of the now and the primal.

We’re Californians in 2016, and we’ve learned some things about music in the intervening millennia. Some tools we have now have been around forever -- like our voices and our drums. Those tools are the beginnings of music. They're the canvas on which we paint with more modern inventions, like guitars and synths.

The four of us make music because we can't help it. Talk to one of us for even a few seconds and you see the depth we're invested in our careers, no hesitation -- no "if music doesn't work out, we'll go jump into something safe." Chris literally can not stop pounding on whatever's in front of him. Ryan often wakes up in the middle of the night to write five songs in a row. We've slept in furniture stores, on couches and floors, and only two of us have a car. The world is a scary and anxious place when you leave it all out there. To us, you guys make the difference between a world that feels right and a world that doesn't.


We’ve recorded out of pocket before, and we've recorded with a label before. In a vacuum, we could self finance, but it would take years to do. We aren't looking at this as a shortcut. We look at this as an opportunity. Finally, we can all join forces and do something we couldn't do in a vacuum. 

The last EP we made was great, but we've grown as artists. Our songs need things we can't do from scratch by ourselves, and need new help from great industry contacts. 

We’re asking you, our fans, friends and family members, to invest in us. Our vision for the next phase of our career stems from this group of primal, real songs. From there we want to hire a producer/engineer, work out of a large recording studio, and then -- most importantly -- push our music to the world with a professionally managed radio push and a focused, disciplined local/regional market publicity campaign. 

We’re hoping that by doing it together now, we can do it well enough that we won't exclusively have to depend on crowdfunding again.


What is the budget?

$4100 -- Studio time with a professional sound engineer, as well as mixing and mastering.

$1000 -- Publicist for LA area -- The LA music scene is really ruled by a few gatekeepers. We could probably write and send out our own press releases, but without the relationships that PR professionals have already established with local bloggers like Buzzbands.LA, We Found New Music, Grimy Goods, LA Record, LA Weekly, etc., it's that much harder to even get our emails opened. 

$2300 -- Radio campaign -- We will be hiring a professional firm such as the Planetary Group or AAM's Sunday service to coordinate a radio campaign. This entails sending advance copies of EP4 to approximately 300 college and independent radio stations across the country. More importantly, the firm's relationship with program managers helps us open doors with station managers and allows us to track which stations have added the EP to their library. 

$500 -- Art and photography -- We're hoping to commission two very good friends of ours -- Ara Aranguri and Demetrios Katsantonis -- to do the artwork, t-shirt design and photography for this project. 

$400 -- CD replication -- We need to make physical copies of our product to give to our backers, send to radio stations and sell to our fans. 

$700 -- Rewards fulfillment -- These perks ain't free!  Includes sales tax. 

$1000 -- Fees and other miscellaneous expenses -- This includes payment processing fees, the fees Indiegogo charges to host on their platform, shipping for out of state perks.

What can go wrong?

As a band, we've always taken big risks. We've gone on tours, played big shows and festivals, and generally delivered things a lot of people thought were impossible. Crowdfunding this EP is a new, exciting risk, but one we feel prepared for. We have contingency plans on top of contingency plans in case we don't get to our goal through Indiegogo, or on the off chance we push past our goal (...epic music video??). As always, all of Niantic's day to day profits from here to the release go towards making sure we make the best possible product for our fans. The fundraising thermometer below shows what we'll be able to fund at each level, including overhead for fees and perks. Check back frequently, this graphic will be updated as the campaign goes along.


*Distribution includes CD duplication and artwork -- basically all of the things that go into packaging music for consumption.

Another big risk is time. Things almost never go right in the studio. We've built in time to make sure every song is ready out of the box the first day of recording. There's extra buffer time in the project plan, because the thing you can't plan ahead for is always the thing that delays you. 

When these things happen, you'll be the first to know about it, and we'll plan accordingly (the rewards may take extra time to get to you, etc).  You can see below for our target project timeline. 


How else can I help?

The ultimate goal of all of this is to share our music with the world. If you can't contribute financially beyond buying us a cup of coffee, we understand. Please share our project page with your friends. You never know what they might be able to do, or who they might be friends with. Bring your friends the next time we play in your area. Or put us on during your next road trip. 

Big shout out to Kevin Brennan, Jack Brazill, Maggie Bryan, JP Pulles, and the rest of the Niantic team for the various things they've done to help get the video and project going. We wouldn't be here without your help!

Check back frequently, this graphic will be updated as the campaign goes along.






*Distribution includes CD duplication and artwork -- basically all of the things that go into packaging music for consumption.
Another big risk is time. Things almost never go right in the studio. We've built in time to make sure every song is ready out of the box the first day of recording. There's extra buffer time in the project plan, because the thing you can't plan ahead for is always the thing that delays you. 
When these things happen, you'll be the first to know about it, and we'll plan accordingly (the rewards may take extra time to get to you, etc).  You can see below for our target project timeline. 




How else can I help?
 The ultimate goal of all of this is to share our music with the world. If you can't contribute financially beyond buying us a cup of coffee, we understand. Please share our project page with your friends. You never know what they might be able to do, or who they might be friends with. Bring your friends the next time we play in your area. Or put us on during your next road trip. 
Big shout out to Kevin Brennan, Jack Brazill, Maggie Bryan, JP Pulles, and the rest of the Niantic team for the various things they've done to help get the video and project going. We wouldn't be here without your help!

story:
CRISIS: 

In Africa, endangered rhinos and elephants are rapidly being killed off by greedy international poachers at an alarming rate, now approaching extinction. The park rangers who defend these animals are outgunned and are far too often killed defending the last of these magnificent endangered animals.  

SOLUTION:

The International Coalition Against Poaching (I.C.A.P.) was created to help the park rangers bring the tragic and senseless killing of these majestic endangered animals to an end so the species can recover, thrive and "live on" in the wild as intended. 

Our website details the exceptionally powerful organization we've built to help defend the defenseless. We hope you'll look through it and share our org with those inclined to help: http://www.counterpoaching.com

"I.C.A.P. is an elite international team of veterans from the Special Operations, Counter-Terrorist, Intelligence and Diplomatic Communities - each uniquely qualified, experienced and equipped to directly help African park rangers respond to the growing threat against critically endangered wildlife across the African continent.  The I.C.A.P. team exists solely to make a serious contribution to this worthy counter-poaching cause."
~Craig "Sawman" Sawyer, I.C.A.P. President


New WORLD RECORD Event:


JOIN US!

You can help! Click on one of the donation options to help fund this world record shot! This shot will help raise awareness and support for animal rescue operations and also help improve the survivability of our troops by improving their long range marksmanship equipment and capabilities. 

Craig will shoot a 5-round group at 2 miles and another at 3 miles to set new official WORLD RECORDS! This event will be well-publicized to help raise awareness for the ICAP animal defense mission. Donate NOW and help us get the word out to others and become part of this positive team effort!

Thanks in advance to all who will help support and spread awareness for our mission to DEFEND the DEFENSELESS!

story:
"TORN SAIL’s music is so utterly timeless that it could have been released any time since the mid 1960s. Calling upon the likes of Tim Buckley, The Moody Blues and David Crosby, more recent acts like Verve (before they became The Verve), Sun Kil Moon and Talk Talk, as well as enduring influences such as Joni Mitchell, Lucinda Williams and Pink Floyd, it wears its heart on its sleeve unashamedly..." 

 

This Short Sweet Life is  a distillation of six years of Torn Sail in six tracks:  There's the definitive mix of Birds,  -  initially released on Paul 'Mudd' Murphy's cherished label -  Claremont 56.  There are also great contributions from E.R Thorpe (The Listeners) & Mark Lanegan on Ricochets;  B.J. Smith (Smith & Mudd) plays Moog on Gains on Gains, and Rachel Foster (Bent, Groove Armada) sings on the full length version of Treasure.

Simply put - this record should be out in the world.  We need your support to make it happen.  We don't fit with any label but ours and yours.  

I need your help to make This Short Sweet Life available so that it can be played, shared, e-mailed, or even wiped, piled up, lent against, scratched, caressed, loved and put snugly between other records on a shelf, lent to friends, handed down to children, someday bought for a quid from the charity shop, or sold for a small fortune on discogs.   If I have any funding left over then I'll put it towards the next album or even get the band back out on the road and play some shows.  If I don't make all the money, well, I'm making the records anyway.  I'll just be a little hungrier.
 

Thank you for your time.

Huw (Torn Sail)

story:
Short Summary

Hello! My name is Doris Fields aka Lady D. I am a singer/songwriter and actress. I am also a radio host and now, a festival organizer! I, along with my friend and fellow blues lover, Antonia Ritchie have been organizing the Simply Jazz and Blues Festival since 2013 here in the heart of southern WV. Struggling against a dwindling coal driven economy, we feel that the Arts are definitely "what's next" for the southern coalfields and exposing people to America's "roots" music, the Blues is a great place to begin the road to recovery. Although we don't have the ultimate solution to the area's economic woes, nor are we able to cure disease or end poverty but we know that music is not only important; it is necessary. Music's beneficial effects on mind and body have been known for thousands of years, so "music is medicine!"
We like to think of the Simply Jazz and Blues Festival as a shot of love and happiness injected into our Appalachian summer. We offer three days of jazz, blues and gospel music that not only gives local audiences the opportunity to enjoy what is not very mainstream for this neck of the woods but we also attract a blues audience from outside the state to our beautiful mountains and wonderful hospitality!
We have put this festival on year after year through sponsorships, program advertising and out of pocket. It is slowly catching on at the local level and support is increasing, but not to the point that the total cost of the festival is covered. This has definitely been a labor of love to bring local, regional and national artists to Beckley for the past 3 years, but we have to be more aggressive now in asking for the support of not only businesses but the public in general. We are not able to do it without YOU! Did I mention that this is a FREE festival? Word Park in uptown Beckley comes to life the third weekend of August with the sounds of the music that shaped America and we offer it FREE of charge to the public but it is not free for us to put it on.

What We Need & What You Get

The whole festival could be covered for $25,000! This includes the artists' fees (14 acts over 3 days), sound and lighting, insurance, security, hotel rooms, food for hospitality and advertising. We are setting a goal here of $10,000. If we can reach this goal, we can at least feel somewhat comfortable that the balance can be made up in sponsorships and advertising. We've added some perks to give you a little incentive to help us out. As little as $5 would be so very appreciated as it does add up!

The Impact

The ways in which your support of the Simply Jazz and Blues Festival would impact our area of southern WV would be tremendous. How?
1. Supporting a minority owned operation
2. Advocating diversity (This is music for everyone)
3. Advocating the Arts (These genres are also part of the Arts!)
4. Preserving America's "roots" music. (The Blues)
5. Attracting tourism to southern WV. ($)
6. Impacting the local economy (gas stations, restaurants, hotels, etc.) ($)
7. Giving musicians work at a decent level of pay.
8. Showing southern WV in a positive light.
9. Celebration of the African-American musical culture that is jazz, blues and gospel music.
10. Educating the masses through our instrument petting zoo and "Blues in the Schools" programming for young people.


Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges with an undertaking such as this, but we are armed to meet them first with the heart, passion and love of the music and the artists that perform and preserve it. I have worked in the entertainment field for over 20 years and have organized this festival for the last 4 years and feel equipped to produce an event such as this. Money is the only real obstacle that stands in the way. We have a proven track record of producing great events but we need your help to keep them great!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute monetarily. If you cannot; please just spread the word, share this campaign or maybe sign up to be a volunteer at the festival!

story:
Sleep Keepers are a band built of contradictions and collisions, of both celebrating differences and sharing common ground. We've just released a heavy dynamic “ROAR!” EP and a soft piano EP "Hearts Get No Sleep".

Check us out:

https://www.facebook.com/SleepKeepers

https://vk.com/sleepkeepers

https://www.instagram.com/sleepkeepers/

What We Need

Guys, the truth is, much more money is needed to produce&release a 10-track LP. So we'll be thankful for any help and support you give us, no matter how many contributions we may receive.

Other Ways You Can Help

We do understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help!  Please make some noise about our campaign, using the Indiegogo share tools.

Much love xx

story:
My name is Michael Reisman.  Some of you know me as Bongo.  I’ve been a musician since as far back as I can remember, writing and singing my own stuff for 20 years now.  I’m also a father, husband and progressive early childhood educator.  I’ve been in bands as a drummer and guitarist in New Jersey, Bremerton and Seattle for years, but I want to introduce you to a new musical endeavor.  Introducing Michael Reisman is an artistic re-envisioning of me as a contemporary American folk artist, much as I’ve always been, but not the same.  Introducing…is a new collection of original songs that not only tell the intimate story of my life and perspective, but stories and perspectives that I believe speak to the lives of the contemporary American family, man, woman and child.  Introducing… requires your help, so I am asking you to participate in the process of creation: creation of this project, as well as others to come.  Your contributions in support of this album will allow me to release this collection of original, fully arranged songs written over the last ten years.  Although this record is what one might consider a “solo” release, many other folks you know, or know of, have contributed.  Releasing this music, spreading it live and on social media, will give others the opportunity to hear it and choose local level folk artistry for themselves as an alternative to what the commercial music industry puts in front of us.   Your support of my project brings you closer to the creation process, closer to my music, and closer to future projects and collaborations.  Maybe closer than you think…

 

What We Need and What You Get

Introducing Michael Reisman requires $5000 to mix, master, reproduce and release.  So far the project has benefited from the donated talents of many of the artists and collaborators I have worked with in past years.  We recorded all the basic tracks at Eric Waldman’s (Bobby Beetcut) Revolutionary War Historical home in Wantage, NJ.  Overdubs happened everywhere.  Zach Green and David Brinen recorded horns at Princeton Stained Glass in Union City, NJ.  Organ and piano parts were recorded by Mitch Weinberger (Chester Cates) in Bellingham, WA.  Eric has been editing the material to be mixed, and you can find some sample mixes prepared by Barry Rose on this page.  Andrew Hankins recorded and edited the promotional video you saw at the top of the page.  For better or for worse, I have reached the end of the line of kindly donated skills and services, and now must raise the funds to pay for the completion and release of the project.  There will be a very limited release of hard copy CDs, including artwork and thank yous.  No matter what level you contribute, you will receive a CD.  The CD release will coincide with a digital release via traditional online platforms, so the music will be available to everyone.

Contribution gifts are tiered:

Perks for your contributions start at $25 and ALL come with at least one hard copy CD AND a digital copy of the album for easy sharing.  An assortment of creative and inclusive perks and demonstrations of my gratitude for your generosity can be found on this page, but I've tried to keep it simple.  I know you will find a gift that suits your budget.  If you do not, please contact me so we can work something out!

Why Support Introducing Michael Reisman?

We make music choices with our hard-earned dollars almost every day.  Whether you pay for subscription online music services, purchase digital downloads, or are at the record store holding LPs in your hand, the music you love is more readily available to you than ever before.  If you are a fanatic like me, you are willing to save up any spare dollars you can find to purchase higher priced, limited edition collections that represent the particularities of your favorite artist or era.  Chances are you know me personally, via one capacity or another, or you know my friends, band-mates and co-collaborators.  This sourcing opportunity is a chance for you to make that same musical choice, but to support artists with whom you have a personal tie or relationship, on a grass roots level.  Without your support, this project will not be completed, and the songs will not be heard.  The world will not end.  Holden will continue to eat.  But the collective efforts of nearly a dozen musicians will come to a grinding halt. 

This is not pop, club, house or dance music.  It’s contemporary folk/rock/singer-songwriter, Americana, if you will.  My songs provide an intimate insight into the multiple perspectives that occupy my mind yet reflect our world, our community.  We are families, artists, educators and contributors to society.  We are members of a diverse economic class.  Some have disposable income.  Some do not.  But all of us buy music.  Here is a choice to not only buy MY music but support it as a worthwhile, community-oriented, artistic endeavor.

Let’s Make This Happen Together

Crowdsourcing/funding a project like this is very scary.  Failure is simply not an option, at the risk of my own artistic self-esteem!  Not everyone can contribute financially.  Just like the musicians and artists who have contributed their talents and time to this project, you can still help, even if you cannot contribute your own dollars.  Simply pass the campaign along to your friends and family, especially those who care about the local artist and musician, and tell them you want to support this project, and ask them to contribute on your behalf.  Indiegogo has sharing tools embedded on this page to make for easy sharing.  That’s why every contribution level comes with, minimally, the gift of CD and digital album for easy sharing!  Because in the end all contributors, artists, and patrons alike, will want the music heard, and more music to be made.  Right?  I sure hope so.  Thank you!

story:
We are BJ Griffin (Cellist) and Jason Brown (Pianist).  We both studied classical music at James Madison University.  After college we decided to start mixing classical music with some of the pop music we like to play.  We started out playing at open mics together in 2011, now is 2016 we are performing 6-7 nights a week.  We are raising money to fund our first CD as a duo.  Helping us with this project will get our music out to a much broader audience.  Audience is so important to us.  When we perform, we like to think of the show an intimate conversation with the audience.  This CD will help us get intimate with the masses (LOL).  

We are looking to raise 10,000 to be used for studio time, much of the expenses associated with recording, and more of our video projects associated with the CD.  We have some exciting perks and rewards for your generosity.  We will be giving you product but in addition to that we will also come and give private home performances, Facebook live performances, show shout outs, and even personal cover requests posted on youtube.

 

Even if you are not able to contribute. 

 

Please help out by sharing this campaign!

story:
Update One Video

Update Two Video

 

What Are We Doing?

The Toshi Clinch Big Band is a newly formed big band under the leadership of Toshi Clinch that is entering the studio to record their debut album "Vesuvius". The title of the album comes from the active volcano located in Naples, Italy called Mt. Vesuvius, and the pieces recorded for the album are meant to be a reflection of the awe inspiring power and energy of the great volcano. We hope to provide a full big band album at the highest possible quality.

The members of the band come from around the United States and have all studied or are currently studying music at The University of North Texas. We are excited to perform and record this music for you, but in order to do so we are seeking additional funds. 

Meet the Band:

Due to our enormous size of 18 full time and 5 part time members we have a lot of great information about each of them for you to have a look at. Above you will find both videos and pictures for each member, plus each picture also includes a brief bio so you can get to know the player that little bit more! Here is one of the videos from our trombone player Conner Eisenmenger.

For even more information check out our website at: http://www.toshiclinchmusic.com/tcbb/

Listen to the Band:

This is one of the pieces that will be featured on Vesuvius. It is Toshi Clinch's arrangement of the popular jazz standard "A Night in Tunisia" by Dizzy Gillespie, performed by some of the members of the TCBB.

 
There are also Sneak Peek videos from our first rehearsal at the top of this page. Here is a snippet of Bacon Grease composed by Toshi Clinch.
 
 

You can listen to another recording of the A Night in Tunisia here:
https://soundcloud.com/toshi-clinch/a-night-in-...

To listen to Toshi's arrangement of Back at the Chicken Shack composed by Jimmy Smith follow the link here: https://soundcloud.com/toshi-clinch/back-at-the...

The band is also putting on a live concert in April where we will be performing every piece from the upcoming album. The concert will also feature compositions and arrangements from members of the band as well as local artists. This is definitely an event not to miss if you live in the Dallas, Fort Worth area. All of the details can be seen below.

What We Need & What You Get:

In total the band is looking for $11,000 USD to fund this entire project. This money goes towards many aspects of making a record including paying the musicians, hiring the studio and recording engineer, distributing the product, CD artwork, advertising and production costs. 

For those that contribute to this Indiegogo Campaign you have many options to choose from when it comes to perks. No matter what you contribute we want to make you feel valued, and to let you know that this project would not be able to happen without your contribution. For more information about the perks, you can check out each one to the right or watch the video below.

 

The Track List:

 
The album features many different styles and tracks which Drew and Toshi help breakdown in the video above. The album features 10 different tracks and below you will find a summary of the track names and styles.
 
Bacon Grease - A medium swing minor blues that is very gritty!
I Used to Say - This tune features trumpeter Joshua Kauffman in a Stan Kenton style ballad.
Vesuvius - The title track mixes Afro-Cuban styles with up tempo swing to create an explosive piece.
Double or Nothing - A tribute to the great spy movie soundtracks of the past, this tune goes between a fast paced straight 8th feel, a sophisticated swing feel, and a light tango.
A Night in Tunisia - Originally in 4/4, this arrangement features a three piece Afro-Cuban percussion section in 9/8.
Spank-A-Lee - This arrangement shares a lot of similarities with the original Herbie Hancock tune released on "Thrust" in the 70's and will feature our guest artist Pat Coil on multiple keyboards.
Samba Juice - A delightfully playful samba that features many different soloists from the band.
The Kitchen Sink - This piece has it all, and you can find just about everything you could want when it comes to Funk in this one. Drew was asked to write the most difficult piece he could for this commission, and it definitely comes across.
Job (Aftermath) - An introspective piece in 5/4 that features our second trombonist Conner Eisenmenger. This piece is based on the biblical character Job and is similar to the Maria Schneider style of big band writing.
Kangaroo Bruise Blues - Named due to Toshi's background in Australia, this piece is an up tempo blues that features almost everyone. Thad Jones' writing style was definitely channeled by Drew when he wrote this composition.
*BONUS TRACK* 
Back at the Chicken Shack - For those that contribute towards one of the multiple packages that include this bonus track that will not be publicly released, you will hear a swinging shuffle blues that features the Organ playing of Pat Coil. Definitely not a tune to be missed!
 

The Impact:

Due to the significant cost associated with making an album of this magnitude, we want you to know that every contribution to this project will make a significant impact to the making of Vesuvius. Every contribution and donation will make this album more professional and improve the end product significantly.

Other Ways You Can Help:

We understand that not everyone can contribute to this crowdfunding campaign, but there are other ways you can help us out. The biggest way is for you to spread the word about this project. We are a big band but even we have limitations to how many people we can tell about this album. If you are able to pass on the details about us then we would be forever grateful!

As this is a huge project we want to thank you for taking the time to read all of the details regarding the Vesuvius album, and hope that we can deliver a product that you will be happy with!
story_txt:

The title of the album comes from the active volcano located in Naples, Italy called Mt. Vesuvius, and the pieces recorded for the album are meant to be a reflection of the awe inspiring power and energy of the great volcano. We hope to provide a full big band album at the highest possible quality.The members of the band come from around the United States and have all studied or are currently studying music at The University of North Texas. We are excited to perform and record this music for you, but in order to do so we are seeking additional funds. Meet the Band:Due to our enormous size of 18 full time and 5 part time members we have a lot of great information about each of them for you to have a look at. story:
Every so often, you meet an individual that changes your entire perspective on life. Jon Sheptock is one of those people. Instead of viewing life through a glass half empty, Jon’s glass positively runneth over.

Though you are initially stunned by his physical disabilities, you are just as amazed by the anointing that God has on his life.

Jon has been through more than any able- bodied person could possibly understand. In his teenage years, he had a particularly hard time knowing where to fit in. It was in those darkest hours, that he began to contemplate suicide. Consumed with hopelessness and paralyzed by fear, he instead turned to the only other available option. He gave his life fully to Christ, and found that with God, anything is possible. 

Jon has had the opportunity to share his testimony with Hundreds of Thousands. He has sung with Bill Gaither, Sang the Anthem at Pro Sporting Events, Wounded Warrior Fundraisers, Military Events, Salvation Army Corps and Many More. He ministers to prisons, schools, churches, foster/adoption events, civic events, conferences Fortune 500 Companies and more. He is also the Lead Singer of the band “One Percenters”. It is an ever growing prison ministry that he is very proud to be apart of. It has truly changed thousands of Men's lives who feel they live in a hopeless world.

Through Christ, there seems to be nothing that Jon can’t do. With his family, Jon continues to live life to the fullest. The motto of his ministry is “Making Life's Challenges – God's Victories” and this is also the emphasis for his success.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The money that is raised will finalize the project that I have been working on for years. 
  • You will receive Jon's First CD, AND the Newest Project entitled "I Surrender"

story:
Hello, friends!

We are Urbanisteria band, and we have very good news for you!

Two years have passed since our first album was released: https://goo.gl/PBCd9v

We visited different cities, performed at many venues in our country and abroad, managed to be support band for such cool bands as P.O.D., Limp Bizkit, Billy Talent, Shinedown, A Day to Remember. Having finished last year with a big solo show in St. Petersburg, we decided it’s time to get to work and record the second album. During that time we’ve just had a lot of new tracks, so they have to see the light of day.

The exact schedule of studio sessions has been already made up. We will devote the half of summer to recording our second album at D.Gray studio in order to present it at one of the best St. Petersburg music venue in autumn. We hope you want it too.

This message is addressed to each of you, who loves our creativity and is partial to what we do.

What We Need & What You Get

The recording is no easy task and here, more than ever before, we need your support. What is required is money for studio time for recording and mixing our new material.

We invite you to be a part of our crew, be a part of Urbanisteria and help us to turn our idea into a quality product. Becoming the participant of our project, you give us an opportunity to develop, go on and surprise you with our creativity more and more.

In return we offer you interesting perks.

NB! every perk includes shipping to any country.

Budget

Where your money goes:

  • Studio time (70 hours) – 1 300 $ 
  • Sound engineer’s fees (recording) – 1 100 $ 
  • Mixing & mastering – 1 250 $ 
  • Subtotal – 3 650 $ 
  • IndieGoGo fees (5% + approx 4% for transferring money = approx 9%) – approx 350 $ 
  • Total – 4 000 $

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute there are other ways you can help us:

  • Share the campaign on your social media channels, the Indiegogo share tools are great for this.
  • Tell your friends about the campaign, and ask them to spread the word too.

Be with us, be a part of our crew, and we’ll cope with any tasks together.

Stay True! Stay Urbanisteria!

__________________________________________________________________________

Привет, друзья!

Мы группа Urbanisteria, и у нас для вас очень хорошие новости!

Прошло два года, как вышел наш первый альбом: https://soundcloud.com/urbanisteria

Мы побывали в разных городах, выступили на многих площадках страны и зарубежья, успели открыть концерты чертовски крутых команд: P.O.D., Limp Bizkit, Billy Talent, Shinedown, A Day to Remember.  Завершив прошлый год большим сольным концертом в Санкт-Петербурге, мы решили, что пришло время садиться за новый материал и записывать второй альбом. За это время у нас накопилось много новых треков, они должны увидеть свет.

Уже составлен точный график студийных сессий — половину лета мы посвятим записи нашей второй пластинки в студии D.Gray, чтобы осенью презентовать ее на одной из лучших площадок Санкт-Петербурга. Надеемся, вы этого хотите тоже.

Это обращение адресовано каждому из вас. Тому, кто любит наше творчество, кто неравнодушен ко всему, что мы делаем.

Что нам нужно и что вы приобретёте

Процесс записи альбома довольно непростая задача, и здесь, как никогда, потребуется ваша помощь. Все, что нам требуется, — это средства на аренду студии для записи нового материала и его сведения.

Мы предлагаем вам стать частью нашей команды, стать частью Urbanisteria и помочь нам воплотить нашу идею в готовый качественный продукт. Становясь участником нашего проекта, вы дарите нам возможность развиваться, идти вперед и радовать вас своим творчеством все больше и больше.

Взамен мы предлагаем вам интересные вознаграждения.

NB! любое вознаграждение включает в себя отправку в любую страну.

Бюджет

Представляем вам нашу смету:

  • Студийное время (70 ч) – 1 300 $
  • Работа звукорежиссера (запись) – 1 100 $
  • Сведение  и мастеринг – 1 250 $
  • Итого – 3 650 $ 
  • % IndieGoGo (5% + примерно 4% за перевод денег – примерно 9%) – 350 $
  • Всего – 4 000 $

Как ещё вы можете помочь

Вы также очень поможете нам:

  • Поделившись этой кампанией в своих профилях в социальных сетях, воспользовавшись инструментами для репоста на Indiegogo;
  • Рассказав друзьям о нашей кампании и попросив их распространить информацию.

Будьте с нами, будьте нашей командой, тогда мы вместе справимся с любыми задачами.

Stay True! Stay Urbanisteria!

story:
Short Summary

I’m Brandon Patrick George. Originally born in Ohio, I moved to New York City almost ten years ago. I had a crazy idea to move to New York and to forge my own path as a flutist. Maybe it’s working. I’ve performed recitals and chamber music concerts at leading concert halls including Alice Tully Hall, the Kennedy Center, Cité de la Musique, and Bargemusic. As an ensemble player, I’ve performed with one of our country’s great symphonies— the Pittsburgh Symphony Orchestra—and with the International Contemporary Ensemble (ICE) in Chicago and in England at the Huddersfield Contemporary Music Festival. All of which have been critically acclaimed by the press including mentions by the New York Times, The New Yorker, and Chicago Tribune.

My interest in music in extends from early to contemporary classical music. This debut album is a tapestry of my wide range of performance work, featuring compositions by musical giants including J.S. Bach, Pierre Boulez, and Sergei Prokofiev, and introducing a new, solo work by the living, Finnish composer Kalevi Aho.

The instruments, too, are a mosaic of old and new: among them is a new, modern flute, yet made from wood; and an historic 1939 platinum flute intended to broaden the possibilities of the instrument for future generations. 

This album honors American craftsmanship and legacy. Powell Flute’s first platinum instrument, commissioned for the 1939 World’s Fair, is featured on this recording.

Other Powell instruments will be used on this recording, including a modern flute made of grenadilla wood.

 

 

What I Need & What You Get

Your contributions will help with the costs for studio time, the recording engineer, videographers, producers, photographers, graphic designers, and for the stellar musical collaborators joining me on the album. All of this will ensure that I can hand over a master copy to a record label for post-production and worldwide distribution. The label will take over from there.

This album needs $10,000.00 for it to become a finished product.

In return for contributing to my debut album, you will receive updates in the form of a behind-the-scenes look at the process with audio and video tours; a postcard, a thank you letter, a digital download of the album, a disc of the album, tickets to the album release, and even a private concert featuring music from the album, depending on the level at which you are able to give.

If 100% of the goal is not met, the monies will be used to compensate all the professionals who will be working with and collaborating with me on the project. But the full $10,000.00 guarantees the album.

It is my responsibility to hand over as much of a finished product as possible to the record label to ensure production and distribution.

 

The Impact

Recordings are essential for independent artists.

People are listening to music more now than ever. However, it still takes resources to make the same great music that today’s listeners find through streaming services, instead of a brick and mortar music shop.

This album also honors American craftsmanship and legacy. Verne Q. Powell Flutes, Inc., in Boston, began making flutes in 1927. Powell’s excellence in flute making earned him the responsibility of creating #365: the firm’s very first platinum flute commissioned for the 1939 World’s Fair—an instrument that is featured on this recording. Your contribution to the successful production of this album allows history to be made: #365 will, by virtue of the instrument’s historicity, be a universal, archival landmark for the future.

 

Risks & Challenges

Because I anticipate working with a European label, there may be a delay in the release of this album. Although I am hoping to release by Fall 2017, I ask for your patience should that not be the case. Release dates are determined by the label.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re unable to give at any of the suggested levels here, please know that I would be grateful for anything you’re able to do at this time.

If you can’t help at all financially, I ask you to please tell your friends, share my project on social media (use the Indiegogo share tools!), and send me good thoughts!

This project is a huge undertaking for me, and I am grateful for everyone’s help and support in whatever way possible. One can’t go it alone—it takes a team to see success.

 

Thank you!

BPG
