This debut album is a tapestry of my wide range of performance work, featuring compositions by musical giants including J.S. Bach, Pierre Boulez, and Sergei Prokofiev, and introducing a new, solo work by the living, Finnish composer Kalevi Aho.
The instruments, too, are a mosaic of old and new: among them is a new, modern flute, yet made from wood; and an historic 1939 platinum flute intended to broaden the possibilities of the instrument for future generations. 
This album honors American craftsmanship and legacy. Powell Flute’s first platinum instrument, commissioned for the 1939 World’s Fair, is featured on this recording.
Other Powell instruments will be used on this recording, including a modern flute made of grenadilla wood.
 

 
What I Need & What You Get

Your contributions will help with the costs for studio time, the recording engineer, videographers, producers, photographers, graphic designers, and for the stellar musical collaborators joining me on the album. All of this will ensure that I can hand over a master copy to a record label for post-production and worldwide distribution. The label will take over from there.
This album needs $10,000.00 for it to become a finished product.
In return for contributing to my debut album, you will receive updates in the form of a behind-the-scenes look at the process with audio and video tours; a postcard, a thank you letter, a digital download of the album, a disc of the album, tickets to the album release, and even a private concert featuring music from the album, depending on the level at which you are able to give.
If 100% of the goal is not met, the monies will be used to compensate all the professionals who will be working with and collaborating with me on the project. But the full $10,000.00 guarantees the album.
It is my responsibility to hand over as much of a finished product as possible to the record label to ensure production and distribution.

 
The Impact
Recordings are essential for independent artists.
People are listening to music more now than ever. However, it still takes resources to make the same great music that today’s listeners find through streaming services, instead of a brick and mortar music shop.
This album also honors American craftsmanship and legacy. Verne Q. Powell Flutes, Inc., in Boston, began making flutes in 1927. Powell’s excellence in flute making earned him the responsibility of creating #365: the firm’s very first platinum flute commissioned for the 1939 World’s Fair—an instrument that is featured on this recording. Your contribution to the successful production of this album allows history to be made: #365 will, by virtue of the instrument’s historicity, be a universal, archival landmark for the future.


 
Risks & Challenges
Because I anticipate working with a European label, there may be a delay in the release of this album. Although I am hoping to release by Fall 2017, I ask for your patience should that not be the case. Release dates are determined by the label.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you’re unable to give at any of the suggested levels here, please know that I would be grateful for anything you’re able to do at this time.
If you can’t help at all financially, I ask you to please tell your friends, share my project on social media (use the Indiegogo share tools!), and send me good thoughts!
This project is a huge undertaking for me, and I am grateful for everyone’s help and support in whatever way possible. One can’t go it alone—it takes a team to see success. Thank you!
BPG

story:
Aloha Friends, Family (Ohana) and Curious Newcomers,  

We are Dirty Roots & Soul Redemption (Melchizedek & Moroni), brothers from Wainaku, Hilo, Hawai'i, also known as "Moku O Keawe".    

My brother and I compose music that expresses our lifestyle, spirit, culture, and political stance.   We have been performing our music throughout Hawai'i and the U.S. for the past 15 years. Together we believe in music’s ability to empower and unite all under one love, understanding, and collective consciousness.

We would like to extend how grateful we are for all of the support throughout our musical journey thus far.   At times it can be overwhelming and is always deeply inspiring. We are continually humbled by the number of people reaching out with kind words, shared stories, and offers of support.

We feel incredibly blessed to be able to live a life supported by our art and passions. Thank you so much to each and every one of you for coming out to our concerts, singing along, supporting this music and spreading it's message far and wide!

NEW ALBUM

We have been hearing your call for fresh recordings and are actively empowered to bring you the collaborations of Dirty Roots & Soul Redemption in 2018.  Our first Joined studio album, a collection of original roots music, to be released in our very own home town Hilo, Hawaii.

For us, the meaning of this album is our culture.  This opportunity aligns us with so many dreams built and felt in our heart and soul.   We aim to live pono and our vision is to be the example of our ancestral and cultural roots…  striving to give power and voice to the voiceless while inspiring future generations.

 

What We Need & What You Will Receive

Our goal is to complete this album while maintaining freedom as independent artists with a passionate drive to use music as a tool for social change, education, community engagement and upliftment. In order to accomplish this, keep out of debt and stay connected to the people and places that have grown this music from the very beginning, we are asking for your help in raising $30,000.

 Your generous contributions will support:

- Professional studio recording 

- Mixing

- Mastering

- Sustainable CD Production

- Compensation of our contributing musicians and team 

- Support of Hawaiian Culture through local organizations

- Supporting Local Hawaiian business for album production

- Anything above and beyond will help support more sustainable tour travel and outreach work

We are excited to engage with YOU through this platform to support the creation of this album and the greater vision of song in a creative and sustainable way.

 

Impact

Your contribution will cover recycled (and local!) CD packaging, production, and the cost of getting this music out through sustainable tour planning, graphic design, promotion and an updated website to help us stay connected with you. In pledging support for this project you are also contributing to helping us continue to broaden our work with indigenous empowerment and environmental organizations.

Through our production process we are partnering with Hawai'i Original: 808 Empire to create the Custom, Organic, Dirty Roots & Soul Redemption Clothing Line. We are also working with Hawaii's very own Prime Footage and local Hawaiian artists for our new Graphic Designs.

Ho'okupu - Offerings: The 8 Islands .... Our Offering~ Makana - Giving Back to you~

Hoʻokupu are offerings given as an expression of gratitude, respect, and aloha.

Makana are gifts, to give a gift, or donation.

We will be partnering with "Mokupāpapa Discovery Center", donating $1 of every $5 gifted to the "Archipelago" Ho'okupu perk.  The Mokupāpapa Discovery Center (MDC) was established to interpret the natural science, culture and history of the Northwestern Hawaiian Islands and surrounding marine environment. Creating greater public awareness of the region and ocean conservation issues. https://www.papahanaumokuakea.gov/education/cen...

We will be partnering with "'Aha Pūnana Leo", donating $5 of every $25 gifted to the "Kaho'olawe" Ho'okupu perk.  The ʻAha Pūnana Leo is a Native Hawaiian nonprofit with a vision of “E Ola Ka ʻŌlelo Hawaiʻi” (The Hawaiian Language Shall Live) and a mission to revitalize the Hawaiian language as a living language in Hawaiʻi and beyond.  From pre-school to youth programs, Aha Punana Leo is creating a supportive environment to communicate effectively while preserving the Hawaiian language through generations to come.  http://www.ahapunanaleo.org

We will be partnering with Hilo’s "Hui Makahiki o Hanakahi", donating 10% of all funds gifted to the "Lāna'i" Ho'okupu perk for local food and Hawaiian games at this cultural event. Plus, Soul Redemption & Dirty Roots will be playing solo and full band sets at the Makahiki event in November. 

Makahiki is a ancient Hawaiian festival, in honor of the god Lono. The focus of the season is a celebration of the bounty of the land.  The Makahiki continues the tradition of Hawaiian games, helping warriors stay active, and also servs as training and practice showcasing the mental and physical strength of the contestants.  Makahiki features hula dancers, traditional arts and crafts workshops, competitions, music and food. 

We will also partner with “808 Empire”, donating 8% of all funds gifted to the "Moloka'i" Ho'okupu perk for keeping it local, supporting local business efforts, supporting local talent, and their exposure outlets; magazine, concerts/events, online interviews, and business guidance.  Plus Dirty Roots & Soul Redemption will play for  an “808 Empire” event on the big island.  http://www.808empire.com

We will also partner with “ASEDA”, donating 5% of all funds gifted to the "Kaua'i" Ho'okupu perk for sustainable co-op efforts, working with Dogomba tribes of Ghana Africa, as well as new product development.  ASEDA serves as an empowering business model to preserve indigenous cultures and sustain a healthy balance with the land and indigenous tribes. http://asedarawhoney.com

Please note that you may donate any amount by clicking the "Back It"  link.  ~Backing us on this campaign~  

PERK DISCLOSURES:

* $1,000 - Acoustic session only available in HI

** $5,000 - Must be in the US or on tour path: Acoustic session and appearing in music video

*** $10,000 - Must be in the US or on our tour path: Full band session and Appearing music video

**** Acoustic & full band sessions will require recipients coordination for venue, transportation (timely rides to and from airport, venue, and housing) and lodging.  Flights are provided as part of the Perk.

***** Performance dates to be determined upon campaign completion.

 

Challenges

It has been deeply humbling to see what it actually costs to bring this music into your hands and for our voice to reach where it is most needed. We are committed to offering art that will stand the test of time, be authentic to voice, vision and tradition. 

Along with creating an album to inspire future generations, our hope is to utilize the privilege of being passionate and skillful musicians to awaken and inspire hearts. Using music as the powerful unifying force it is intended to be, we intend to leverage the success of this album, our tour, and our music to continue our work with organizations protecting the rights of indigenous peoples and those working to protect the rights of our precious waters and lands.

"Ua Mau Ke Ea O Ka Aina Ika Pono"

(The Life of the Land Is Perpetuated In Righteousness)

 

Our journey with Roots Reggae & Hawaiian Traditions began many years ago......... 

Growing up in Hilo Hawaii as children of Hawaiian ancestry, we have longed to know the songs, rituals and rites of our culture and ancestors. The ways in which these strong men and women honored the earth and how they celebrated the passage of the cycles of life and of the land. This longing fed our heart, soul and spirit and became an unquestionable calling that has led us on this life journey to create songs of the people and of the land. 

Ancestry and culture tap us into our indigenous roots and reawakens the understanding that each one of us is a part of a living and breathing whole. We live in a time where it is too easy to forget that we belong to the land that gives us life, and not the other way around.

 

The Musicians of Dirty Roots & Soul Redemption!

Vocals: Moroni (Molonai) Naho'oikaika-Holoholokulani, Melchizedek (Kaleio) Navarro

Guitar: Moroni (Molonai) Naho'oikaika-Holoholokulani

Drums: Ross Wamar

Harmony Vocals: Moroni (Molonai) Naho'oikaika-Holoholokulani, Melchizedek (Kaleio) Navarro

Bass: Paul Battad

Keys: Shay Panela

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign~

Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Vimeo 

Email

Word of Mouth

Youtube : https://www.youtube.com/user/dirtyrootsband/videos

Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/dirtyrootssouldremptio...

Twitter : https://twitter.com/soulredemption 

Website: https://www.dirtyroots-soulredemption.com

 

Now is the time when music depends on our connection to the land and one another.  May this music serve as a guide as we grow and care for this land and one another.

Our roots are our connection to the natural world & music is essential to healing.

~ One Love~

 

Melchizedek & Moroni

DR/SR

...a indie rock band from Athens Greece and we releasing our first self-produced album. In the process of recording the album and preparing our videos many people helped us and we want to return something back to them.

Members 

Aris Siafas / Voice

Distribution

and prepare our videos

Our love!

story:
Hello You ! :)

My name is Clotilde Solange Arzu, and I am a singer-songwriter currently living in Lithuania (but born & raised in the South of France.. :) )

I've been dreaming of recording my songs for a long time, and I am so delighted to finally take a flight, and make it come to reality!

The material is ready, the musicians are waiting -- this Indiegogo campaign is the final step toward creating my first-ever professionally produced studio album.

The project

Tenderness, tenderness, tenderness is music. Back home.. where the mystery of your heart unfolds. 

It would not be a surprise off course if I would say music is my passion since childhood. Singing is healing me, and always did. Music has always been there - it is my sacred place. After each singing moment, whether it is simply around a bonfire or a concert stage, when I see so many shining eyes thanking me from within after having deeply felt a connection, then I know even deeper why I feel the need to share my songs to You.

I want to share that profound & magic power music has, through daily & simple stories we all go through. To give a voice to those stories, and music to give them a beautiful meaning. To find back something from deep within, that feeling where you are back home, in your heart. I truly believe music makes us feel back from where we truly are - and heals our scars :) 

That's why this project is so dear to me, and I can't wait to share my songs to You.

Your contribution

I have wanted to record my songs for the last five years, but always had financial limits constraining me, and did not enable me to record any of my craft. Today, I have decided to launch this campaign to raise funds for my debut album, after having found a great studio and collaborator to properly work on my music (the sound-engineer and producer Artūras Bieliauskas and his studio "Folk Science").

Where the money goes

The funds raised will cover the following : 

* The recording, mixing and mastering sessions of 9 songs (1000eur)

* One music video with professional film crew (800eur)

* CD copies (200eur)

For You

I am so appreciative and grateful for any support you can lend to this campaign. In exchange for your generosity (seriously, THANK YOU!), I've put together a really exciting group of rewards that are available exclusively through your participation in this campaign. 

Check it out below! Digital downloads, signed drafts, a songwriting session or a private performance, and even a guest producer credit on the album!

THANK YOU ! :))) 

Thanks so so so much from the deepest of my heart for checking my campaign. Hopefully we meet soon, in music.

With Love,

Clotilde Solange Arzu.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Dr. Henry Darragh, (aka 'Doc Loc'), and I'm from Pasadena, Texas. I grew up listening to hip-hop and became a professional (mostly jazz) musician in 1994. My love of Houston rap and big band jazz is the driving force behind Doc Loc and the Swangers.

After releasing "Draped Up" and "Sittin' Sidewayz" (feat. Paul Wall and Big Pokey) last summer (and with the help of friends and a grant from Houston Arts Alliance), we produced six more Southside Classics. I began this dream of an idea in 2013 and this concert will be the celebration of all the work that's gone into the project.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need the funds to pay the band for rehearsal, for the show, and the venue rental.
  • For supporting the campaign, we have the downloads to send pre-street release date, concert tickets, t-shirts, and even a possible music lesson with me (Dr. Henry Darragh)
  • All of the funds will go towards paying the musicians and covering the cost of the venue. The show will go on somehow if the funds are not all raised.

The Impact

My project is a valuable representation of classic Houston hip-hop performed by big band for the first time, however, one doesn't have to like rap or jazz to appreciate the music.

Risks & Challenges

The hurdles I have to achieve my goal are actually small. I have a rehearsal to schedule (of 15 musicians) and I have the obstacle of getting the funds to pay them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot help financially would you consider helping get the word out and make some noise about my campaign? Indiegogo has super convienent share tools!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hi! I'm Dr. Henry Darragh, (aka 'Doc Loc'), and I'm from Pasadena, Texas. I grew up listening to hip-hop and became a professional (mostly jazz) musician in 1994. My love of Houston rap and big band jazz is the driving force behind Doc Loc and the Swangers.
After releasing "Draped Up" and "Sittin' Sidewayz" (feat. Paul Wall and Big Pokey) last summer (and with the help of friends and a grant from Houston Arts Alliance), we produced six more Southside Classics. I began this dream of an idea in 2013 and this concert will be the celebration of all the work that's gone into the project.

What We Need & What You Get

I need the funds to pay the band for rehearsal, for the show, and the venue rental.
For supporting the campaign, we have the downloads to send pre-street release date, concert tickets, t-shirts, and even a possible music lesson with me (Dr. Henry Darragh)
All of the funds will go towards paying the musicians and covering the cost of the venue. The show will go on somehow if the funds are not all raised.


The Impact
My project is a valuable representation of classic Houston hip-hop performed by big band for the first time, however, one doesn't have to like rap or jazz to appreciate the music.

Risks & Challenges
The hurdles I have to achieve my goal are actually small. I have a rehearsal to schedule (of 15 musicians) and I have the obstacle of getting the funds to pay them.

Other Ways You Can HelpIf you cannot help financially would you consider helping get the word out and make some noise about my campaign? Indiegogo has super convienent share tools!

story:
Who Are We?

This outfit first started off as solo musician, 'Templeton' (whose past bands included Birdhouse, First Black President and The Bends), and morphed into 'Templeton Universe' on this 5th album called 'Between Lies'. We are an independent band (meaning we are not signed/managed and do EVERYTHING ourselves). Get an acoustic taste of what we do below (this song is off our last album, 'Headspace'):

 

Templeton roughed it out alone with his last four albums ('Templeton', 'Boy on Bike', 'Twist' and 'Headspace' — which will ALL be given to you along with the latest album in our 'prestige package') over the last decade.

But, now with the band behind him and more ideas streaming in, we're asking for some help in launching this latest album the right way. This means getting the CD registered (bar code and distribution), getting the CD glass-mastered, design fees for the cover artwork and across-the-board marketing of the album.

Here's a song/video from 'Boy on Bike' called 'On Bended Knee':

 

What You Get

Every single package GUARANTEES you an IMMEDIATE digital download (within 24 hours) of 'Between Lies' BEFORE it gets released (release date set at 1 May 2017) — you get to sample the music before the rest of the world does as well as exclusive updates on what we're trying to achieve (it's a journey we'd LOVE to share with you).

The more you pledge, the more you get and we're offering up to 5 digital albums!

FEEDBACK THAT WE'VE GOT SO FAR VIA THIS CAMPAIGN :)

"Loving this album. Thanks for making it!" ~Joshua (Sydney, Australia) (Joshua upgraded his package to the Prestige Package  and got all 5 of our albums after enjoying the latest album!)

"Been doing my dusting to it!" ~Barbara (Barrydale, South Africa)

" Busy listening to it - fabulous!!" ~Antje (Worcester, South Africa)

"I am enjoying watching your journey" ~Rose (United Kingdom)

"Long live the music!" ~Matt (Seychelles)

Reviews (general):

"The first thing that crossed my mind on hearing the first few bars and vocal introducing itself was " Rufus Wainwright", a vocalist who I hugely admire so that's a good start! The more I listened I could hear other influences, the way the track has been crafted with some great changes had me thinking of the great Jeff Buckley - however, I have to be clear "Templeton (Universe)" is not trying to be anything other than Templeton and this track is a great song,well written and well produced, beautiful vocal, great instrumentation well crafted. In a nutshell it hits all the right buttons and I cant find a single criticism, apart from the fact I think it could have been a bit longer - more like this and the right promotion and we should be seeing him/them getting to the top! It would be a crime for them not to - best thing Iv'e heard coming out of South Africa since Nelson Mandela!!​" ~ Review on N1M ('Jesus in Heavens')

Here's a taste of Mike singing one of the songs off 'Headspace' (our last album):

 

 

What's the Music About?

Glad you asked!

We've dubbed ourselves ambient rock and we're a melting pot of The Beatles/Muse/Zero 7/Radiohead/Rufus Wainwright/Elliot Smith. Our somewhat cheesy tagline is 'Cosmic Music for the Alternative Soul' which pretty much translates to:  boundary pushing sounds for ears that appreciate music driven by spirit, mastered by dedication and fueled with passion.

We love to make and perform music. It's our life.

Our heaviest musical influences were mentioned above but also include Queen, Pink Floyd, David Bowie, RHCP, Sigur Ros, Nirvana, Neil Young, Jeff Buckley, Skunk Anansie, as well as classical composers such as Bach, Debussy, Tchaikovsky and Saint-Saens.

We strive to give back to music what these artists have given to us — the soundtrack of our lives, the jet-fuel in our veins, the sweet remedy to our emotions. 

This latest album takes the listener down that red-pill, rabbit hole of truth, lies and self awakening. As the saying goes, "The truth will set you free but it will piss you off first", well this pretty much sums up the undercurrent of the album.

We're very hot-blooded about current world/political/spiritual/social issues and try to inject our songs with our take on a society gone mad. Our music not only highlights these issues but also reminds us of an ever-present, underlying hope that love will ALWAYS win the day. Other what would the point be, right?

What We Need & Packages on Offer

We have already self-funded the production of the album and it is ready to go out into the big wide world. What we still need help with now is a little extra funding — $1000 to be precise. This is broken down into:

  • Registering the album,
  • Final Cover Design,
  • Glass mastering,
  • Packaging,
  • Marketing the album.

If we don't reach our goal of $1000, we will use the funds to do as much as we can along the lines of registering, designing the cover and advertising the new album. 

Here's the video of our ambient song, 'Lie to the Moon', off our latest album ('Between Lies'):

 

We have 3 exciting packages:

  1. $50 — this gets you an *IMMEDIATE digital download of the new album 'Between Lies' as well as *IMMEDIATE downloads of our 4 albums to date, 'Headspace', 'Twist', 'Boy on Bike' and 'Templeton'. You will also receive exclusive updates of the journey of this albums release and a secret BONUS gift. 
  2. $25 — this gets you an *IMMEDIATE digital download of the new album 'Between Lies' as well as  *IMMEDIATE downloads of our last album, 'Headspace' and 'Boy on Bike'. You will also receive exclusive updates of the journey of this albums release. 
  3. $10 — this gets you an *IMMEDIATE digital download of the new album 'Between Lies'.  You will also receive exclusive updates of the journey of this albums release. 

*Please give us up to 24 hours to process your downloads as they are all done manually.

Catch our lyric video of the first song off the latest album below (a definite Alice-in-Wonderland/Oz feel to it):

 

Your Impact

Funding our campaign will allow us to have a much broader outreach. We believe in the impact our music will have on many like-minded souls and want to infiltrate as far and wide as we can — your contribution will help us immensely to realize this dream. 

Furthermore, we will be organizing more campaigns to take Templeton Universe on a nationwide tour and — with the help of music-loving people like you — even an international tour.

Who knows, one day we may even get to meet you in person at one of our concerts!

Other Ways You Can Help Us

We understand that you may not be in the position to financially back us right now but maybe you still want to help us out? Well, that's easy 'cause Indiegogo has made it a piece of cake to share this campaign with your friends and family. We'd be over-the-moon if you'd help us by sharing our campaign and boosting our potential to attain our goal.

Thank you!

 

 

For more information about TEMPLETON UNIVERSE please visit our site: click HERE.

You can watch some of our video's on YouTube by clicking HERE.

Please follow us on FACEBOOK and TWITTER.

story:
Hi, my name is Sebastiano Dessanay, I am an Italian double bassist and composer based in the UK.

I grew up in an ‘operatic’ family, my granddad was first director of the opera theatre in Cagliari. I was only 10 when he tragically died, but after the loss, my mum started to bring me with her to see operas, mostly Italian (Puccini, Verdi) but not only (I fell asleep during Mozart’s Don Giovanni!). Over the years, I have participated to operas in the children’s choir, as a walk-on, as a double bassist, and finally I took the courage to write my own!

What and Who you are supporting

Between 2011 and 2013 I wrote The Cry of the Double Bass, a contemporary music work, with a beautiful libretto by English writer Mike Carter, celebrating not only my instrument, the double bass, but also a musical genre I am very fond of.

An opera about powerful passions and broken dreams, The Cry of the Double Bass charts a young man’s struggle against outer obstacles and inner demons to answer the call of his soul and realise his lifelong ambition in music. A deep and affecting work that will resonate with people of all ages.

You will discover more about this opera at www.thecryofthedoublebass.co.uk

Visit http://www.tete-a-tete.org.uk/event/the-cry-of-... to buy tickets for the opera's Act 3 premiere! 

On the 10th of August 2017 part of this work will be finally seeing the lights of a theatre for the first time, at the 10th anniversary of the Tête à Tête Festival in London. It will be one of the most important achievements of my artistic and personal life.

By supporting this project you will contribute to fairly reward all the creative team and amazing artists who have agreed to be part of it. But mostly, you will help getting a strong message out there for people of all ages and backgrounds: make your own decisions and follow your heart.

What I have and what I need 

Tête à Tête kindly provides the Studio Theatre at the Royal Academy of Dramatic Arts, a fantastic venue in Central London, and they will carry out a big marketing and advertising campaign, but I need to provide a finished production.

All the funding application we did were unsuccessful, therefore this campaign is the only mean we have to put the performance on. I am asking you to contribute to part of the production costs. Whatever amount we raise, it will be used towards the performance of my work at Tête à Tête Festival 2017.

The Creative and Production Team

This space is dedicated to the amazing collaborators who are going to help me in this adventure. To know more about me there is my website www.sebastianodessanay.com

Writer and theatre director Mike Carter wrote the beautiful libretto of the opera. He is going to be assistant director in this production.

Friend and long time collaborator, choreographer Riccardo Buscarini will provide his artistic vision in directing and choreographing the work.

Daniele Rosina, Director of Orchestral Studies at the University of Birmingham, will be conducting the performers.

Members of Decibel Ensemble, together with Birmingham-based freelance musicians, will constitute the main orchestral forces. With Decibel, a double bass quartet and a double bass soloist will perform on stage. 

The cast consists of two sopranos, a baritone, a bass, an actor and a dancer. Among them, the amazing Themba Mvula as the protagonist as Young Man, and soprano Natalie Raybould ​playing the protagonist as Boy.

Rosie Clements is helping with the production side of things.


 

A breakdown of the costs

- £1,000: pre-production costs (producer fee, piano reduction, parts production and print, website and logo design)

- £1,000: director, conductor, lighting designer fees

- £2,000: performer and singer fees for rehearsals and performance

- £1,000: travel expenses, stationery and contingency.

What you get in return

For your kind support I offer perks such as special mentions in the programmes and social media, free tickets to the Tête à Tête show, copies of my CDs, a bound copy of the opera libretto, a bound copy of the opera score, an exclusive dinner with the creatives behind the project, and the composition of a personalised opera aria with text provided by you!

Other ways you can help

Even if you can't support the project financially, please share this campaign with your friends and contacts! You will help us promoting the message: make your own decisions and follow your heart!

And give us a like on Facebook: 

https://www.facebook.com/crydoublebass/

And follow us on Twitter: 

https://twitter.com/crydoublebass

 

THANKS SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!

story:
Welcome to the Greatest Lives EP Crowdfunding Campaign Welcome to The Greatest Lives EP Crowdfunding Campaign   Welcome to the Greatest Lives EP Crowdfunding Campaign  Welcome to the Greatest

My name is Anne Leighton, and I've been in show business as an artist/businesswoman/writer/career builder/promoter for my entire life since elementary school.  In the late 1990s, Joe Deninzon and I met—first as a journalist covering an artist for The Inside Connection, a music instruction monthly. Within 2 years, I began handling his publicity, and through the decade-- helping with his other career needs. In 2009, I started writing and recording for various friends’ albums, including one, HEALTHY FOOD FOR THOUGHT, which was nominated for a Grammy.

 

In 2015, thanks to $3500 from a crowdfunding campaign, Soul Asylum Poetry/Canada published my poetry book, THE LEIGHTON EXPLOSION, and I did 2 live performances. More to come! 

By 2015, Joe started becoming a rock star in the best sense of the word. He signed a record deal w/ Melodic Revolution Records, had more gigs, and syncs.  He is becoming a big deal in the progressive rock and music sessionist world.  Joe Deninzon & Stratospheerius’ GUILTY OF INNOCENCE album hit the Jamband/Relix charts at # 4, finding airplay in Europe and Spotify without us even running campaigns there.  He opened for John5 at John’s request!

In 2016 on my 60th birthday, Sheer Publishing in South Africa signed me to a songwriting deal.  This company is home to some artists I've championed, plus the song "The Lion Sleeps Tonight."

I went through my song idea box, and found the 1984 cover of The New York Post in which Muhammad Ali announced he had Parkinson’s Disease.  My note on the paper, "What does he want us to know" put me on a path of reconnecting with a Midwest poet/pacifist/boxer that understood the soul of the underdog, worked hard, found humor in most situations.  Muhammad Ali was a role model for me and millions of artists.

The chorus is "The Greatest Lives for the Greatest Lives."  My theme is that “nice guys finish together,” and that is a wave being put forth by more people nowadays. Joe's vision in the song is supporting civil rights, Black Lives Matter, equality, "Never Say Die," "Come on, People, smile on your brother. Everybody get together..."

Songwriting with Joe, a blissful journey, included getting to know musicians that also inspire the world.   Drummer Carmine Appice influenced me in artistic and business ways, because he has a great one-on-one connection with people.  Keyboardist Jeremy Beck has spiritual touch on Hammond B3 and acoustic pianos.  Thembeka Mnguni is a singer that I discovered listening to the South African TV version of The Voice.  She reminds me of Cissy Houston, Mavis Staples, Etta James, with gestures kind of like Bobby Darin's! She is a mother that is fighting for her autistic son and surviving life after an abusive relationship. It’s an honor to have her interpret the practical wisdom of so many people’s hero.

Mission Statement

I want “The Greatest Lives” to be heard. My focus are media outlets in sports, Louisville, and music.  In addition to sending out press releases, I do one-on-one pitches and follow ups to as many journalists and radio personalities, as possible.  

Listen to "The Greatest Links" at https://soundcloud.com/leightonmedia/the-greatest-lives-with-band

What We Need

A minimum of $4000 will expedite two things: the pressing of the song as a CD for crowdfunders and relevant media, plus offer the financial support for me to work this project as a priority between now and end of January.    

What I Offer   

1)     The first thing I offer is this song.  And I come offering rewards--digital files from Joe and me.  Our favorite writings, recorded songs. Physical books, swag, new work-in-progress, and a new piece of merch-- a USB stick called "the Leighton Inclusion."  

2)     I offer sweat equity, because "The Greatest Lives” will be marketed to more media. The song’s message is about NOT looking down on those that look up to me AND about focusing on doing actual great things that develop character. 

The Impact of The Greatest Lives

The lyrics of the song give insight on Ali's character, and his philosophies that generate love and support of our fellow human beings.  I took songs and themes from interviews he did.  My co-writer Joe Deninzon added his feelings about equality, including reflections on our current battles in civil rights and respect for one another. The musical performances are inspiring.    

If I raise $1000 more, I’ll hire a dentist to get my smile ready for my close-up. After that, if we get $3000 to $5000 more, we will create a music video for either June 2020 or for January 2021.  $2000 will get it a video campaign.  

More money will be for more recording.  My voice as a writer is about love, freedom, gratitude….  I recently reconnected with the first good song I wrote.  I did it in the 9th Grade, and the song was about the Underground Railroad; it won first place for the Daughters of American Songwriting Contest that year.

Risks & Challenges

I think the main challenge I have in getting my work done is if I die before I can do as much as I can, including get this song heard.     

Also, for the crowdfunder that orders perks that are physical product, we add postage onto your financial pledge.  It's around $4 for each US send out, and $10 for each international mailing.

Other Ways You Can Help  

I know—firsthand—that we can’t always contribute to crowdfunding campaigns.  Over the past two years I've reigned in my donations, because of the amount of money I've spent in creating my goal of these songs.  

I hope that my friends will think of their buddies that love Muhammad Ali's message, and turn them on to this song and campaign. My understanding is there are almost 7.8 billion people on Earth.  Spread the word, and I hope they can enjoy the song!

 Quotes:

“She’s very good.” (regarding Thembeka's singing)    
-Harris Allen, WFAN Sports Radio -New York

“Outstanding. Yes, it has all the elements to go R&B, Urban AC and Gospel. Strong message, well produced, and the vocals are great. I can hear this song on all Urban and R&B stations.”

-Spider Harrison, WLAC-Nashville  (Hippie Radio)

“I remember when most music had lyrics of hope and brotherhood. Nice to bring some of that back!"

-Carter Alan, WZLX-Classic Rock-Boston

"Great Chorus"

-Terry Ellis, Founder The Chrysalis Orchestra, co-founder Chrysalis Records

 

The Greatest Lives

I won’t look down on those
that look up to me
we all wanna shine bright 
but sometimes there’s reason to fight

It’s always the season
to fight for equality
Some may hate what we achieve
but we got reason to believe

CHORUS: The Greatest lives for the greatest lives
there’s light and there’s fight in your inner child
The Greatest lives for the greatest lives
To face all our fears and to Never Say Die

Character matters 
and strong action make us masters 
Ali says Protect them
so they won’t be suffering.  
  
Sometimes we feel alone
Because others just don’t know 
Raise up your fist
and find our courage to resist

CHORUS: The Greatest lives for the greatest lives
There’s light and there is fight in our inner child!
The Greatest lives for the greatest lives
To face all our fears and to never say die

BRIDGE: And even though you feel like screaming
at all the hatred in this world
It’s so surreal you must be dreaming
It’s time to let your love unfurl

Repeat chorus twice 
Once you can substitute “your” inner child for “our” inner child

© 2019 Joe Deninzon (FiddleFunk Music) and Anne Leighton (Sheer Publishing)
All Rights Reserved

THE GREATEST LIVES
Lead Vocals, background harmonies: Thembeka Mnguni
Jeremy Beck: piano and Hammond B3
Carmine Appice: drums
Joe Deninzon: Producer, background vocals, additional percussion, co-writer
Anne Leighton: Assistant Producer, co-writer
Dale Wardell: Durban Engineer
Sequoia Duncan: Durban assistant
Jz Barrell: Drums Engineer
Alex Salzman: Mix
Fred Kevorkian: Mastering
Arie Monroe: Art Work

Studios: the Deninzoo-Dumont, NJ ; Randyland-Manhasset, NY; AudioSuite-Durban, SA

Published by Sheer Music Publishing (Leighton) and Fiddlefunk Music (Deninzon)
Contact: Sheer Publishing: info@sheer.co.za, + 27 11 438-7000
JDeninzo@gmail.com and Anne@AnneLeighton.com
story_txt: Welcome to the Greatest Lives EP Crowdfunding Campaign Welcome to The Greatest Lives EP Crowdfunding Campaign   Welcome to the Greatest Lives EP Crowdfunding Campaign  Welcome to the GreatestMy name is Anne Leighton, and I've been in show business as an artist/businesswoman/writer/career builder/promoter for my entire life since elementary school.  In the late 1990s, Joe Deninzon and I met—first as a journalist covering an artist for The Inside Connection, a music instruction monthly. Within 2 years, I began handling his publicity, and through the decade-- helping with his other career needs. In 2009, I started writing and recording for various friends’ albums, including one, HEALTHY FOOD FOR THOUGHT, which was nominated for a Grammy. In 2015, thanks to $3500 from a crowdfunding campaign, Soul Asylum Poetry/Canada published my poetry book, THE LEIGHTON EXPLOSION, and I did 2 live performances. More to come! By 2015, Joe started becoming a rock star in the best sense of the word. He signed a record deal w/ Melodic Revolution Records, had more gigs, and syncs.  He is becoming a big deal in the progressive rock and music sessionist world.  Joe Deninzon & Stratospheerius’ GUILTY OF INNOCENCE album hit the Jamband/Relix charts at # 4, finding airplay in Europe and Spotify without us even running campaigns there.  He opened for John5 at John’s request! In 2016 on my 60th birthday, Sheer Publishing in South Africa signed me to a songwriting deal.  This company is home to some artists I've championed, plus the song "The Lion Sleeps Tonight."I went through my song idea box, and found the 1984 cover of The New York Post in which Muhammad Ali announced he had Parkinson’s Disease.  My note on the paper, "What does he want us to know" put me on a path of reconnecting with a Midwest poet/pacifist/boxer that understood the soul of the underdog, worked hard, found humor in most situations.  Muhammad Ali was a role model for me and millions of artists.The chorus is "The Greatest Lives for the Greatest Lives."  My theme is that “nice guys finish together,” and that is a wave being put forth by more people nowadays. Joe's vision in the song is supporting civil rights, Black Lives Matter, equality, "Never Say Die," "Come on, People, smile on your brother. Everybody get together..."Songwriting with Joe, a blissful journey, included getting to know musicians that also inspire the world.   Drummer Carmine Appice influenced me in artistic and business ways, because he has a great one-on-one connection with people.  Keyboardist Jeremy Beck has spiritual touch on Hammond B3 and acoustic pianos.  Thembeka Mnguni is a singer that I discovered listening to the South African TV version of The Voice.  She reminds me of Cissy Houston, Mavis Staples, Etta James, with gestures kind of like Bobby Darin's! She is a mother that is fighting for her autistic son and surviving life after an abusive relationship. It’s an honor to have her interpret the practical wisdom of so many people’s hero.Mission StatementI want “The Greatest Lives” to be heard. My focus are media outlets in sports, Louisville, and music.  In addition to sending out press releases, I do one-on-one pitches and follow ups to as many journalists and radio personalities, as possible.  Listen to "The Greatest Links" at https://soundcloud.com/leightonmedia/the-greatest-lives-with-bandWhat We NeedA minimum of $4000 will expedite two things: the pressing of the song as a CD for crowdfunders and relevant media, plus offer the financial support for me to work this project as a priority between now and end of January.    What I Offer   1)     The first thing I offer is this song.  And I come offering rewards--digital files from Joe and me.  Our favorite writings, recorded songs. Physical books, swag, new work-in-progress, and a new piece of merch-- a USB stick called "the Leighton Inclusion."  2)     I offer sweat equity, because "The Greatest Lives” will be marketed to more media. The song’s message is about NOT looking down on those that look up to me AND about focusing on doing actual great things that develop character.  The Impact of The Greatest LivesThe lyrics of the song give insight on Ali's character, and his philosophies that generate love and support of our fellow human beings.  I took songs and themes from interviews he did.  My co-writer Joe Deninzon added his feelings about equality, including reflections on our current battles in civil rights and respect for one another. The musical performances are inspiring.    If I raise $1000 more, I’ll hire a dentist to get my smile ready for my close-up. After that, if we get $3000 to $5000 more, we will create a music video for either June 2020 or for January 2021.  $2000 will get it a video campaign.   More money will be for more recording.  My voice as a writer is about love, freedom, gratitude….  I recently reconnected with the first good song I wrote.  I did it in the 9th Grade, and the song was about the Underground Railroad; it won first place for the Daughters of American Songwriting Contest that year.Risks & ChallengesI think the main challenge I have in getting my work done is if I die before I can do as much as I can, including get this song heard.     Also, for the crowdfunder that orders perks that are physical product, we add postage onto your financial pledge.  It's around $4 for each US send out, and $10 for each international mailing.Other Ways You Can Help  I know—firsthand—that we can’t always contribute to crowdfunding campaigns.  Over the past two years I've reigned in my donations, because of the amount of money I've spent in creating my goal of these songs.  I hope that my friends will think of their buddies that love Muhammad Ali's message, and turn them on to this song and campaign. My understanding is there are almost 7.8 billion people on Earth.  Spread the word, and I hope they can enjoy the song! Quotes:“She’s very good.” (regarding Thembeka's singing)    -Harris Allen, WFAN Sports Radio -New York“Outstanding. Yes, it has all the elements to go R&B, Urban AC and Gospel. Strong message, well produced, and the vocals are great. I can hear this song on all Urban and R&B stations.”-Spider Harrison, WLAC-Nashville  (Hippie Radio)“I remember when most music had lyrics of hope and brotherhood. Nice to bring some of that back!"-Carter Alan, WZLX-Classic Rock-Boston"Great Chorus" -Terry Ellis, Founder The Chrysalis Orchestra, co-founder Chrysalis Records The Greatest LivesI won’t look down on thosethat look up to mewe all wanna shine bright but sometimes there’s reason to fightIt’s always the seasonto fight for equalitySome may hate what we achievebut we got reason to believeCHORUS: The Greatest lives for the greatest livesthere’s light and there’s fight in your inner childThe Greatest lives for the greatest livesTo face all our fears and to Never Say DieCharacter matters and strong action make us masters Ali says Protect themso they won’t be suffering.    Sometimes we feel aloneBecause others just don’t know Raise up your fistand find our courage to resistCHORUS: The Greatest lives for the greatest livesThere’s light and there is fight in our inner child!The Greatest lives for the greatest livesTo face all our fears and to never say dieBRIDGE: And even though you feel like screamingat all the hatred in this worldIt’s so surreal you must be dreamingIt’s time to let your love unfurlRepeat chorus twice Once you can substitute “your” inner child for “our” inner child© 2019 Joe Deninzon (FiddleFunk Music) and Anne Leighton (Sheer Publishing)All Rights ReservedTHE GREATEST LIVESLead Vocals, background harmonies: Thembeka MnguniJeremy Beck: piano and Hammond B3Carmine Appice: drumsJoe Deninzon: Producer, background vocals, additional percussion, co-writerAnne Leighton: Assistant Producer, co-writerDale Wardell: Durban EngineerSequoia Duncan: Durban assistantJz Barrell: Drums EngineerAlex Salzman: MixFred Kevorkian: MasteringArie Monroe: Art WorkStudios: the Deninzoo-Dumont, NJ ; Randyland-Manhasset, NY; AudioSuite-Durban, SAPublished by Sheer Music Publishing (Leighton) and Fiddlefunk Music (Deninzon)Contact: Sheer Publishing: info@sheer.co.za, + 27 11 438-7000JDeninzo@gmail.com and Anne@AnneLeighton.com

story:
Howdy-doo!

On the off chance you happened upon this page without knowing me, hello there! I am an independent singer-songwriter, and I am in the process of making my third album. As I mentioned above, it has been over six years since I first started recording this album, and boy has a lot happened since then. 

There has been starting a farm and reconnections and new friends. There has been love and moving a million times and heavy metal poisoning. There have been family illness and adventures and identity questions turned crises and going back to school. Through it all there has been this album changing along with me.  A lot of the songs that were on the album in 2013 are not there anymore. But I think what’s in its place is deeper and better. In some ways it feels less like an album and more like a soundtrack to the last six years of my life.

I am so excited/relieved/happy/many other emotions to have it so close to done. That being said, due to many studio hours and a crazy year of health (re: heavy metal poisoning), I am so close and yet, still so far away!

What this baby needs

Here’s the deal peeps: All the recording is complete. Here are the final tasks I am trying to finish up!

  • Final edits
  • Mastering
  • Replication
  • Digital downloads
  • Hopefully playing some shows in the PAC west!

Other Ways You Can Help

As someone who hasn't been to the dentist in a length of time I am choosing not to disclose so that you won't judge my hygiene, I understand completely if you are not in a position to give $. Sometimes you just don’t have it, and if you did, you’d go to the goshdang dentist! However, you can still help out if you are so inclined!

  • If you can share the word that I have a new album coming out, that would be amazing!
  • If you can share the word that I have an Indiegogo campaign right now, that would be amazing!
  • If you know of people who live in cities I will be going to play in and could give them a heads up, or have them get updates via my socials, that would be amazing!
  • If you would consider signing up for email updates, that would be amazing!
  • If you would consider using the Indiegogo share tools, that would be amazing!

MANY MANY MANY THANKS!  So many of you have helped in so many ways in the last 6 years. If you are on this page and read this far, I APPRECIATE YOU AND YOUR TIME SO MUCH. THANK YOU.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! :) 

 

I‘m Isabel, a cellist and composer - born in Germany and currently living and working in Switzerland. 

Since years it has been my dream to record my own solo CD with multitrack compositions of mine. And if not now when else shall it ever happen? Half a year ago I have finally started to write the pieces and put them together.

This project is really important for me, because I have always felt like my way of musical creation doesn‘t really fit into the classical music industry. The industry is always about: younger, faster, and more „perfect“ music making - but I really think that music should be: creating something that you put thought, dedication, passion and time into. I want to create my music that expresses my feelings and experiences. 

 

What I need your contribution for

Recording professionally in Switzerland is unfortunately really expensive.

Studios and mixing is total around 8000 CHF. 

The rental of the studio will be around 4000 CHF, recording/mixing around 4000 CHF.

A small part of my recording is already covered so that's why I am doing a crowdfunding now to mainly cover the bigger part of the mixing and recording costs.

 

The Impact

In the past I was in a lucky position to record some of my compositions live with cello students from Zurich‘s University of Arts and use the Universities recording facilities for free. As I am not a student anymore this isn‘t possible and I have to fund my own recording. 

Some of my pieces are for example:

Saudade

 

Go on

 

 

Risks & Challenges

The main challenge for me is to get together the funding for my project. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing is caring! :) Help to spread the word

story:
Help me get my new album done!

Hey, friends-- I've got a new jazz album all recorded-- but, I need financial help getting it mixed, mastered, and released-- I need about $2,000. It is a long album, sixteen jazz standards (think Rat Pack, show tunes, standards), with just my guitar and voice, exactly like I do it live. I've even got world-famous sax player, Greg Yasinitsky, playing on two songs with me!  The sound that I was shooting for with the album is if Harry Connick Jr. was singing with Joe Pass on guitar. Then, imagine Harry has strep throat and is pretty drunk,  and Joe lost two-fingers in a freak lawn mowing accident-- and you'll have the sound of the album. Very unique, I think you'll like it!

If you want to donate $20 or more--  I will send you the album when it is done, with much gratitude!

If you'd like to help me, but can't donate anything, just tell friends about it, and link them to this page, my website, or my Facebook page (Eric E.), and that will help a great deal, too. Especially with sales, after the album is released. I probably won't have it on Spotify for a couple of years (makes album sales meaningless) but I will have it available on CD, Digital download card, iTunes, and maybe even vinyl, if I get some requests.

story:
As a long time musician, trumpeter, and composer, it has always been a dream of mine to record my music and share my love and passion with the world! That opportunity has now presented itself, but I need YOUR help to make the dream a reality.

 

About The Project

Back in December 2016, I asked saxophonist Jeff Clayton (Clayton-Hamilton Jazz Orchestra, Clayton Brothers Quintet) to be an Artist-In-Residence at California State University, Stanislaus where I am the Coordinator of Jazz Studies. As part of his visit, I asked him to perform with my University's big band and play with a group of mine at the "Jazz @ Carnegie Arts Center Series" in Turlock, CA. His answer to this query was “Yes” but with a challenge: to create new music and to put it out there (or distribute it)!

The original plan for this project was to feature some of my older compositions I had yet to record. However, once the creative juices were flowing I ended up going into the studio with 6 brand new compositions as well as a few older ones (and one from Jeff)! This music reflects my life over the past year or so and I even pay tribute to some important people in my life!

Joining me on this recording is a wonderful cast of talented and supportive musicians: of course Jeff Clayton (Alto Sax), Brenden Lowe (Piano), Chris Amberger (Bass), and Tim Metz (Drums). You’ll also hear from some amazing special guests which include some of my closest friends as well some well-respected names in jazz! All of the music was recorded and engineered by Brian Kendrick at his beautiful home studio in Stockton, CA.

 

Where Do Your Donations Go?

Your donations and contributions to this project will go directly to the following:

  • Mixing & Mastering
  • CD-Pressing & Publication
  • Record Distribution
  • Album Cover Photography & Artwork
  • Recording & musician contracting fees

 

The Perks

When you donate to this project, you are privy to some amazing perks! 

  • Digital Download ($12) - digital copy of the album
  • CD + Digital Download ($20) - CD + digital copy of the album
  • CD + Album Poster ($50) - CD + digital copy + autographed album poster
  • Private Lesson* ($75) - 60-90 min improvisation, trumpet, or composition lesson
  • Sheet Music of Originals* ($100) - copies of all originals (Bb, C, & Eb available)
  • Small Group Arrangement* ($250) - commissioned arrangement for your group
  • Big Band Arrangement* ($500) -commissioned arrangement for your big band
  • Private Performance* ($1500) - my group performing music from the album for your private event!
    * CD + digital copy + autographed album poster included in package

 

How Can You Help?

Your donations and a contributions would be greatly appreciated! However, If you can’t contribute to this campaign, thats ok, you can still make a difference! Here are the following ways you can help me reach my goal:

  • Donate to the project by clicking Back It!
  • Contribute by selecting one of the exclusive Perks
  • Get the word out on Social Media (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, SnapChat, etc.)
  •  Don't forget to use the Indiegogo Share Tools! (see top right of campaign page)

For more information on this project, please visit my website at www.joemazzmusic.com

 

THANK YOU for your time and I hope you enjoy the music!

story:
Just Another Crowdfunding Campaign, Just Another Bluegrass Record. Right? 

Wrong. At least, mostly wrong. This will be a decidedly bluegrass record.

Jon and Justin met each other more than six years ago and together they've been playing music, writing songs, and making waves in the bluegrass community ever since.

 Jon was the first recipient of the International Bluegrass Music Association's Songwriter of the Year Award in 2012. He's had close to 200 of his songs recorded, including nearly a dozen bluyegrass #1s, he plays bass with Chris Jones and the Night Drivers, hosts a radio show on SiriusXM's Bluegrass Junction with Del McCoury, and is a living, breathing encyclopedia of bluegrass history. 

 Justin was nominated for IBMA's Instrumentalist Momentum Award in 2016 for his banjo playing. He's performed with Laurie Lewis, Jim Lauderdale, Roland White, and many others. His songs have been showcased by the IBMA and by American Songwriter Magazine, he's also a columnist for the Bluegrass Situation, and he organized Shout & Shine, the bluegrass community's first ever showcase focused on diversity, at IBMA's World of Bluegrass. 

 Mid-2017 Jon and Justin cobbled together a band to play their debut show as a duo at the World Famous Station Inn in Nashville, Tennessee, in the process realizing that they'd gathered quite the collection of songs. An album's worth, even. So an idea was born. And that idea is what spawned this campaign, this very pitch, and you taking the time to read it.

No Risk, No Rewards. 

 We know you know it. Making an album is an extraordinarily expensive process, even when you strip it down to the bone. There's the studio time, mixing and mastering, the talent, pressing the record, fulfilling our rewards, publicity, and Indiegogo's percentage. We've budgeted for only the absolute essentials because for us, funding the record means just that. Funding the record. Nothing more. No bells and whistles. (Bells and whistles ain't no part a-nothin anyhow.)

 Think of this as a preorder. You can get in on the ground floor of something that's shaping up to be a fantastic album of good ol' fashioned bluegrass played by some of the most exciting musicians around. You can "preorder" the record as a digital download, a signed hard copy, or in a bundle with a signed poster or signed postcard. If you aren't burnt out on crowdfunding campaigns -- thank you for being an amazing human --  and want more than just a "preorder," we've added some options beyond just the music and accoutrements. A songwriting consult? A tailor-made concert? This is a choose-your-own-adventure type of situation. 

Wait... So How Is This More Than Just Another Crowdfunded Bluegrass Record?

 Thank you for bringing us back around to this point. The songs will hit your ears with that bluegrass familiarity we all love, but they aren't hackneyed, cliché, or heavy-handed. The instrumentation is well within the standard definition of the genre, but each of the players have unique, recognizable voices on their instruments. There's the band from our Station Inn show: Momentum Award winner Casey Campbell on mandolin; phenomenal, traditional-to-her-core fiddler Corrina Logston; and Amanda Fields on guitar with an invincible right hand. And we'll have a second band as well: Brandon Godman on fiddle, a veteran of Quicksilver, Dale Ann Bradley, and the Band Perry; Molly Tuttle, IBMA's reigning Guitar Player of the Year; and Tristan Scroggins, another Momentum Award winner and fiery mandolinist. Kimber Ludiker, of Della Mae fame and a Grand Master Fiddle Champion, will be lending a twin part here and there. We have some surprise guests vocalists lined up, too. (Support the album and we'll give you all the secrets as we go.) 

 Without meaning to, we've ended up with quite a diverse set of pickers on this album, playing... well, bluegrass. That's why this isn't just another bluegrass album. We didn't start out with an agenda, or an overarching goal, we've just been writing and making music that we love to write and make -- with people with whom we love to write and make music. That's why we and all of the talented folks on the roster are rearing and ready to go. 

 Music - especially bluegrass - doesn't exist without community. The community of musical people that have surrounded us throughout our careers and over the course of our friendship inspired this project and are actively making it a reality. It makes sense, then, to use this campaign to expand that community, bringing each and every one of you into the fold as well.  

 Okay, so it is another bluegrass record. But not just another bluegrass record.

 We hope you'll support our campaign, but if you can't -- don't sweat it, we've passed on plenty of crowdfunding projects ourselves -- give us a share, a tweet, a like, a signal boost, or whatever you can to get the word out. We've got songs about lost love, forbidding prairies, rare wildflowers, granite quarries, and raging fires to get out to the masses!
story_txt:
Just Another Crowdfunding Campaign, Just Another Bluegrass Record. Right? 
Wrong. At least, mostly wrong. This will be a decidedly bluegrass record.
Jon and Justin met each other more than six years ago and together they've been playing music, writing songs, and making waves in the bluegrass community ever since.
 Jon was the first recipient of the International Bluegrass Music Association's Songwriter of the Year Award in 2012. He's had close to 200 of his songs recorded, including nearly a dozen bluyegrass #1s, he plays bass with Chris Jones and the Night Drivers, hosts a radio show on SiriusXM's Bluegrass Junction with Del McCoury, and is a living, breathing encyclopedia of bluegrass history. 
 Justin was nominated for IBMA's Instrumentalist Momentum Award in 2016 for his banjo playing. He's performed with Laurie Lewis, Jim Lauderdale, Roland White, and many others. His songs have been showcased by the IBMA and by American Songwriter Magazine, he's also a columnist for the Bluegrass Situation, and he organized Shout & Shine, the bluegrass community's first ever showcase focused on diversity, at IBMA's World of Bluegrass. 
 Mid-2017 Jon and Justin cobbled together a band to play their debut show as a duo at the World Famous Station Inn in Nashville, Tennessee, in the process realizing that they'd gathered quite the collection of songs. An album's worth, even. So an idea was born. And that idea is what spawned this campaign, this very pitch, and you taking the time to read it.

No Risk, No Rewards. 
 We know you know it. Making an album is an extraordinarily expensive process, even when you strip it down to the bone. There's the studio time, mixing and mastering, the talent, pressing the record, fulfilling our rewards, publicity, and Indiegogo's percentage. We've budgeted for only the absolute essentials because for us, funding the record means just that. Funding the record. Nothing more. No bells and whistles. (Bells and whistles ain't no part a-nothin anyhow.)
 Think of this as a preorder. You can get in on the ground floor of something that's shaping up to be a fantastic album of good ol' fashioned bluegrass played by some of the most exciting musicians around. You can "preorder" the record as a digital download, a signed hard copy, or in a bundle with a signed poster or signed postcard. If you aren't burnt out on crowdfunding campaigns -- thank you for being an amazing human --  and want more than just a "preorder," we've added some options beyond just the music and accoutrements. A songwriting consult? A tailor-made concert? This is a choose-your-own-adventure type of situation. 

Wait... So How Is This More Than Just Another Crowdfunded Bluegrass Record?
 Thank you for bringing us back around to this point. The songs will hit your ears with that bluegrass familiarity we all love, but they aren't hackneyed, cliché, or heavy-handed. The instrumentation is well within the standard definition of the genre, but each of the players have unique, recognizable voices on their instruments. There's the band from our Station Inn show: Momentum Award winner Casey Campbell on mandolin; phenomenal, traditional-to-her-core fiddler Corrina Logston; and Amanda Fields on guitar with an invincible right hand. And we'll have a second band as well: Brandon Godman on fiddle, a veteran of Quicksilver, Dale Ann Bradley, and the Band Perry; Molly Tuttle, IBMA's reigning Guitar Player of the Year; and Tristan Scroggins, another Momentum Award winner and fiery mandolinist. Kimber Ludiker, of Della Mae fame and a Grand Master Fiddle Champion, will be lending a twin part here and there. We have some surprise guests vocalists lined up, too. (Support the album and we'll give you all the secrets as we go.) 
 Without meaning to, we've ended up with quite a diverse set of pickers on this album, playing... well, bluegrass. That's why this isn't just another bluegrass album. We didn't start out with an agenda, or an overarching goal, we've just been writing and making music that we love to write and make -- with people with whom we love to write and make music. That's why we and all of the talented folks on the roster are rearing and ready to go. 
 Music - especially bluegrass - doesn't exist without community. The community of musical people that have surrounded us throughout our careers and over the course of our friendship inspired this project and are actively making it a reality. It makes sense, then, to use this campaign to expand that community, bringing each and every one of you into the fold as well.  
 Okay, so it is another bluegrass record. But not just another bluegrass record.
 We hope you'll support our campaign, but if you can't -- don't sweat it, we've passed on plenty of crowdfunding projects ourselves -- give us a share, a tweet, a like, a signal boost, or whatever you can to get the word out. We've got songs about lost love, forbidding prairies, rare wildflowers, granite quarries, and raging fires to get out to the masses!

story:
Summary

The International Cajon Festival is about to start and we are celebrating our 10th anniversary! Musicians from different schools, styles and nationalities will come together to share their instruments, their music and culture in this unique event that will take place from April 27-30 in Lima, Peru. Over four intense days we will have concerts, conferences, video screenings, workshops and master classes. Join the celebrations!

Rafael Santa Cruz, an outstanding researcher, actor musician and teacher founded the festival ten years ago. Continuing with the tradition of his family, he devoted his life to the study and the promotion of afro peruvian music and the cajon, one of its most emblematic and influential instruments.

What we need and how it will be used

We are launching this campaign to raise funds that will allow us to pay the main services we are hiring to make the festival possible. The largest part of your pledge will be used to pay all the people hired in the production, which means musicians, dancers and technicians to enable their participation in the festival. We cover part of the travel expenses of our artists, so we really need you! Another part of the funding will be use for covering our operational costs, such as the rent of the National Theater and the technical equipment needed to set up venues, make the screen projections and held the workshops during the event.

As this is our 10th anniversary we really want to bring to our community some special free activities. We are working hard to maintain the high quality of our festival and we already have experience in doing magic out of little money, but this time we need your support to make things bigger and bring free culture to more people!

What you will get

In exchange for your support you will receive different kind of rewards, which vary from music, books, entrances to the main show in the National Theater and your own cajon painted by an important Peruvian artist, a unique piece of art! Of course you will also be considered and recognized as one of our associated producers of the festival!

In case our goal is not met, we will use the funds we are able to get to pay an equal rate for all the people involved and we will run the whole event on a smaller scale. So we really need your support to help us deliver a great celebration for everybody!

The Impact of our festival

Our festival is positioned as a benchmark in terms of percussion in Peru and in the Latin American region and it has captured media attention both nationally and internationally. It is an important educative event that allows free access to culture to all the sectors of the population and encourages people to appropriate of public spaces through a massive central event. It facilitates activities of cultural exchange and development between countries and encourages the recognition of contributions from minority groups. We have rapidly grown in scope since our first edition and more than 40,000 people have already attended the total activities we offer!

Risks and Challenges

Some months ago we started looking for several funding sources. We’ve being very active doing so, knowing that in our country it’s difficult to raise money for this kind of events. We still need to raise funds to make our Festival possible. In past editions, we’ve received support from some private companies and public institutions, but this year, because of the recent national emergency due to the heavy rains in the highlands, public and corporate sponsorships have been redirected to attend it, so we need to rely on private funding in order to get all this work on its feet and guarantee all the services and locations we are using are being paid. Culture is the best expression of resilience and hope So here’s where we need you, and we believe the quality of the festival it’s worth the effort of your involvement!

Other ways you can help

We understand some people may not be able to contribute financially, in that case please support us with the diffusion of our campaign and of the materials we’ve prepared for the festival. Use the hashtag @FestivalInternacionalDeCajonPeruano to follow us on Facebook. Give us a like; give us your comments and share as much as you can, we really appreciate it! And of course, come join the festival!

story:
Short Summary

I started to play violin when I was a kid, but when I really decided to go on the music path was a couple of years ago. I've been traveling the world and gathering inspiration, which has given a mix of feels to my music. On the way I picked up didgeridoo and then half a year ago added it to my music. The didgeridoo combined with the violin and loop pedal unlocked a deeper and richer sound. As I continue on my musical journey, my sound and songs constantly develop and grow. During my last summer travels around the UK I met an amazing producer who offered me to record a professional quality album with him. This album will be part of European tour which I am setting up and it can only happen if I can afford a van to travel between shows.

What We Need & What You Get

I need to get enough money to buy a van and cover costs of recording an album.

Whoever supports $10 or more I'll send you download code of the new album

Whoever supports $50 or more will receive a signed physical copy of new album with personal note

Whoever supports $500 or more I'll write a song especially for you, record it and send it to you

if you support with $5000 or more plus travel costs I'll travel to your home to play a personal show and cook a special Vojta's dinner for you... ;)

          

The Impact

Without a van the tour is not possible and I will not be able to get to the amazing producer and record the new album...

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any money just share it... :)
