story:
Short Summary

 

"Como antes pasó con el flamenco o con la música de Buena Vista Social Club​.Sin ir más lejos, con el jazz . Géneros musicales de extracción popular y​ sangre caliente, denostados en un principio por las clases pudientes​ y a los que los dioses de la música acabaron​ reconociendo su lugar en la historia.​"- ​El País (Spain)

 

 

 

Peruvian chicha music was born and exploded from the chaotic political context of the 80s. At the time, Peru was suffering from devastating economic inflation and terrorism, forcing Andean populations to migrate to a cruel and unwelcoming capital. Until this day, despite being undervalued and stigmatized, chicha music continues to have a strong sociocultural impact in the lives of working class Peruvians. 

This expression of popular music produced from migration, caused abrupt social encounters and cultural frictions. Migrants who were forced to live in marginal spaces within the urban setting of Lima, began building their own identity by mixing the music and lyrics they brought from the Andes with city rhythms such as American psychedelic, Cuban guaracha, Colombian cumbia, among many other stunning hybrid styles. This led to the creation of  musical icons and finding new spaces for cultural expression. This is how the Andean cumbia (chicha) boom in Peru became an essential part of a key historical moment in Latin American cultural re-appreciation, not only having influence in music, but also in aesthetics, social, economic and even geographic aspects, all under the powerful name of “chicha”.

 

 

Seeing the importance of this dynamic history, the director of this project, Jalo Nuñez Del Prado, embarked on an arduous mission, traveling across Peru, to find the person at the heart of the chicha movement, Juan Campos Muñoz. Juan Campos was the driving force behind Discos Horóscopo, the record label responsible for launching and popularizing emblematic figures of Peruvian Chicha music like Chacalón & La Nueva Crema, Los Shapis, Pintura Roja and Los Ovnis, among others.

 

Now, Discos Horoscópo returns 40 years later with the goal of legitimizing chicha music as part of Peru's immaterial heritage through the international release of the ten most emblematic chicha albums and a strong international press campaign, planting the seed to spread our musical identity worldwide.  

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

Until now, this project has grown and moved forward without any institutional or private support. This project has moved forward independently with the driving force of producing deluxe editions of these remastered albums. At least 12,000 Euros have been spent in the first stage (pre-production). Costs include: contract development, obtaining and purchasing catalog rights, restoring and digitizing the complete catalog, searching for and purchasing archival material to include in the final production, purchasing domain and web hosting, programming, graphic design, development of audiovisual materials, media and press, pre-production assistance, and operating costs. 

 

 

 

 

Now, in the second stage,we need to raise 40,000 Euros in order to move forward to production for each album. We are asking for your collaboration to produce and release the first five albums of the total ten. Which are:

 

  1. Chacalón Y La Nueva Crema - S/T  (Release Date: June 2017)

  2. Los Shapis - Auténticos (Release Date: September 2017)

  3. Pintura Roja - Pinceladas Musicales (Release Date: December 2017)

  4. Chacalón y La Nueva Crema - Grandes Éxitos 76-82(Release Date: March 2018)

  5. Los Ovnis - Creadores Del Ritmo Tropical Andino (Release Date: July 2018)

 

Standard Issue Black 140grs Vinyl

 

Special Edition Color Vinyl ( Only 150 Numbered Copies)

 

 Costs would include for each album:

  • studio photo session of original album covers
  • retouching photos taken for offset printing
  • graphic design and layout for the packaging gatefold and booklet LP
  • graphic design and layout for the packaging gatefold and booklet CD
  • analog remastering 12 tracks digitized by renowned Spanish sound engineer,Juan Hildalgo 
  • digital remastering 12 tracks digitized by renowned Spanish sound engineer,Juan Hildalgo
  • production of vinyl records in black and color version, limited and deluxe editions 
  • production of CDs 
  • payment of phonographic rights
  • payment of royalties to author rights
  • office and warehouse costs and maintenance in Madrid
  • shipping and handling costs
  • hiring press agent specialized in Madrid
  • travel expenses
  • project management fees
  • production assistance, coordination, and distribution in Lima and Madrid
We are offering incredible perks to those who choose to become part of the revival and preservation of this revolutionary story told through music.  
 
 

The Impact

In Peru, chicha music has been consistently criminalized, racialized, and devalued for its deep relationship with working class people. This project aims to revalorize and celebrate chicha as a brilliant force of style and music on par with other important musical movements in the world.  

To rescue, preserve, know, and spread the values of our cultural heritage signifies securing our sense of cultural identity and in turn defending our sovereignty. At the core of this project is the preservation and rescue of chicha music as a form of keeping our cultural heritage alive as well as making chicha music known and available on an international level through digital platforms such as spotify, itunes, apple music, google play, deezer, etc...

 

 

Perks:

 

 

​​5 Euros

 Thank you for your contribution!

 

​9 Euros​ 

  1. MP3 320KBPS First release digital download album - Remastered.
 

25 Euros

  1.   First release album CD Delivered - Remastered
  2. MP3 320KBPS First release digital download album - Remastered.

 

35 Euros

  1. First release album LP Delivered - Standard issue black 140grs Vinyl - MP3
  2. 320Kbps Digital Download Album - Remastered

 

50 Euros 

  1. First release Album LP Delivered - Standard Issue Black 140grs Vinyl
  2. First release album CD Delivered - Remastered
  3. MP3 320KBPS First release digital download album - Remastered.
 

100 Euros

 

  1. First release album LP - Special Edition Color Vinyl ( Only 150 Numbered Copies)
  2. First release album CD Delivered - Remastered
  3. MP3 320KBPS First release digital download album - Remastered.

 

 

250 Euros  

 

  1. First release album LP - Special Edition Color Vinyl ( Only 150 Numbered Copies)
  2. First release album CD Delivered - Remastered
  3. MP3 320KBPS First release digital download album - Remastered.
  4. Professional print of actual album art

          

500 Euros 

SELECT 3 ALBUMS FROM ANY OF THE FIVE ALBUMS THAT WILL BE RELEASED from the first phase of our project and receive all that is listed below from those corresponding albums.

  1.  Release Album LP - Standard Issue Black 140grs Vinyl (Delivered)
  2. Album CD Remastered ( Delivered)
  3. MP3 320Kpbs Digital Download Remastered Album
  4. Professional Print Of Actuals Album Art Or PhotoGraphy From The Age 40cm x 40cm.

 

*  Please be aware that you will not receive anything until its release date. Make sure to check release date estimations in the description.

 

1000 Euros

SELECT YOUR 3 TEST PRESSING ALBUMS ( ONLY 5 COPIES) + ALL OF THE ABOVE:

*Test pressing albums are extremely rare, limited, and unique copies of vinyls before mass production begins to test quality control.

 

SELECT 3 ALBUMS FROM ANY OF THE FIVE ALBUMS THAT WILL BE RELEASED from the first phase of our project and receive all that is listed below from those corresponding albums)  

  1.  Release Album LP - Standard Issue Black 140grs Vinyl (Delivered)
  2. Album CD Remastered ( Delivered)
  3. MP3 320Kpbs Digital Download Remastered Album
  4. Professional Print Of Actuals Album Art Or PhotoGraphy From The Age 40cm x 40cm.


*  Please be aware that you will not receive anything until its release date. Make sure to check release date estimations in the description.

 

2000 Euros

SELECT YOUR 3 TEST PRESSING ALBUMS ( ONLY 5 COPIES) + ALL OF THE ABOVE:

*Test pressing albums are extremely rare, limited, and unique copies of vinyls before mass production begins to test quality control.

 

SELECT 3 ALBUMS FROM ANY OF THE FIVE ALBUMS THAT WILL BE RELEASED from the first phase of our project and receive all that is listed below from those corresponding albums)  

                 

  1.  Release Album LP - Standard Issue Black 140grs Vinyl (Delivered)
  2. Album CD Remastered ( Delivered)
  3. MP3 320Kpbs Digital Download Remastered Album
  4. Professional Print Of Actuals Album Art Or PhotoGraphy From The Age 40cm x 40cm.
  5. You will be recognized as a music preserver of Peruvian Chicha.


*  Please be aware that you will not receive anything until its release date. Make sure to check release date estimations in the description.

 

DISCOS HORÓSCOPO
www.discos-horoscopo.com
contacto@discos-horoscopo.com
Telf: + 34 665 202 779

 

Join us on facebook!

story:
"Color of the Sound" | Armen-Levon Manaseryan /piano

 

I am an Armenian concert pianist, currently residing in Belgium.
I  had numerous recitals, took part in concerts, festivals and I am the prize-winner of various international piano competitions in Armenia, Romania, France, Russia, Germany, Kazakhstan, Austria, Belgium, Italy, Poland and Malta. I am also the founder and artistic director of "Vitrage" charity festival  in Brussels.

Recently I won the 1st Prize and Trophy at the 5th Valletta International Piano Competition in Malta (2017). I was also awarded a special prize to record a CD with renowned "KNS" Classical label. The chance to record a CD is a big opportunity and I am hoping for your support and help in achieving this goal.

The program I wish to record includes "Pictures At an Exhibition" by Mussorgsky and "Six Dances" by Komitas. Works by Komitas  has never been recorded on KNS Classical label and I will be glad to be the first. This is very important for me as an Armenian pianist. I will be once again spreading the Armenian music, which is always included in my repertoire. The project is very unique, because the CD will be also containing my paintings related to each of Mussorgsky's pictures.  

My other big passion is painting. The CD will also have an appendix brochure, containing my paintings related to each of Mussorgsky's pictures. Mussorgsky was inspired to write that piece by the exhibition of a Russian painter and architect Viktor Hartmann (1834-1873).

As a continuation of this inspiration into the 21st century I created a series of paintings, based on my personal impressions. In addition to my paintings the appendix brochure will also contain information about me, the composers and their works.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We’re really looking forward to collaborating with you! Here are all the costs related to the release of our first CD:

1. Renting a "Steinway & Sons" piano and a concert hall

2. Recording

3. Mixing & Mastering

4. CD release in collaboration with KNS Classical label, which includes: CD digital publishing and distribution; top quality cover design; management of all the elements involved in the publishing; promo package; artist profile  in KNS Classical website; inclusion of the CD in KNS Classical catalogue;  1 professional AD for Social Media purposes; 1 banner in KNS Classical website; digital contribution to KNS’partners, online retailers: Amazon, Itunes, Rhapsody, Spotify and more.

5. IndieGoGo & Credit Card Processing Fees

 

The approximate cost of the project is 4.500 EUR.
Please help me to reach my goal. Each euro will get me closer to it. 

I have prepared various gifts and offers for your support. Hope you will like them. You can become acquainted with them on the right-hand side of this page. 

Please share this campaign with your family, friends and colleagues.  You will help me a lot!  You can always use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
The Band

Dirty Heretics is an electro punk/thrash duo made up of Atesh Tur and Rachel Gavaletz. We have been writing and performing together for a little over a year. During our time together, we have selected a 4 song EP to be released this summer, and one of our songs has especially stood out. After a lot of meetings, storyboarding, and preparation, we are so excited to reach the next level with our music video for the single Black and Blue. 

The Song

Black and Blue is about addiction. Unfortunately, it’s about a particular person’s addiction. Sterling Spiers passed away on Dec 6th 2015 of a heroin overdose at the age of 27. He was the brother of Rachel’s life-long best friend, Tommi-Sue Spiers. 

Rachel: “I have written several songs about Sterling throughout the years. How could I not be affected by this person’s struggles and the pain he suffered? But it is subtle. I wanted the lyrics to be universal. Anyone struggling with addiction. Or depression. Or something dark. And as we played this song live, people really paid attention to it. Maybe it’s just the vibe of the song…. the dark trappy sound… I’m sure no one knew the first time they heard it what it was about. For whatever reason, our fans and audiences felt connected to it. And Atesh and I knew this was the song to use for the music video.”

Atesh: "Black and blue is a story about how an idea, a theme, can be interpreted in many different ways due to our mental states. The three distinctive parts of the song tell the same idea through completely different dynamics. First part is a slow middle eastern guitar intro playing a moody variation of the theme of the song. In the second part, the theme gets serious, more alerting as tension builds to the third part, where the story gains speed and builds up to a dark electro climax."

So here's the deal...

We have already broken down all the production costs including location, editing, and crew, and have chosen the flexible funding option on IndieGoGo. That way, if we don’t make it to our goal of $3,300, we can still use the funds we raise to help create this video. But the AMAZING part about crowdfunding is that $5 really does go a long way! In fact, our first perk starts at $5 which is a download card for our EP. If you are unable to give, PLEASE SHARE this page on social media! 

 

Stay tuned for updates, and enjoy our cover of The Beatles' "Don't Let me Down" while you give :^)

story:
"Preachin' Drunk" by Joe Cat music release.

Hey Y'all.  My name is Joe Cat and I am a Americana Roots artist living in Athens GA. I have a gritty blue-collar sound that comes from real life experience. I tour most of the country playing my music in many bars, listening rooms, cafes, & breweries. I spend about 200 days on the road a year taking my music to all demographics of people in this country. After the last ten years I have made many great friends that also enjoy my music and stories. When I first started playing again years ago, I did so for my own health. The heavy stress of life compelled me to play for hours, just to drown out the struggles of everyday life. I would essentially get lost in my own music while playing. It was and still remains the best therapy you could ever ask for. I have come to realize, in all of the places that I visit and play, the music has the same effect on many others. Many people relate to my songs, and find an escape from their everyday lives in them. What I have originally created to sooth my own soul has become so much more for many folks who get lost in the music with me. Along the way I have met and have been inspired by many other musicians and artist that have similar passions. Unfortunately, life is short and unpredictable. There have been so many of these same folks who have inspired and helped me along who unfortunately are only here with us now in spirit. It was their love, and encouragement that keep me working along, and playing my old heart out for strangers every night. I feel like I have finally found my purpose in life, and have vowed in all of their names to never slow down or stop. I want to inspire others to do what makes them happy. To express themselves and break free of the stress of everyday life. 

My new album release, "Preachin' Drunk", is the first time that I have invited other musicians to come and record my music with me. The results are turning out to be the best music I have ever made. I have been working hard at my home studio, "Cabin in the Sky Studios" here in Athens GA with mastering to be done very soon at another local studio. I would be honored and eternally grateful to any of you who help contribute to this new effort of mine.  All of the money raised will be used to produce, vinyl, cd's, promotion, and pay for studio time. My goal is to raise a total of 5,000 dollars to help offset all of the cost of this process.

Hopefully I will be able to come out to where you are soon and play some of my music.

Thank-you for all of your help.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Eniola Anna Abioye. I was born in London, raised here in the States. I have loved words my whole life. Music, writing and design have been my favorite ways to express myself. I decided to launch this campaign to receive funding for an EP.

What We Need & What You Get

The full amount, I am asking for is $6000.

The money will cover the cost of production, mixing and mastering each song on the album, as well as paying musicians and creatives that will help create the sound.

If fully funded, by the end of November, beginning of December, at the latest, I'll have an EP (electronic album) for all to download off of iTunes and hear on various online music platforms. 

Risks & Challenges

If I am honest, I am nervous and scared. I have tried before to garner funds for big projects and failed miserably. How is this time different? It is different because I realize that fear is just the door I walk through to get to the other side of my biggest dreams, not the thing that holds me back. If I fail, I will not stop. I won't lick wounds. I will keep going, because I am convinced that this isn't just about scratching an itch, but fulfilling my destiny.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please pray and send me what you are sensing from the Lord, I want to hold these up as affirmations and confessions.

Share and spread the word through Facebook and Instagram.

Also, feel free to email me and send me messages!!

Love you:)

story:
Marty Mayhem and the Liabilities Debut Album

Hey I'm Marty and I want to make an album. After years of various bands (good and bad) I have finally found my voice and style and the next step is to create a great record and get it out there. I have had some interest from labels, some good and some bad but I feel with the genre of music and the vibe the band has I want to go full DIY and put the record out myself. So I am asking for your help in raising the funds and in return I can give you some cool stuff. I feel we can do this together!

I have been playing music for a decade now and nine times out of ten I have had the backing of my brother Alex on drums, and this time is no different. There's just something different that happens when we play together. I will get some other local musicians to get involved. I plan to record at a small local studio as to help them out too, we are looking at local printers to produce the CDs, Cassettes, Posters. Hopefully I won't just get an album recorded and out there but I can help some small local businesses out at the same time.

The album is written and demo'd and we are starting to make final tweeks. So once the money has  been raised I can get straight into the studio. Recording, mixin, mastering and then printing materials and duplicating CDs.  I envisage this taking around 3 months to do it properly. With any luck you'll have a great new rock n roll  album in your hands before the end of the year.

 

What I Need & What You Get

So, I have put on my business head (yes I suppose having a day job did have its uses) and I have crunched the figures and decided I need another £750 all in to get the job done (I have already had some generous donations, many thanks to those people). This includes recording, printing, photos, artwork.... The whole thing. If we can raise more than this I can look at more studio time, currently I plan on spending 2 full days in the studio which is not long in album terms but, if Led Zepplin can do it then so can I! Any extra money raised will be spent on studio time and promotional material. 

On the flip side, if I don't reach the target the show will still go on. I will do more shows, busk, whatever it takes to get the money together, it might just take a little while longer to get the record out there. 

I have put together some cool "packages" for you to buy! 

Millennial - Download of the album/ demos

Casual Fan - CD and Poster

Retro - Cassette (yes we are putting the album on cassette) Poster, Demos

Guru - CD, Demos, Lyric Sheet

Collectors - Everything and more!! CD, Cassette, Demos, Poster, Lyric Sheet, and anything else I have to hand.

Of course your can just buy the CD if that's what you want.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can contribute or not I need your help to get the word out there about the album  and what I am trying to do. So please share on social media, tell your mates! To help you there are some share tools right here on Indiegogo.

Thanks for your support! 

Marty

story:
Hi folks,

some of you will know already that my debut solo album, "We Used To Go Raving" is being released on September 29th. I'm hoping, with this campaign, to drum up a bit of support for the album ahead of its release, as well as obviously selling as many copies of it as I can! It is probable, like the majority of music out there, that, in time, the album will be available to stream at some point on the usual platforms, Spotify, etc, but if you choose to buy the album, even when considering that, then it really helps me to develop as a musician, fund the various expenses incurred in gigs, equipment, and the writing and production of music in the near and distant future. 

If you'd like a wee listen to what it is that you're funding, then please do! 2 youtube links to my first 2 singles below:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gLlnmv8Euq0 - We Used To Go Raving (title track and first single, released in Feb 2017)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W6b59ANt2l4 - No More (Say Yes) (2nd single, released in June 2017)

A few folks in the press and internet have written nice things also:

"A lovely, tumbling piece of piano-led, millennial nostalgia"  The List

"would not be out of place on the new Trainspotting 2 soundtrack" Scots Whay Hey

"filled with 80s nostalgia and silent nods towards Ian Curtis genius" The Vinyl District 

"in case you haven't noticed, we love it." When You Motor Away

More can be found on Facebook and Twitter. Please contact us!

facebook.com/errantmediamusic

facebook.com/stephenmclarenmusic

twitter.com/errantmedia

twitter.com/mclarenallday

email: stephenmclarenmusic@gmail.com

story:
After 25 years of playing in symphony orchestras, in April 2016 I began working fulltime on composing, performing and publishing my own compositions.  I am currently building up my portfolio of original music.  I hope that audiences will enjoy experiencing these compositions and that other musicians will enjoy playing them.  In the last two years I have had several interesting commissions.  One piece, which is called Sonaquifer: Flowing-Turning Dance, was commissioned  by cellist Hannah Addario-Berry, who  recorded it for her 2016 album, Scordatura.  I kept writing more material, and the piece became a full suite of four movements.  Sonaquifer Suite can be played on either cello or viola.  You may have heard me perform the viola version at a San Francisco recital, house concert, dance community campout, or Burning Man.  

It is now time to make a professional studio recording and to publish the sheet music for Sonaquifer Suite, as well as another piece called Reflections, for Baritone Viola (formerly called Piece in G - the piece with the plucking like a classical guitar.) Recording and publishing will enable me to share these pieces with listeners and musicians all over the world.

On Nov. 17 and 18, 2017, I recorded at Laughing Tiger Studio in San Rafael, California, with the assistance of David Bowles, a renowned sound engineer and producer who has worked with many top classical artists.  Contributions to this campaign will help to cover the costs of the studio, the engineer, and CD production.  We are making physical CDs, because they are still good to have on hand to offer at shows, and some people still like having physical recorded objects.  The album will also be available for streaming and distributed digitally.

The scores are ready to publish as both downloadable PDFs and paper booklets.  I will have covers for the booklets professionally printed, and I will print the contents and assemble the booklets myself.  This way I can make booklets as they are needed and will have the ability to make corrections if needed.

Contributions will also help defray the high costs of advertising in print and online publications.  I will also take advantage of many opportunities to publicize my music for free online.

My goal for this campaign is $8500.  If this is reached it will allow me to do all of the things mentioned above.  If is not reached, I will still make the recording and publish the scores, but my advertising strategy might need to be modified.  If the goal is exceeded, funds will go toward getting the word out even more.  This recording project will represent my work in the world, which will help me to gain paid commissions for future projects, and this will in turn help me to continue to produce original music to the best of my ability.

People have told me that my music touches them emotionally and takes them on a journey.  When this happens, I feel that I'm doing my job as a musician.  In this way I am traditional, although I do love experimenting with unusual tunings, techniques and technoloigical  possibilities.  In the process of writing Sonaquifer, I came to terms with some self-doubt about whether my music is "modern enough," since I still use old-fashioned ideas like melody, harmony, and recognizable rhythms.  (Yes, these are considered old-fashioned by some!)  My conclusion is that there is a common ground of musical language which speaks to and brings joy to many people, and I love being a channel for musical communication.

Would you consider making a donation to help me share this music with an international audience?  If you can donate, thank you so much!!!

Please consider sharing this campaign with your friends on social media!  Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Crushingcrayons is a band hailing from the small coastal lumber and fishing town, Coos Bay, Oregon. We have been in our current lineup for almost two years and with the release of our first LP we want to take our sound from just being a local one; to being something across the west coast and even further. Our good friend and brother, Nathan Sloan will also be joining us on this adventure. Together we are going to rock the west coast  one city and town at a time 

We are starting this campaign to help fund a few things that we will need on tour. With gig money we have built up, and money invested into our band, this will be the final piece in our plan to make this tour a tangible dream. 

Here is how our funds are set up:

We are asking for $2,000 and this is how it is split up.

$550- Music Gear: This includes: strings, power cords, drumsticks, drum heads, picks, extra tubes for 3 amps we will be using, and we would like to invest in some type of road cases for amps*.

Here is a list of the gear:

Guitar cables (backup)- $126.00 for 6 cables

Guitar picks- $4.00 for 6 dozen

Tubes for each guitar amp- $180.00 for 12 tubes

Guitar strings- $50.00 for a bundle of 12

Bass guitar strings- $60.00 for 3 sets of strings

Drumheads- $45.00 for a bundle pack of heads

Drumsticks- $85.00 for 10 pairs of sticks

*(This is not a necessity, but would be a very good investment) 

$350- Van repair: We bought a van back in January of this year from a local dealership and we got a good deal on it, but there are some repairs that need to be made before it is truly ready for the road up ahead. 

$500- Gas: We need gas to get from city to city. A necessity. No gas no tour.  

$400- Food: Yes, if not for the gas and food, this tour would not be possible. We have to fuel ourselves up to play shows and to keep peace amongst each other.

story: For the fourth summer in a row, the Salt Creek Chamber Orchestra will collaborate with some of the most talented singers in the Chicago area to present operas in concert.  This year's program includes Ralph Vaughan Williams' Riders to the Sea and Giacomo Puccini's Gianni Schicchi.  Entrance fees remain extremely low;  children 7 and under are free!  Your financial support is necessary (and appreciated) so that we can present you with an exceptional evening of opera.

story:
Hello world! We are Banded Starling, and we’re a band based in southern New Hampshire.

I (Priscilla) have been writing songs since I was 15. As my songwriting progressed, I began to share my music with the people I was closest to, and Pete was one of my first friends to hear my original music. It was only natural for the two of us to start playing together and share our love of music with anyone who would listen. After sharing our original music live throughout New Hampshire and Massachusetts, we are stoked to be able to give people something they can make a part of their lives beyond our performances. 

The material is ready--this Indiegogo campaign is the final step toward creating our first-ever professionally produced studio album.

This campaign is raising funds for our professionally recorded album with Mike Davidson, a Boston-based producer and engineer with 15+ years of experience working with both established and up-and-coming musicians. Together, we are digging into our original material with Mike, writing arrangements, and reaching out to local musicians to bring the songs to life.

We’ve been able to cover the costs of recording and producing one song, which is ready for you to check out right here on this page. This first song is called “Isabel,” and you can check it out below!


While we were able to fund the recording process for "Isabel" on our own, to create an album of songs of this quality, studio time costs add up quickly. With that said, this campaign can give us a unique opportunity to collaborate and make great art together. Your donation will cover following costs of my project:
 

1. Pre-Production: This is where everything starts. We will sit down with Mike to start crafting the arrangements for each of the songs that will go on the album. We’ll hold rehearsals to fine-tune the songs, arrangements, and talk through new and exciting ideas for how to approach the recording process.

2. Recording: This is when we enter the studio and start capturing the music and where the songs become what you'll hear on this album. This campaign will play a huge role in making sure we have enough time to capture great performances for every member of the band.

3. Mixing & Mastering: Each track will get mixed to create the right balance between instruments, texture and color that make up a track. As a final step, the album will be mastered from beginning to end, so the listening experience is cohesive and carefully choreographed from start to finish.

And what will you get for your generosity and support? So many awesome things!

We are so appreciative and grateful for any support you can lend to this campaign. In exchange for your generosity, We've put together a really exciting group of gifts that are available exclusively through your participation in this campaign.

Check out some examples below and a full list to the right!

It's hard to express how much this project would change our lives.

Music has this incredible ability to heal and unite people, to express feelings that help us feel connected in fundamental human ways. We're just a thread in life's tapestry but we hope to connect with the larger community through our music.

Music is also a great connector. The musician friends we've made on this journey are irreplaceable and have challenged and encouraged us to be better musicians ourselves and take more opportunities to share our music and our message.  As we add musicians to a project, the project morphs into a beautiful shared expression that could never be reached on our own. One of our hopes is that this project helps us find new collaborators in our networks to make more music together.

While we've never made a music project of this caliber, we put excellence into everything we approach. One of the best ways is to practice, experiment, and allow ourselves to lean into each project, and of course the music we create. With your support, we will channel that consistent work and experience into something new and beautiful that we (including you!) have made together.

If you're ready to contribute, just click the pink "Back It" button on the top right of this page! Every little bit counts, and we’re so grateful for all your support.

If you've got folks in your network that would be interested in supporting us please help get the word out and make some noise! There are social media share buttons on this page, and please tell your friends how grateful we are for this support.

Thank you so much for checking out our campaign page. We can't wait to share this music with you!

story:
Why a "samba" metronome?

There are no two ways about it: Practicing music with a metronome is essential to develop and improve your sense of rhythm. But is also soooo frustrating!

Brazilian musician and SambApp co-creator Pablo Regis wanted an organic way of practicing Brazilian musical genres. He wondered, “Instead of a traditional metronome, what if I had a portable percussionist in my back pocket to accompany me during those moments when I need a steady groove for practice or at live performances? Why isn’t there an 'App for That’?”

So, Pablo teamed up with his partner, Kate Spanos, a dancer and web developer, to develop a "samba metrnome app." Over the following year, the two of them toiled away to make the app a reality. With the help of friend Steve Sachse, a talented musician and sound engineer, they created the first successful prototype, SambApp 1.0. Pablo played each instrument and rhythm, Kate designed the interface and programmed the app code for iPhone, and Steve recorded the instruments and meticulously edited the sound files. The team spent hours upon hours in Steve's home studio, creating loops of the various rhythm clips and equalizing the recordings for optimal sound quality.

  

 

SambApp 2.0

We released SambApp 1.0 in December 2015. While we were happy with the results of the initial launch (and we are grateful to the friends who downloaded the app from the iTunes store), we have a lot of ideas for improvements. We learned a lot during the first attempt, and now we want to take SambApp to the next level and offer the app to a wider audience.

For SambApp 2.0, master percussionist and drummer Scott Kettner, bandleader of Nation Beat and creator of World Drum Lessons.com, will perform and manage music production and guest artist performances.

With interface upgrades, additional functionality, and improved sound quality, we will deliver an easy-to-use, professional sounding rhythm tool to Brazilian musicians and music fans all over the world. In the future, we want to expand this model to other traditional music styles, starting with rhythms and instruments from traditional Irish music, Latin American and Caribbean genres, and West African traditions, and then branching out to even more rhythmic styles.

  • Check out SambApp 1.0 in the iTunes Store: https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/sambapp/id1062145718?mt=8
  • For more information about SambApp, visit: http://www.sambajig.com/apps/
  • To find out more about Pablo and Kate's music and dance entertainment company Samba Jig Productions, visit: http://www.sambajig.com/

 

What Your Financial Support Delivers

We will add the following features with the release of SambApp 2.0:

Interface design improvements - $2,000

We have partnered with a professional smartphone app design company whose development team will clean up the SambApp interface by: 

  • Creating a more polished, professional look;
  • Developing an Android version of the app (in response to many requests!) to expand SambApp's reach;
  • Adding useful new features, such as the ability to program practice sessions and set up speed targets;
  • Adding a foot pedal function to start and stop loops;
  • Adding a visual metronome component;
  • Adding a tempo tap function as an alternative way to set your metronome speed;
  • Adding support for AirPlay, Audiobus, and inter-app audio.

Recording improvements - $4,000 (studio time) + $2,000 (artist fees)

Master percussionist and drummer Scott Kettner will perform and manage guest artist performances in a professional recording studio with a professional sound engineer. Scott will record new versions of existing rhythms and add new rhythm loops:

  • Rhythms include: samba, baião, xote, choro, partido alto, marchinha, frevo, capoeira, capoeira Angola, capoeira regional, capoeira benguela, and maracatu. 
  • Instruments include: pandeiro, triangle, berimbau, shaker, surdo, caixa, zabumba, conga, agogô, alfaia, tarrol, gonguê;
  • A professional sound editor will create tracks for accurate looping and efficient time-stretching.

Production costs - $800

Samba Jig co-founders Pablo and Kate will manage the development and sound teams to ensure a great-sounding product to distribute to the public. Production costs will go towards:

  • Management of iTunes and Android accounts;
  • Financial accounting;
  • Marketing and promotion.

TOTAL: $8,800

 

Perks

We appreciate any support you can give us! We are offering some awesome and appropriately themed perks. At the $25 giving level, you get a free download of the app on iPhone or Android once it's ready to download. 

 

The Impact

The idea is simple, but a percussion metronome is game-changing.

Anecdotal feedback is overwhelmingly exciting.  Musician and dancer friends agree that SambApp would transform their practice and performance experiences. People are already using SambApp 1.0 and they are eager for more innovative features and improvements.

We know what people want and need in their metronome.

SambApp will help you hone your skills with practice tools that help you learn the swing of Brazilian music and dance. The swing and "feel" of the rhythms are embedded in the loops as they are played on real instruments by professional musicians, and that human element will help you better connect to the music. Taking SambApp as a model, we also plan to expand to other cultural music forms in the future.

While SambApp does not replace a real percussionist, it is a reliable enhancement tool for any practice session or live performance. SambApp is invaluable for musicians and percussionists, who can rely on its steady beat while they improvise and create variations on top of that basic rhythm.

Support SambApp 2.0 and see how far we can take this.

 

Risks & Challenges

We learned from our many mistakes as we developed SambApp 1.0, and we feel confident in our new plan to move forward.

We already have a design team and sound team waiting for the funds to upgrade the design interface and sound looping of our app. 

We estimate the project to take 10-12 months, with a projected launch date of January 2019.

If we do not reach our entire goal, we will leverage your contributions to find corporate and private sponsors, as well as arts-funding organizations to complete the necessary funding. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We welcome any level of financial contribution, but your support of our fund-raising campaign can also be powerful in other ways:

  • Tell your friends! Share on social media! Write a song about it!
  • If you are a music or dance teacher, tell us how you would use the app to teach; if you are a music or dance student, tell us how the app could help you learn.
  • Download SambApp 1.0 from the iTunes Store and give us some feedback on other improvements you'd like to see (or give us the $2.99 you would have spent on the app...).
  • Make suggestions for the metronome based on your musical experience, even if you have experience with another musical style outside of Brazilian genres.

To receive updates about our upcoming projects and events, subscribe to the Samba Jig newsletter: http://www.sambajig.com/contact

The swing and "feel" of the rhythms are embedded in the loops as they are played on real instruments by professional musicians, and that human element will help you better connect to the music. Taking SambApp as a model, we also plan to expand to other cultural music forms in the future.
While SambApp does not replace a real percussionist, it is a reliable enhancement tool for any practice session or live performance. SambApp is invaluable for musicians and percussionists, who can rely on its steady beat while they improvise and create variations on top of that basic rhythm.
Support SambApp 2.0 and see how far we can take this.
 

Risks & Challenges
We learned from our many mistakes as we developed SambApp 1.0, and we feel confident in our new plan to move forward.
We already have a design team and sound team waiting for the funds to upgrade the design interface and sound looping of our app. 
We estimate the project to take 10-12 months, with a projected launch date of January 2019.
If we do not reach our entire goal, we will leverage your contributions to find corporate and private sponsors, as well as arts-funding organizations to complete the necessary funding. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We welcome any level of financial contribution, but your support of our fund-raising campaign can also be powerful in other ways:


Tell your friends! Share on social media! Write a song about it!
If you are a music or dance teacher, tell us how you would use the app to teach; if you are a music or dance student, tell us how the app could help you learn.
Download SambApp 1.0 from the iTunes Store and give us some feedback on other improvements you'd like to see (or give us the $2.99 you would have spent on the app...).

Make suggestions for the metronome based on your musical experience, even if you have experience with another musical style outside of Brazilian genres.

To receive updates about our upcoming projects and events, subscribe to the Samba Jig newsletter: http://www.sambajig.com/contact

story:
Who's Clara? What's Mayday? Are we sinking!?!? 

Me! The Album! I certainly hope not, and especially not if we are all on board!! 

about the clara delfina: 

I was born 7 feet tall, eating nothing but avocado and breathing nothing but music. As I grew from a sapling into an Elephant I started to travel. What began as a voyage through classical music, turned into a dance with the devil. As an angsty teen I got dragged down into the current of Irish music, then bluegrass, and finally (after years of telling my father to turn off his horribly scratchy field recordings) Old-Time. It was always there, at square dances, on the radio, in the old Ballads that he sang me to sleep with. It snuck into the different little songs and melodies I'd write. But I've been pretty head over heels, ever since I accidentally stuck my toe into the cold, dark, depths of traditional music. So here I am, 21, recording some sweet ballads and killer tunes, ready to party, and ready to cry! JOIN ME :D

about the album:

We recorded Mayday in Floyd, VA at studio 808A with Joe Dejarnette behind the sound board. Haakon Oyen, Landon George, and Jake Blount join me for a selection of stringband tunes and ballads. 

Mayday traditionally  marked the day that people would chase away winter and welcome spring. It's international workers day, it's a way of asking for help, and collectively, it's a symbol of hope.

I always knew I wanted my first album to pay tribute to the music from my grandmother. She grew up in New York, but the songs she learned from her mother traveled all the way from the Missouri Ozarks. After I finished up touring the UK as an old time duo (with welsh old-time player Ben Mcmanus) last spring, I decided it was finally time to embark on my first solo album- exploring the music of my family's past, while exploring what music means today and tomorrow. My grandmother's death in the summer,  fuelled the ready budding inspiration of exploring the way loss, death, and the past, influence love, life and the future. It's partially a dedication, and partially an exploration of community music and the way it helps bind people through troubled times, reminding people that winter always makes way for spring, and it's time to Welcome in the  May! 

what we're asking...

Unfortunately it is really expensive to tackle such a project, so I'm asking you for help!

  • All together, making this beautiful thing a reality is going to cost about $6,000. That's studio time, mixing/mastering, paying my lovely friends who are adding spicy instrumentation, album artwork design, and physical production costs. It's no easy task, but it's an exciting one! And very very doable. I have low-balled the goal a bit, with the hope that it will be more achievable and that if we are lucky, we may go over!   
  • Here's where it gets actually really seriously exciting, because I'm definitely not just asking you to throw money into a void, honestly, it might be interesting to see what happens to money in a void, but let's leave the experimenting to the scientists for the time being... In this case, you get, not only a warm fuzzy feeling that you helped to support arts, and preserving history, and community music and all that, but also it's your chance to get in on the excitement before the rest of the world! By joining the effort you will get an inside look at the recording process as well as a first listen to the album! If you're able to go the extra mile I am so thankful, and have listed a number of ways I want to show my appreciation! Anything from handwritten lyrics plus illustration to house concert, or also you can definitely suggest something, like some abstract art made from found objects on site while recording. 
  • I am definitely hoping that we will be able to make the goal, but there's always a chance it won't quite happen. If that is the case, the money that has already been donated is still greatly appreciated! This album is definitely happening, those monies will just have to hang tight for a little while for savings and loans to bump it up to where we need it. 

​​what do you get?

Well, I certainly hope it gets you out of your chair dancing, or maybe shedding a nostalgic tear? Music is all about forming connections and sharing experiences, so if nothing else, I hope that this is able to connect you to the past and the future. This has been a dark time for many people in different ways, politically, environmentally, personally, and I'm hoping that music, and it's magical way of pulling people together, will get us through this. It's a seed of hope! Additionally, you are a puzzle piece to this huge task of preserving and making history, that's no task for the faint of heart! Trad 4ever

if you can't spare a dime?

NO WORRIES! It's probably a good thing money doesn't grow on trees, because I'm sure a lot of trees would just rather be left alone, but it sure would be nice sometimes. We could always use an extra voice getting the word out! Share where you can! You can share the campaign directly from this page, or also have people look up the campaign on IndieGogo! Also sending love and singing with your friends and neighbours is appreciated, and generally a wonderful way to spend life. 

So much love! And thank you for whatever you can spare <3 

xx Clara Delfina

So much love! And thank you for whatever you can spare <3

story:
Short Summary

Hey there! I’m ZANDRA, a singer/songwriter based in Austin, Texas. I was raised in Houston where my father, a musician turned Episcopalian Priest instilled a love and appreciation of music in me. Every day on the way to school he would give my two little sisters and I musical lessons on everything from New Wave to Reggae. I started training and performing as a singer when I was a very little girl. I was the kid who always took choir and church solos WAY too seriously. I got very involved in musical theatre at age 7 and last summer I had the incredible opportunity to play Roxie Hart in “Chicago” the musical.

I wrote music as a little girl and quit for many years only out of a lack of believe in myself. I picked it back up in the summer of 2016 after returning from residential treatment for PTSD and exiting a very serious relationship. My entire world and identity felt like it had been ripped out from underneath me as I came to terms with the abuse in my childhood, a miscarriage I suffered and tried to stuff down and the collapse of a relationship that I thought was indestructible. I was so raw and full of emotion that I couldn’t help but start writing again. But this time I was able to see the beauty in my art and have decided to pursue it full force!

I've fully funded the record up to this point. I'm working 3+ jobs in addition to working on the record and I can only do so much. I really need your support to propel this dream into reality. 

This record is about love, lust, loss, finding your strength, breaking addictive cycles and celebration of freedom. I really believe in the music on this record. I believe in it’s ability to make you dance, get stuck in your head, make you think, allow you the space to grieve and empower you to feel strong and fabulous.

This has always been my biggest dream in life. With your help we are making it a reality and giving me the backing to get my music career started off strong! Your generosity and support truly means the world to me and I am incredibly grateful.

 

We Need & What You Get

I'm raising 6,000 that will cover the following

  • Finishing the record (Studio time, mixing and mastering, paying musicians)
  • Promoting the record (Various promotional/marketing costs) 
  • Music Video Budget (Gotta pay more talented artists!)
  • Rewards Budget (Sending you goodies and a small budget for our dope release party)

*REWARDS*

$10 Early Digital Release of my Debut EP "Curated Chaos" & Handwritten "thank you!" note and embroidered patch

$25 Signed copy of my Debut EP "Curated Chaos" on CD and Early Digital Release & Handwritten "thank you!" note & embroidered patch

$50 Two tickets to my Release Party/Concert & Signed copy of my Debut EP "Curated Chaos" on CD and Early Digital Release & Handwritten "thank you!" note &  embroidered patch

$100 Cover of your choice & Four tickets to my Release Party/Concert & Signed copy of my Debut EP "Curated Chaos" on CD and Early Digital Release & Handwritten "thank you!" note & embroidered patch

$200+ Executive Producer Credit & Cover of your choice & Four tickets to my Release Party/Concert & Signed copy of my Debut EP "Curated Chaos" on CD and Early Digital Release & Handwritten "thank you!" note &  embroidered patch

The Impact

I've powered through so much in my short but challenging lifetime. I'm ready to rise and help others do the same through my art. I want to not only create music that makes you move but that makes you feel strong, empowered and free to be who you are. 

Determined is my middle name and I love nothing more than rising to a challenge. You can be assured that your backing is going to be used wisely and I will be working as hard as possible on my end to create something that we can all be proud for being a part of. 

Can you see yourself bragging to your friends that you were one of my initial backers in the not so distant future when my music comes on the radio? Because I can. ;)

Other Ways You Can Help

Following my pages and helping me promote my content is a huge help!

On Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/musicbyZANDRA/

And Instagram @musicbyZANDRA

Liking and commenting (even an emojii will do!) on my content boosts it so other people see it on their feeds as well. Sharing my music, pages and content ensures people will see it!

In closing I truly appreciate your support. I wouldn't be able to do it without you! I am beyond excited to get this ball rolling and makes these dreams a reality.

story:
Why the need for The Big WOW?

In an ever changing society, with rents and property prices increasing everywhere, it's getting harder for creative people to find and use spaces needed to facilitate the production of new music.  This campaign is about helping us renovate a new space in Sheffield to do just that.

  • We are a big group of musicians and friends who love everything about music
  • We bring collectively, decades of live music experience, from places like Club 60
  • We need help renovating this new space to help us rehearse, record & perform music
  • Help us to help others record or perform music in Sheffield

This is an opportunity to help us achieve that goal - it's what we like to do!

 

How can you help us?

People power and our time is not a problem - we are a big team with lot's of helpers! 

Our biggest hurdle is paying for building materials, a lot of which are specialist and therefore expensive.

We have already raised & invested about 25% of the funds required to complete this project, enough to allow us to start the renovation process.   People's generosity and time means we  already raised money and built a new floor - that alone cost £2500 just in materials!  Putting a heating system in cost us £1500 - again, not including the people time needed to intsall.

Big space = Big costs

Here is the most important thing we need help with financing though...

Sound proofing!

(This is our most expensive hurdle to overcome)

Making & playing music has a side product of noise.  Because we are developing this old workshop in an area of Sheffield that is also seeing residential properties being built, we have to make sure that everybody is happy!  We anticipate that this alone is nearly 60-70% of our required total.

In order to do this we have to invest in

  • Professional floating sound boarding
  • Double glazed glass units for the windows
  • Birch-wood window shutters, providing additional insulation and security
  • Proper sound-proofed doors

 

And other things...

We need help with some other items too - not quite as important, but still needed.  

(By that we mean if we don't hit our target it's not the end of the world, they will just have to come later rather than sooner, but it would be really helpful to us now if we could also raise funds to get these installed as soon as possible!)

  • All doors to be "uber" fire exits (and not just "normal" doors)
  • Brand new electrics throughout (including nice mood lighting)
  • Fully clean, restore and seal all metal-work to preserve the industrial heritage
  • A nice new toilet (everybody loves a prisitne loo!)
  • Nice new kitchen area too - cuppa anyone?

 

What it means to us

It's not everyday a new opportunity arises to work on such an exciting venture.  Here are a  few reasons why we are motivated to spend so much time and effort and why we are asking for your finacial help...

  • we believe new music is always needed - this space will help bring that
  • our shared experinces and history of Club60 brought to a new space
  • help keep Sheffield's only analogue recording studio housed and functioning
  • a place to host events that are truely supportive for artists
 

And a great big thank you xxxx

Regardless, we are so grateful for your contributions to The Big WOW. Even the smallest of donations can help and we apprecaite every penny and pound we recieve.  If you are unable to support us financially at this time you can instead share this campaign with your friends and family. Your willingness to share this project and ask for support on our behalf is of incredible value to our mission. And we thank you for that!

With love and gratitude, 

The Big WOW team x

story:
I'm Su and I play banjo and fiddle! 

Its really about time I got a descent fiddle for the gigs and sessions I play in!! 

I bought a fiddle on eBay as a restoration project and found that it is a VERY nice fiddle that I could only do so much to restore it and also with help from friends to work on it too. But it needs expert attention for it to be fully playable. 

The fiddle is now with the surgeon and it'll be due early Feb hopefully in time for the FOAOTMAD Festival in Gainsborough!

 

Please help contribute toward this lovely fiddle.

It is a copy of a Hopf made in Germany, early 20th century.

I strung it up for a few sessions and one gig and many have said it sounds a lot better! It is a beautiful thing and I look forward to playing more tunes on it.

story:
Be Part of The Experience

My music comes from my heart, my life, and even beyond me.  It is the bridge between where you are and where your soul wants to go. It is the anticipation of something beautiful about to happen.  The words are honest and uplifting. The vocals are clear, soulful, and warm. The sound is soulful house, using textures and rhythms that make you want to move. This is The Courtney Hinton Experience.

 

 

Now Is The Time

It became obvious to me that I have a passion and a gift to inspire and pour into the growth of others after years of working in the field of public health.  While I was rewarded by supporting people in that way, there was still something missing. Then, at the end of 2015, I became severely ill and was hospitalized. I was in such a low place that my thoughts were entertaining death as a welcome respite.  In that moment, music was my only comfort. I knew then my purpose for being on this planet and that the music inside of me could be used as salvation for others.

 

In the years that would follow, I gave myself permission to live out that dream of singing that I’ve had since childhood. I began offering that gift to the world more and revisiting songs that came to me all the way back in 2010.  I’ve reached the place where I need to invite more people on my journey to fulfill its purpose. Join me! Let’s make something beautiful happen.

 

About This Project’s Sound

While training as a runner and during my first full marathon, I found the songs that gave me the push I needed to make it to the finish line were house songs; positive and inspiring with a powerful rhythm.  Because of the inspiring effect house music had on me spiritually, I began seeing running as a time for not only physical fitness, but also spiritual fitness. This project can serve as your soundtrack for your soul’s marathon.

 

Why Join Me?

By supporting this project, you expand what’s possible not just for me, but for everyone who will be touched by it.  My close friends and family who have heard some of the songs say they use the music as a tool to unwind from a long day or to inspire them to move forward in life with grace.

As I began to work on this project, it was clear I could not fund it entirely on my own.  My fundraising goal is slightly under the project budget, but it is my hope that this campaign will exceed its' target and will be sufficient for all project related expenses.

Your contributions will go towards:

  • studio time, producer fees, equipment for recording and creating
  • registration, copyright fees and distribution costs
  • creating a professional marketing campaign and web presence
  • maintaining my vocal health by funding my ongoing vocal development
  • music equipment and software needed to create and perform
  • compensate other artists and supporters on the project

Possible Challenges

 

Locating My “Soul” Mates

I want to make sure that I have the right sound for this project, which means locating musicians who have an understanding of what the vibe of inspirational and soulful house music is all about.

 

On Time and On Purpose

This project is slated for completion and release in Autumn 2019. I anticipate that timing and scheduling may be a challenge in the coordination of all the project's moving parts.

 

Foresight and Experience

Years of collaborative creative work have given me a realistic idea of all that could potentially go wrong. To prepare,  I have developed relationships with R Street Studios in Washington, DC where I intend to do most of the recording. I have a solid relationship with the owner, who is already mentoring me on audio engineering and I can use that knowledge on my own to make my time in the studio efficient. I also have a relationship with the producer of the track “Never Too Late”.  We have a process in place to make our collaborative time effective.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You taking the time to read my campaign means so much to me!  And you can support this project in other ways as well.

 

  • Share it with everyone you know and meet:
    • Invite others to know who I am and what my music is about.
    • Send text messages, share palm cards, give my business cards and repost on social media.  The more eyes that see this campaign means more hearts can be touched.
  • Use or refer me for special events:
    • I’m available to be booked for your Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Year Parties and church services.  
    • Tell your corporate party planners, church staff, and your friends.
  • Provide an in-kind donation:
    • I’m in need of equipment, studio time, graphic designers, photographers, videographers, audio producers, and a publicist.
    • If you or anyone you know fits this description, or have these items, please reach out to me.
  • Help me share The Experience:
    • Know of a place looking for a performer? Let me know.
    • I’m offering Christmas caroling this year, so if you know places where I would be welcomed, let me know.
story_txt:
Be Part of The ExperienceMy music comes from my heart, my life, and even beyond me.  It is the bridge between where you are and where your soul wants to go. It is the anticipation of something beautiful about to happen.  The words are honest and uplifting. The vocals are clear, soulful, and warm. The sound is soulful house, using textures and rhythms that make you want to move. This is The Courtney Hinton Experience.  Now Is The TimeIt became obvious to me that I have a passion and a gift to inspire and pour into the growth of others after years of working in the field of public health.  While I was rewarded by supporting people in that way, there was still something missing. Then, at the end of 2015, I became severely ill and was hospitalized. I was in such a low place that my thoughts were entertaining death as a welcome respite.  In that moment, music was my only comfort. I knew then my purpose for being on this planet and that the music inside of me could be used as salvation for others. In the years that would follow, I gave myself permission to live out that dream of singing that I’ve had since childhood. I began offering that gift to the world more and revisiting songs that came to me all the way back in 2010.  I’ve reached the place where I need to invite more people on my journey to fulfill its purpose. Join me! Let’s make something beautiful happen. About This Project’s SoundWhile training as a runner and during my first full marathon, I found the songs that gave me the push I needed to make it to the finish line were house songs; positive and inspiring with a powerful rhythm.  Because of the inspiring effect house music had on me spiritually, I began seeing running as a time for not only physical fitness, but also spiritual fitness. This project can serve as your soundtrack for your soul’s marathon. Why Join Me?By supporting this project, you expand what’s possible not just for me, but for everyone who will be touched by it.  My close friends and family who have heard some of the songs say they use the music as a tool to unwind from a long day or to inspire them to move forward in life with grace.As I began to work on this project, it was clear I could not fund it entirely on my own.  My fundraising goal is slightly under the project budget, but it is my hope that this campaign will exceed its' target and will be sufficient for all project related expenses.Your contributions will go towards:
studio time, producer fees, equipment for recording and creating
registration, copyright fees and distribution costs
creating a professional marketing campaign and web presence
maintaining my vocal health by funding my ongoing vocal development
music equipment and software needed to create and perform
compensate other artists and supporters on the project
Possible Challenges Locating My “Soul” MatesI want to make sure that I have the right sound for this project, which means locating musicians who have an understanding of what the vibe of inspirational and soulful house music is all about. On Time and On PurposeThis project is slated for completion and release in Autumn 2019. I anticipate that timing and scheduling may be a challenge in the coordination of all the project's moving parts. Foresight and ExperienceYears of collaborative creative work have given me a realistic idea of all that could potentially go wrong. To prepare,  I have developed relationships with R Street Studios in Washington, DC where I intend to do most of the recording. I have a solid relationship with the owner, who is already mentoring me on audio engineering and I can use that knowledge on my own to make my time in the studio efficient. I also have a relationship with the producer of the track “Never Too Late”.  We have a process in place to make our collaborative time effective. Other Ways You Can HelpYou taking the time to read my campaign means so much to me!  And you can support this project in other ways as well. 
Share it with everyone you know and meet:
Invite others to know who I am and what my music is about.
Send text messages, share palm cards, give my business cards and repost on social media.  The more eyes that see this campaign means more hearts can be touched.


Use or refer me for special events:
I’m available to be booked for your Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Year Parties and church services.  
Tell your corporate party planners, church staff, and your friends.


Provide an in-kind donation:
I’m in need of equipment, studio time, graphic designers, photographers, videographers, audio producers, and a publicist.
If you or anyone you know fits this description, or have these items, please reach out to me.


Help me share The Experience:
Know of a place looking for a performer? Let me know.
I’m offering Christmas caroling this year, so if you know places where I would be welcomed, let me know.

story:
Story of Jaymison

Jaymison began in late 2016. What started out as a hangout with my friends Dan and Taylor turned into something I've now enjoyed for years. I named my project 'Jaymison' after a kid I've known for a while who lives in a low income area in Tennessee. The whole point of continuing and doing this project is to tell stories, whether they be mine or someone else's.

Yellow Squash

After moving up north and not doing music at any capacity life kind of found me in a position where things were pretty good. But, as it usually goes with life, things went in a different direction both with relationships and goals in life. On a whim I decided to record with someone a good friend recommended. Me and (now great friend) Chris Riley tracked 5 songs in June of this year. 

After listening to what we tracked I choose to put out this song called "Yellow Squash". 

Once it was out for a week or so I found out that Spotify got a hold of it and put it on their "Fresh Finds" playlist as well as some other of their own curated playlists. It was weird and strange, I ended up getting emails, texts from folks who enjoyed the song. Even had a small label in Europe ask if they could re-distribute the song.

Calmate

The cool thing is that before and after releasing the song I've been able to write almost 25 other songs.  A lot of these songs come from a similar place like Yellow Squash does. Most of them are written with a common theme. The over-arching theme is being calm and collected in the storm. With that being said, the album title is called Calmate....which is Spanish simply means to "calm one's self".

HLP (plz if u can)

To be transparent, it costs a good amount of money to make a decent-sounding album. So instead of being a quiet guy and just tracking the dang thing I'm in need of some help - your GUYS' help. 

I'm stoked because I've gotta pretty good feeling that these songs have a capacity to not just sound BANGIN' but for them to also gain some traction.

If you're still reading this then coolio! Look to the right side and see if one of these donation packages fits your budget and also gives you something you'd either wear or listen to.

Cool Swag yo

Idk if you like cool t-shirts, but here's an example of the Yellow Squash t's :)

haha, don't know why that picture is so big. Anyways, thanks for giving!

story:
Well, what's a fella to do- songs keep happening and needing proper attention and that requires money. I've been fortunate to have made four quality albums. My last one was funded by crowd sourcing so hopefully folks will see fit to come back for another installment. I'm really excited to be working with Gregory Lattimer. We did one song and it spun me right 'round. He is a very caring human and a rarity in general, much less in the music industry. I could go on about how hard the biz is but I think that's been pretty well established. I can only say that hard or not, i have to keep going. 

I'm stoked to have this thing pressed to vinyl, a first for me. I'm sad to not be getting CDs but so many people tell me that they don't even have players! Compact disc is brand new technology where i come from! If there are any perks out there that y'all would like for me to consider, feel free to let me know! Thanks so much for your interest here. I do not take it lightly. Cheers!

story:
Who am I ? 

I am Scalawag, or more commonly known as Teo

I've been playing and writing music with different bands around Smithers and Vancouver for the past five years. I'm an actor, dancer, and musician. It's time to embark on this project of releasing my first album of solo material.  But I need your help!

You can listen to my music on soundcloud and YouTube 

https://soundcloud.com/thescalawag

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC40deW5GMnFYGn...?

Or go to my website:

https://thescalawagmusic.simvoly.com/

What do I need? and why...

$2500 may seem like a lot to record and produce an album, but it's actually the opposite. Because I've recorded the entire album myself, with the help of my closest friend Zak, I've saved tremendous amounts of money that would have been spent on studio time and hiring an engineer/producer. For a full length album, $2500 is actually a very reasonable price to be able to print an entire run of albums, and pay the artists who created designed the album artwork, which at this point, is all I need.

$1400 will go towards the actual physical printing of 250 CDs in gorgeous full colour cases with a book insert. 

$90 is what I will need to distribute our song onto iTunes, Amazon and CD baby in order for online downloads of the album to be possible. (it will also be available on Bandcamp) 

$125 (5%) will go to Indiegogo for the fee of using their amazing service

$75 (3%) is the fee for using PayPal or Credit cards to accept backing donations. 

$200 is what I need to put on a rocking album release party and distribute all of the albums and swag to their deserving owners. 

$440 is what I have agreed to pay the artist of the album artwork (Emerenne Saefkow)

$250 is what I have agreed to pay the Designer of the album artwork (Hans Saefkow)

Any funds I raise above our goal will go towards creating Music Videos, as well as funding more creative projects!

Independently producing an album is in my opinion the best way to record an album. Recording usually takes a lot of money and a lot of communication. apart from exhausting nights being cooped up alone hitting record over and over again until it sounds perfect, recording it myself has eliminated the large budget that I would have needed to fund such a project, and given me total creative control. I am simply getting by with a little help from my friends, and the occasional late night jam sessions to keep me sane. 

Perks, oh the perks!

Alongside the invaluable experience of backing an independent project and helping me get my feet on the ground, we also have some sweet sweet perks that will give you even more satisfaction from helping us out. 

With my perk system based off different levels of civil disobedience, you will receive a wide variety of goodies. From a digital download of the album a week before everyone else, to an entire concept album written about you, whether you want to be a follower, a Traitor, or even a Scalawag yourself, every little bit helps tremendously to make this dream a reality!

Even if you can't contribute money, you can still help me out!

I understand that not everybody is able to help out monetarily, but you can still help me make this project a success! help me out by sharing this indiegogo page, (they make it really easy by having buttons up at the top of this page) or by telling your friends about this project, and I will be tremendously thankful! 

 

Thank you so much! :)

Teo

Scalawag

story:
Welcome! 

The Ladles (Katie Martucci, Caroline Kuhn and Lucia Pontoniere) met in 2014 at the New England Conservatory of Music. The only three women in their undergraduate program, Katie, Caroline and Lucia decided to start a band. Hours spent playing together in the dorms led to performances at friends' house concerts and local Boston venues. By the following year, they were living together in Cambridge and performing as The Ladles (a name fashioned after a mislabeled "ladies room" bathroom sign). 

Recording a full length album has been a goal of ours for a long time. Since putting out our EP two years ago, our sound has deepened and matured. It's important to us that we have this music recorded to capture what we've been working on (and give our fans more than 5 songs to listen to ;-)

We feel so privileged and excited to have the opportunity to share our music and connect with our community in this way. Your contribution is quite literally bringing this music to life - Thank you so much! 

How it works

We are hoping to raise $15,000 in 40 days. This money will cover our recording expenses (studio time, engineer and producer fees) as well as compensating our featured guest musicians. Funds will also help to distribute and promote the final product. We want as many people to hear this album as possible!

We have lots of prizes for those who are able to donate. Signed copies of the pre-ordered album, homemade jam, handmade jewelry, unique and personalized jingles, or a house concert in your very living room!

You can help us by donating, sharing, listening, and interacting with us on this recording journey! Every little bit helps.

Keep in touch! We’ll be posting updates from the studio to keep everyone involved in the process. Find us on Facebook, Instagram, and at www.theladles.com.

* * * * * 

“Masters of three-part harmony, The Ladles – comprising Katie Martucci, Caroline Kuhn and Lucia Pontoniere – blend swing, old-time, folk and more to create a handcrafted, downhome sound that brings to mind nights spent making music on the back porch while fireflies flit about and good friends catch up. The sound is spacious and lovely. With instrumentation that impresses, harmonies that inspire and an ability to capture the richness of the folk tradition without getting stuck in the past, The Ladles is a quiet stand out of the roots genre.”

- CJ / Goodtimes SC

 

"The Ladles have been my go-to band for most settings over the past 3 years- I’ve seen them perform live over 15 times and definitely consider myself to be one of their biggest fans. Achingly beautiful lyrics and some of the tightest three-part harmonies known to this world, there is no one to whom I wouldn’t recommend this unstoppable girl group. My only criticism is that a 5 song EP is simply not enough! We need more!"

-concerned fan, Seraphina Mallon-Breiman

 

"Wish I could turn the hands of time FORWARD to when the Ladles finish their album - sick of listening to this 20 minute EP! It barely gets me to the grocery store and back..." 

- Severus Snape
