story:
Our Story

The Berlin Opera Group is a brand new opera group based in Germany.  We are a group of international singers and musicians from America, Scotland, Israel, Brazil, Germany, Spain, France, Serbia, and Australia, and we have come together with our shared love for beautiful music in order to bring that music to life on stage.  Our goal is to combine quality, beauty, passion, and sincerity in a magical creation of art. We were founded in a living room in Schöneberg, Berlin at the start of 2016, and what started as a simple vision has grown into a wonderful project that will bring audiences of all ages and backgrounds together to enjoy this unique art form.  

Because of your support, we were able to put on three full operas with orchestra: Mozart's Le Nozze di Figaro, at the ehemaliges stummfilmkino Delphi Theater Berlin in May 2016, Puccini's La Boheme, at the Brotfabrik Berlin in October 2016, and  R. Strauss's Ariadne auf Naxos at the Pfefferberg Theater Berlin in April 2017.  Because of our previous three successes which were only made possible because of YOU, we are now working on our FOURTH opera, Don Giovanni by W.A. Mozart.  Mozart's Don Giovanni is one of his most famous and beautiful works.  It is a dark story of betrayal, revenge, and justice, all with a light-heartedness that is characteristic of Mozart's operas.  The Berlin Opera Group will perform the work with two stellar casts and a chamber ensemble at the Pfefferberg Theater (again, yay!) in Berlin on October 13th, 14th (2 shows), and 15th.  We are so excited to put on this dark and beautiful opera, and now more than ever we need YOUR help once again! 

You can check out our website here to learn more about our team and get more information about our fourth opera: www.theberlinoperagroup.com

You can also check out our wonderful theater where we will put on our opera here: http://pfefferberg-theater.de/

 

What We Need & What You Get

This is where we need your help.  To put on Don Giovanni, we will need to raise about $7,000.  There are so many costs involved in putting on an opera including the venue, pianist, orchestra, rehearsal spaces, costumes, marketing material, and the set.  Your generous donations will make it possible for us to put on our fourth opera in October.  

Here is an exact breakdown of what we are trying to raise for Don Giovanni:

Venue for 4 performances: $2,500

Lighting Designer for 4 nights: $800

Set, costumes, and props: $800

Pianist fee for all rehearsals and performances: $500

Posters and marketing materials: $300

Rehearsal space: $600

Conductor and Orchestra: $1,500

Total Cost: $7,000

Every donation you give gets you a special perk-from a postcard from Berlin, a CD of duets and arias from the cast of The Berlin Opera Group, to a DVD and a ticket for our performance of Don Giovanni!  Plus, anyone who donates will get their name printed in our program for the opera. The perk you get depends on the amount you donate.  You can see which donation gets you which perk on the right side of this page! 

 

The Impact

Our mission is to create performance opportunities for ourselves and fellow singers in a setting we can be proud of and our audiences can be moved by, while upholding the quality and integrity of this beautiful art form.

By donating, you will help us on our next step to a professional career.  With your help, we will gain performance experience, build our repertoire, be heard by important audience members, and become ready for the big stages in Germany, simultaneously making opera alive and accessible to modern and diverse audiences in Berlin.Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, or if you want to help us even more, you can also help by sharing our campaign and posting this link on all the social networking websites like Facebook, Google +, Twitter, and even e-mail! We will appreciate every little thing you do!

Vielen, vielen Dank für Alles!
story_txt: Our StoryThe Berlin Opera Group is a brand new opera group based in Germany.  We are a group of international singers and musicians from America, Scotland, Israel, Brazil, Germany, Spain, France, Serbia, and Australia, and we have come together with our shared love for beautiful music in order to bring that music to life on stage.  Our goal is to combine quality, beauty, passion, and sincerity in a magical creation of art. We were founded in a living room in Schöneberg, Berlin at the start of 2016, and what started as a simple vision has grown into a wonderful project that will bring audiences of all ages and backgrounds together to enjoy this unique art form.  Because of your support, we were able to put on three full operas with orchestra: Mozart's Le Nozze di Figaro, at the ehemaliges stummfilmkino Delphi Theater Berlin in May 2016, Puccini's La Boheme, at the Brotfabrik Berlin in October 2016, and  R. Strauss's Ariadne auf Naxos at the Pfefferberg Theater Berlin in April 2017.  Because of our previous three successes which were only made possible because of YOU, we are now working on our FOURTH opera, Don Giovanni by W.A. Mozart.  Mozart's Don Giovanni is one of his most famous and beautiful works.  It is a dark story of betrayal, revenge, and justice, all with a light-heartedness that is characteristic of Mozart's operas.  The Berlin Opera Group will perform the work with two stellar casts and a chamber ensemble at the Pfefferberg Theater (again, yay!) in Berlin on October 13th, 14th (2 shows), and 15th.  We are so excited to put on this dark and beautiful opera, and now more than ever we need YOUR help once again! You can check out our website here to learn more about our team and get more information about our fourth opera: www.theberlinoperagroup.comYou can also check out our wonderful theater where we will put on our opera here: http://pfefferberg-theater.de/ What We Need & What You GetThis is where we need your help.  To put on Don Giovanni, we will need to raise about $7,000.  There are so many costs involved in putting on an opera including the venue, pianist, orchestra, rehearsal spaces, costumes, marketing material, and the set.  Your generous donations will make it possible for us to put on our fourth opera in October.  Here is an exact breakdown of what we are trying to raise for Don Giovanni:Venue for 4 performances: $2,500Lighting Designer for 4 nights: $800Set, costumes, and props: $800Pianist fee for all rehearsals and performances: $500Posters and marketing materials: $300Rehearsal space: $600Conductor and Orchestra: $1,500Total Cost: $7,000Every donation you give gets you a special perk-from a postcard from Berlin, a CD of duets and arias from the cast of The Berlin Opera Group, to a DVD and a ticket for our performance of Don Giovanni!  Plus, anyone who donates will get their name printed in our program for the opera. The perk you get depends on the amount you donate.  You can see which donation gets you which perk on the right side of this page!  The ImpactOur mission is to create performance opportunities for ourselves and fellow singers in a setting we can be proud of and our audiences can be moved by, while upholding the quality and integrity of this beautiful art form.By donating, you will help us on our next step to a professional career.  With your help, we will gain performance experience, build our repertoire, be heard by important audience members, and become ready for the big stages in Germany, simultaneously making opera alive and accessible to modern and diverse audiences in Berlin.Other Ways You Can HelpEven if you can't donate, or if you want to help us even more, you can also help by sharing our campaign and posting this link on all the social networking websites like Facebook, Google +, Twitter, and even e-mail! We will appreciate every little thing you do!Vielen, vielen Dank für Alles!

story:
Summary!

Chil is preparing to record at the famous Motor Museum in Liverpool, England. The studio has been home to many artists such as The Black Keys, The 1975, The Arctic Monkeys, and Two Door Cinema Club.

In England, Chil will be partnering with producer and engineer, Al Groves, to create a new EP. Al is known for his work on Bring Me the Horizon’s #1 album, That’s the Spirit. This EP will be shared with numerous press outlets, radio, and many new fans in order to bring the band closer to mainstream success.

Funding details

Details on what we need: 

  • In order for us to record in England it will cost around $3,511.79 per band member to make the trek to England.  These costs include flights, recording fees, lodging expenses, etc. 
  • All money raised will go towards our dream of recording in the Motor Museum studio!

The Impact: Our Story!

We've been through so much together over the last 10 years as a band meeting our musical heroes, meeting tons of great people from shows and traveling , and seeing so much support from our fans at home. This opportunity means so much to all of us in Chil, and we want to bring you the absolute best we can. Recording at The Motor Museum gives us an unprecedented chance to chase our dreams across the ocean.  

It's a studio that has been used by many big name bands in the early stages of their careers. We'll be following in the footsteps of some of our favorite bands, like The Black Keys, The 1975, Oasis, and Two Door Cinema Club.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute there are other ways you can help!

  • Help by spreading the word by simply sharing our campaign with friends and family 
  • Follow us on social media!  We love being able to connect with our audience.

story:
YOU helped to fund ‘sings The Bodysnatchers’, the lost 2 Tone album of tracks we played live, but never recorded for release! It was a great success and we are still very happy with the resulting CD and vinyl LP.

Then, YOU took a chance on funding an EP, not knowing what it would contain, in a musical sense, but YOU trusted us and we delivered! ‘The LoTek Four, Vol I’ was released fully earlier this year on limited edition CD and 7” vinyl EP. Nearly sold out now, it has been very well received, especially by our live audience.

Now, we are asking YOU again. Will YOU trust us once more? ‘The LoTek Four, Vol II’ is waiting to be laid down for your listening pleasure. We may have played at least one of the tracks live and it/they may have gone down very well. For those of YOU having faith in us, there will be a free bonus track!

My name is Rhoda Dakar and I started my musical career in all-female 2Tone band, The Bodysnatchers. I went on to perform with The Specials and was a member of The Special AKA, who released 'The Boiler', a tale of date rape before there was a term for it, and 'Free Nelson Mandela'. I have continued my association with the former 2 Tone alumni, guesting on vocals with Madness' 'On The Town', from 'The Liberty Of Norton Folgate', and tour DJ for The Specials' UK tour, joining them on vocals for the encore. I am currently touring the UK; information and tickets are available here: https://www.musicglue.com/rhoda-dakar/listings

story:
BIO

KYRIE’s swerving through these L.A. streets with a Baltimore mentality and edgy style. Since the age of 9, KYRIE has been writing her own lyrics and performing in front of a live audience every chance she gets. As “KYRIE”, she has since performed at the AFRAM Festival, on the Apollo Theater stage twice, auditioned for multiple rounds of the hit show “X Factor USA”, and independently released tracks such as “Bring Me Down” and “Curry", which followed up with a video that was written about by Revolt TV and Dunk 360. "I've wanted this since I was 7 years old," says KYRIE. "I moved on my own at 18 to a completely different coast just to make sure this career happens for me." With the release of her latest freestyle "Sriracha" and her upcoming festival performances, KYRIE is definitely one to watch. 

 

Contributors will help KYRIE progress as an artist and ultimately propel her one step forward towards her goal of a small tour. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • How much funding is needed: $3,200
  • PERKS!!!!!

    • $12 donation - pre-release download and a handwritten thank you

    • $50 donation - pre-release download, handwritten thank you, and exclusive BTS Vlogs of the project process  

    • $100+ donation - pre-release, handwritten thank you, exclusive vlogs, a signed hard copy of the EP, and poster 

  • Where does your money go?
    • Production 
    • Post-production
    • Marketing the project

The Impact

I fell in love with music at a very young age and I can't imagine my life without it. I've been creating new content and preparing for this project for over half a year now. Being a financially independent 22 year old away from family makes it challenging to push quality content at a consistent rate. Your help at this stage would allow me to reach my goals by exposing me to a larger audience and further my career and I will be forever grateful for your love and support!

Please share this campaign with as many as you can! We can do this!

story:
That’s why I’m turning towards you, my dear fans ( What ????Yes, l’m sure you are one of them, are you not?!!! If you just answered no, I’m sure you will become one, once you have listened to some of my music....  ? You are my fan now, right ?) , friends, family, friends of my friends, maybe even Unknown people, or people I met one time randomly, one day, somewhere, somehow ..... maybe in the street, the underground, a pub’s bathroom, during one of my past gigs, or elsewhere ... 

So If you are this person maybe you can help me make it happen. Through pre-ordering the record via Indiegogo, you will contribute to the creation of the first Manchild On The Moon’s EP. 

All funds are to be raised through pre-ord.

I need 4000 (or more) euros for 4 songs to  be recorded in co-Working With Sam Navel a great sound engineer who’s work I love to bits ( Cascadeur, Puggy, Mr Hanky, Brian Johnson, Tinderstiks....)

So, if you appreciate my Music, my soul and my overall vibe, i’m sure you are the good person « My guardian Angel » to help my project see daylight as soon as possible. 

If you don’t Know anything about Manchild On The Moon yet, it’s time for you to get to know about it right now ! 

Just listen and let yourself float away.

____________________

WHO IS MANCHILD ON THE MOON ? 

Golden night, where masks are falling down, leaving sincerity and love to glide over the city.

Begin a sensual trip, lifted up by this voice that is calling you, cradled by this lunar and airy melody.

Let yourself be taken away within a note, into a bewitched Dreampop, midway between obscurity and the eternal beauty of the moon

___________________

WHAT I NEED  / WHAT YOU GET 

The goal for this Indiegogo is 4000€. 

4000 euros for 4 songs.

Recorded, mixed, mastered and SDRM’ed  (it is a very french thing: I need to pay to produce a “material” version of my EP) and, obviously, pressing CD’s. 

If the final balance amounts to more than 4000 euros (yes, my dream could come true) it will really help me promote finished project and get the most light possible shined upon it.

The very first step would be:  Create a good Music video, and after that, if The money allows it, and thanks to your generous donation, take care of my project, and see that it gets the right kind of management. This includes spending time finding the right label to assist me with growth, blasting my music over the web, radio and all other media platforms… and maybe thiking about a Vinyl version.

Of course, In exchange of your donation you will be entitled to some sweet rewards that either will ONLY be available to YOU, or, you will receive them way before ANYONE else has the opportunity to! 

______________________

THE IMPACT

First, it’s a big risk and challenge for me personally, for my feelings and for all the work and heart I have been putting into this «dream come true-to be » up until now .

If we manage to make this EP TOGETHER , It would finally give me The opportunity to defend my art correctly, and reward all the time and energy I have put in to this project over the years and would enable us to show the world WHO Manchild On The Moon really is. 

______________________

YOU

    •    If you don’t have the possibility to contribute, what I obviously understand, you can still help me by sharing, sharing and..... sharing AGAIN! The more eyes get to see it, the better the chances for success are! I ( Manchild ) will post updates, pictures, and a few clips for you to listen to/watch at... lots of opportunities to share what's been going on! 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

VERSION FRANÇAISE 

Avec votre aide nous allons ensemble, écrire, mixer masteriser et.... sortir mon premier EP.

 

Après quelques années à écrire, composer, chanter et jouer sur scène en France et en Suisse, je suis prêt aujourd’hui, à enregistrer mon premier EP. 

Petit rappel, un Ep est un mini album, 4 titres. 

C’est pourquoi je me tourne vers vous mes chers fans, (Quoi ? Bien sûr que j’ai des fans, t’es MON fan toi non?) amis, famille, amis de mes amis, peut-être cette personne inconnue, un jour croisée au détour d’une rue, d’un métro... durant l’un de mes derniers concerts .

Alors si tu es cette personne, peut être que tu pourrais m’aider à rendre tout cela possible. En participant à mon projet Indiegogo, tu vas contribuer à la réalisation de l’EP. 

J’ai besoin de 4000 euros(ou plus) pour enregistrer 4 titres en co-travaillant avec le magnifique et talentueux ingénieur du son Sam Navel, qui a travaillé entre autre avec ( Cascadeur, Puggy, Mr Hanky, Brian Johnson, Tindersticks....)

Alors si tu aimes ma musique, mon âme, mon énergie,  je suis certain que TU ES la bonne personne, mon ange gardien pour mener à bien mon projet. 

Si tu ne sais rien à propos de Manchild On The Moon il est maintenant temps de savoir ! 

Écoute, et laisse toi porter.....

 

_____________________

Ce dont j’ai besoin, ce que vous recevez en échange.

 

L’objectif de cet Indiegogo est 4000 euros.

4000 euros pour 4 chansons.

L’enregistrement, le mixage, le mastering, les droits SDRM et bien sur le pressage du CD.

Si l’objectif des 4000 euros est dépassé ( oui mes rêves peuvent devenir réalité )

Les deux choses parmi les plus importantes et onéreuses pour réaliser un projet sont la communication et la promotion.

D’abord il s’agit de créer un vrai beau clip et après cela je pourrais, avec votre généreuse contribution m’occuper de mon projet et m’assurer qu’il soit entre de bonnes mains pour la publicité, la promotion et l’édition. 

Cela inclut trouver le bon label pour m’aider à grandir et diffuser au plus grand nombre ma musique. J’envisagerais aussi de faire cet EP une version Vinyl pour les amateurs… Bien sûr, en échange de votre contribution, vous pouvez retrouver de douces contreparties.Acheter en avant première mon Ep et bien d’autres petites ou grandes choses. ( à voir sur le côté) 

__________________________

L’impact. 

Tout d’abord, c’est un grand risque et un vrai challenge pour moi. Si nous réalisons cet Ep ensemble, j’aurai alors toutes les armes en mains pour défendre mon art correctement. 

Montrer à tous les professionnels de la musique qui est Manchild On The Moon. 

 

___________________

YOU

Si vous n’avez pas là possibilité de participer, ce que je peux évidemment comprendre, vous pouvez tout de même aider ce projet en partageant, partageant et en..... partageant encore ! Plus il sera vu, plus il aura de chances de succès !

Je, (Manchild) posterai des nouvelles, des lives vidéo, et des photos tout le long de cet Indiegogo. 

Beaucoup d’actualités à partager avec votre communauté.

Merci à tous 

Et à bientôt

story:
Short Summary

Originally from Chicago, I have been developing my craft for the last 10 years. I've lead an adventurous life, living in NYC, Oakland, LA and now Atlanta. All of these turns have led me to "Blood", my next EP. In contrast to my previous folk-driven EP, "Blood" is pop-driven with songs about survival and womanhood. My goal is to have it recorded by the fall of 2018 with 4-8 songs, shoot a video and promote the content.

What I Need & What You Get

$25,000 will cover costs for the following:

  • Producers and engineers 
  • Recording studios
  • Promotion
  • Music video
  • Photo shoot

Here is what you will get:

  • Digital downloads and my undying gratitude.

Risks & Challenges

The risk here is that it may take longer than expected to raise the funds.

  • I know that I may not be fully funded and am prepared to take whatever side gigs I need to keep my project on track and keep grinding.
  • My goal is to release the EP by the fall of 2018. Though there is a risk of time being pushed, I won't sacrifice quality for the sake of time and will continue until the project is done.

The Impact

By contributing, you will help make my dream a reality. As an artist, I always want to be pushing my boundaries, exploring new territory and most of all, giving myself truthfully to the world. Making this EP also creates opportunities for the songs to be used in placements and syncing as well as presented to A&R/Labels.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can get the word out, share with friends and make some noise about my EP and campaign.
  • Use the share button on the side of this campaign, it's easy, free, and it helps me more than you can imagine. 

And that's all there is to it.

My goal is to release the EP by the fall of 2018. Though there is a risk of time being pushed, I won't sacrifice quality for the sake of time and will continue until the project is done.


The Impact
By contributing, you will help make my dream a reality. As an artist, I always want to be pushing my boundaries, exploring new territory and most of all, giving myself truthfully to the world. Making this EP also creates opportunities for the songs to be used in placements and syncing as well as presented to A&R/Labels.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute that doesn't mean you can't help:

You can get the word out, share with friends and make some noise about my EP and campaign.
Use the share button on the side of this campaign, it's easy, free, and it helps me more than you can imagine. 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Sat nam, I am a Kundalini Yoga Teacher and Musician based in the United Kingdom. I teach locally and sing meditation music with my family in the UK and throughout Europe by invitation from other yogis. 

So far we have made five albums on very tight budgets with the generous and professional assistance of local friends. People have described the music as inspirational and luminous, as well as healing and beautiful. It is sold via Spirit Voyage, Sat Nam Versand and i-Tunes. Many people have been in touch to say they used the music to help deal with sadness, illness or grief or to uplift them in their daily lives. But this is a niche market and very often people download their music from Spotify which doesn't pay back the artist or support them to create new work. 

We feel that this music is needed in the World to bring in more light during challenging and troubled times. Additionally, we create and sing music with our family; our three sons sing with us and play various instruments, creating a family and community style harmony wherever we go, which is very healing for people who've not experienced positive family situations. 

So we need to make this album and we need to go deeper into the vibration of love to do it! We will be paying an experienced Kirtan producer to mix and edit this album, as well as to record additional musicians to play on the album with us. 

The budget for recording, paying musicians, mastering, editing and mixing is £4,000

The budget for printing and distribution is £1,000

Whatever we manage to raise on top of this will help us pay for the crowdfunding fees and also can pay towards some marketing of the CD. 

We would be so grateful if you could support us by pre purchasing the album, or by paying to invite us to come and sing with you. All money will go directly into the CD fund to pay those who are helping us create it! 

If we don't reach our goal, then all money raised will go directly into the CD production, we will just have to find other ways to raise the rest! But we will make this CD, we have a great track record of our commitment to getting this music recorded and out into the World! 

If you're unable to help us by contributing or purchasing this CD, then please share this campaign and let other people know about it. 

You can hear our music at https://soundcloud.com/anand-kirtan

Thank you!

Anand Kirtan, Tom and Family 

www.anandkirtanmusic.com

story:
Li'l Chuck The One Man Skiffle Machine - Genuine One Man Band.

 

"Sublime harp and heartfelt vocals leave the listener wanting more"

Blues matters magazine (UK) June 2017

"Li'l Chuck combines almost every element of pure joy"   4 1/2 stars (out of 5)

NZ Listener. March 2017.

"A true multi-instrumentalist & multi-tasker  in addition to a talented artist"

No Depression Magazine USA. March 2017. 

 

I am passionate about keeping the one man band tradition alive and with 2 successful albums, I've done a pretty good job so far.  Now I am ready for number 3!

I have been a one man band for 25 years or so, and worked endlessly to hone the craft of playing multiple instruments simultaneously.  It took me about 20 years before I felt I had the skills to record my first album so trust me, I ain't no flash in the pan, this is serious one man band business!

I am crowdfunding for my 3rd album.  I call it a 'pre-release' campaign, all I ask is you buy a copy in advance! This makes it a lot easier to finance an album project and guarantees its release. YOU become part of the album project!  This is my second crowdfunding campaign, my 'Utility Blues pre-release' campaign was a massive success.  I raised the NZ$8k I was looking for thanks to you!!!  You had faith in me and my music and I delivered on my promise.  The album was really well received locally and internationally, have a look at the reviews here...http://www.backyardmusic.co.nz/reviews

I sincerely thank you in advance for you support, and in return, I am offering some unique and rather cool perks/ rewards, please check them out and read more about my campaign below. Please note all prices are quoted in US$

What I Need & What You Get 

I am looking to cover the production costs of the album, BUT NOT THE RECORDING COSTS OR TRAVEL COSTS! Just the bits after that are required to get the album released after the recording / mixing process.  I have studio time booked at Sugar Rays Vintage Recording Studio in the UK in October. 

The production costs I am talking about are the 'mastering' (the bit that adds 'sparkle' to the recording and the final stage before 'pressing', the 'pressing' (reproduction of the CD's), graphic design & artwork (The cover), printing (The cover) and a little bit of marketing (PR, reviews, media and release plan). The money I raise will also cover the costs of running the campaign and costs of the 'Perks' / merchandise. 

What You Get

Not only will you get a copy of the album once it is released but in addition, you can choose to have a song written for you, or do you fancy learning harmonica from my online lessons? Would you prefer to have a one on one Skype harmonica lesson? You can even have me perform in your living room? Trust me, I won't be rolling around in piles of money, the CD albums I make just about break even.... after a few years! Please see the financial breakdown below...

February? how long does it take to release an album?  A professional release schedule usually requires a minimum of 3 months once recorded and mastered. 

My time line > CF campaign running Aug 6 - Sept 3 (NZ) > Oct recording > Nov / Dec album production (mastering, artwork pressing) and album release planning (PR/ Reviews etc) > Jan '19 - everything closes down in New Zealand for the summer Holidays > Feb '19 release. February is when New Zealand kicks the sand of the Jandles and gets back into the swing of things.

What no vinyl? Sadly, the reality is, I just don't think I have a big enough audience to support vinyl.  I am in New Zealand, vinyl pressing isn't done here... I have to consider shipping costs, duty, minimum runs etc so the economics and practicalities just don't make sense.  However, if someone was keen to make that happen by boosting the campaign goal I would seriously consider it!. 

CD is dead! Why am I pressing CD's? believe it or not, CD's are still the best option for me and many gigging musicians. I know this through experience and because I know my audience. People like a physical product, something they can hold, something they can take away from the gig. CD's are a practical format, easy to carry and cost effective. I am very proud of the high quality album covers and booklets I produce. Personally, I feel the album artwork and cover notes are just as important as the music. A digital file is ok for just listening to the music, but you don't get the backstory, photos,lyrics, keys & harmonica info, this is the stuff that puts the music into context. 

 

Anything else you would like? If there is something else you would like please just sing out, I am open to ideas!!

I am a one man band on many levels, a one man operation, a totally self funded independent professional musician of 25 years.  I personally organise every element of my career... recording, bookings, social media, marketing, writing, creating, repairs, maintenance... you name it!  I play music professionally and juggle my music career with being a full time parent of 2 little ones.  Some call this "Daddy Daycare" I have the best job in the world, I am with my kids all day and then play music at night. 

Many musicians rely on touring to maximise their sales and income.  I like to be close to home and family, Most of my income comes from local gigs, music tuition and writing.  I have built up a solid local fanbase and awesome online fanbase through my proactive use of social media.  Crowd funding is a vital part of my creative process. 

Supporting me means I can keep making music for you!  I have a very creative brain and am constantly coming up with new ideas and songs...and the best bit is that 'THE BAND IS NEVER GONNA BREAK UP'.  I'm in for the long haul!

I crowdfunded my 2nd album Utility Blues with a very similar 'pre sale' campaign to this one.  I raised the NZ$8k I was looking for. 

The album entered the Official NZ Albums Charts at No6. I got a top 10 album, 

Thanks to you!

You had faith in me and I delivered on my promise.  I am proud of my reputation for being a hard worker and being easy to work with.  I'm passionate, motivated, enthusiastic.  A few years ago, I hit 40, had my first child and had my home destroyed by a massive earthquake within a few months of each other.  Life is too short, now I just get on with it!!!!

Risks & Challenges. Like all creatives, I worry about failure, but I am not actually sure what that failure is!  My biggest worry at this stage is not managing to record enough material at my Sugar Rays session however I have a back up plan to record any additional material at a iconic New Zealand studio. 

Other Ways You Can Help. If you can't contribute, then please just spread the word, tell people about my campaign and my music. You can also listen to my previous albums (or buy them) on all the various digital stores or at my website backyardmusuic.co.nz, please check out my videos on Youtube, subscribe or 'like' my Facebook post. 

Website www.backyardmusic.co.nz

Facebook https://www.facebook.com/skifflemachine/

Youtube https://www.youtube.com/c/LilChuckTheOneManSkif...

Please spread the word, I know what I do is pretty quirky but believe me, I know there are a lot of other folks into this old timey harmonica, resonator guitar, one man band thing too!

Please share the indiegogo links on your social media!

I genuinely appreciate you support folks!

 

The control room at Sugar Rays Vintage Recording Studio where I will be recording!

story:
It's About Time

I've been performing live for enough years that it's strange to have nothing to show for it. I was terrified of the studio and couldn't get used to the sound of my own voice.

Now it's time to face the music (sorry).

These records are the result of pretty much every hour of spare time I had this year, while I was studying for my final exams. I'm massively proud and quite scared - proud of the records, scared for my final exams.

It's a presale, not a fundraiser

I'm not asking for charity (unless you insist...). If you've heard me live, believe in me and want to hear more, then you'll invest in my music. Like a goat farm or an espresso bar. Sort of.

It's all been recorded: the pre-sale just helps pay off those final bits & pieces like sticker printing and disc reduplication. Lesson: next time, get a f***ing record deal (just kidding, stick it to the man).

The goal is aspirational and arbitrary - I'll take what I get and make the rest up with normal sales like, uhh, every musician ever pre-Internet.

£5 - Download 1 EP

£7.50 - CD in the post (P&P included)

£9 - Download both EPs

£13 - Both CDs in the post (P&P included)

£25+ - Both CDs and a thankyou in the acknowledgements*

£100 - 1 copy of every record I ever make

Other ways to pay: Give me a festival/concert contact that works out & you will have a free CD + eternal gratitude.

*Deadline is the printing day obviously - TBC (mid-late August)
 

Photo Credits: CH Photos

We plan to drop a bunch of new singles while we raise money for the new professional record and tour. If you help us out there's a bunch of cool stuff we can offer available below

story:
Short Summary 

          

 

singer-songwriter, multi-instrumentalist

self-taught musician, aspiring jazz guitarist

private music lessons provider,

experimenter in audio production,                

contributing live music to local and regional events at: farmers markets, libraries, music festivals, skill share workshops, open mic performances, social awareness programs,

educational background in agriculture and writing,

professional gardener, botanist in training,

believer in the transformational power of art and wild natural spaces

 

When I began thinking about this solo album project, I knew that I wanted to start small. So I chose to focus on a small instrument---the ukulele. Gondolele: Buoyant Ukulele Music stands fully recorded. Every second of audio critically selected over a 2+ year time period. Each song has been mixed down to stereo wave files and digitally mastered for high quality audio playback. On this album you will discover fifteen studio recorded songs, each containing a minimum of vocals, ukulele, and bass, while most tracks additionally include a mixture of the following recorded instruments: acoustic guitar, marimba, glockenspiel, harmonica, piano, lead guitar, harmony vocals, and hand percussion.

Gondolele's style of music is exuberant, playful, and pulsing with imaginative ideas. The songs appeal to persons of every generation, but seeing as how the ukulele attracts attention from many youngsters, I designed the album to be family friendly from beginning to end. By clicking the pink button above you're contributing towards substantial art that will stimulate and nourish the mind.

                                    

Give and Take

I will not try to calculate the triple-digit number of hours that went into the making of Gondolele: Buoyant Ukulele Music. It's been a labor of love and a critical step for me to take in order to move forward in the realm of music making. Stretching and growing, testing myself, pushing my limits, struggling, failing, learning, resting, adapting, and moving on, have all been key components in this creative process. After spending so much time carefully listening to the audio again and again during the engineering and mastering stages of this album, I will never again be able to use my old ears to listen to recorded music as before; because now they pick out nuances as if they were ears of an engineer, noting the sounds by what it takes to create them! Besides the aforementioned investment of personal time, the following financial investments have already been made: Total Expenses for Studio Recording, Mixing, and Mastering: = $3,750. Total Costs of Collaborating with Local Artists for album cover design and creation of indie-gogo campaign video: = $800

It is in this final phase I hope to muster financial support to cover the sum of $2200 to have the disc manufacturing company press the album onto compact discs. This sum includes the replication of a glass master, one thousand cds in full color packages of matte finish paper-board, a twelve page booklet of visual artwork by yours truly, and song lyrics too. You are going to receive many rewards for adding your contribution to the completion of this project! Please study the column on the right-hand side of the page and choose an option that would best suit your level of investment.

If this project does not receive adequate funding then I plan to continue forward, paying out of pocket the remaining expenses for CD production, and will make good on the distribution of CDs (and additional items) to every person who shows support for the project. Read Footnote below to see what happens if the Indie-gogo campaign gets generously funded.

 

The Impact

Some artists are obliged to balance their lives very particularly in order to generate enough income to survive without losing touch with their passions to bring new creations into the world. In my case, I've been carrying these songs and this project around for about three years. Therefore, the simple act of seeing it through to the end is going to be a relief and a great personal achievement. Even better...to see it through in the midst of encouragement from a community of supporters will be like my heart rocketing skyward on a giant firecracker exploding into a unique pattern of emotional color and shimmering gratitude.

 

Risks & Challenges

Releasing a musical compilation without the aid of a major music label and industry backing can be risky. An avenue that many creative people don't have the patience for or experience to see it through. Taking this direction could mean putting out an enormous amount of effort while seeing little return.

In the year 2000 I received my first musical instrument (an acoustic guitar) at not so early stage in my life. A definite transformation arrived with this new friend in hand. Ultimately, life fast forwarded to the present, despite many hurdles along the way like: plowing through a tumultuous upbringing, dropping high-school, wandering for years, working dead-end jobs, persisting, pursuing and attaining two college degrees, starting a business, making a living---yet, throughout these journeys I have not lost sight of channeling creativity through sound and musical instruments; nor have I ceased to quest for the joyful reward of collaborating with musicians every chance possible.

Now with 18 years of musical experience, I have a secure platform on which to assemble my original recordings, performances, and collaborations. I am armed with plenty of ambition and raw material to dig up when creating future works.

To say this might be too much diversion right now, but if you have time, please watch a twenty-minute informative video that will help you realize why it's extremely important to make space for present day independent musicians. Afterwards, you are going to understand at least one reason why I am not willing to dilute my music in exchange for today's commercial hype. Copy the link below to follow you-tube video: The TRUTH Why Modern Music is...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oVME_l4IwII


Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you so much for considering a contribution to this musical endeavor. Even if this project is not up your alley, please help by spreading the word to anyone you know who adores the ukulele or who may be interested in new music outside of the mainstream. Telling someone or sharing social media links at the top of the page are excellent ways to contribute.

 

Footnote

Investing in my own music is a lifetime endeavor. The funding that gets raised through this Indie Gogo campaign will first go to the disc manufacturing company to pay for 1000 professionally replicated and packaged CDs.

Any extra funding will go into the costs of promoting this new music, creating and maintaining a music website, and releasing a couple singles in winter 2018.

Future Projects: I currently have three more albums worth of original song material and regularly compose new songs. I would very much like to give attention to an emerging contemplative acoustic guitar album I am calling Ponderous Arc. The dream would be to continue releasing subsequent albums as time and resources allow. Ultimately (when cooked down enough and simmering with all the key ingredients) I hope to produce an original album that fits into the modern jazz genre.

Thanks for reading and for contributing!___Jesse Michael Wilhite

https://catchflymusic.com/

Each song has been mixed down to stereo wave files and digitally mastered for high quality audio playback. On this album you will discover fifteen studio recorded songs, each containing a minimum of vocals, ukulele, and bass, while most tracks additionally include a mixture of the following recorded instruments: acoustic guitar, marimba, glockenspiel, harmonica, piano, lead guitar, harmony vocals, and hand percussion.Gondolele's style of music is exuberant, playful, and pulsing with imaginative ideas. The songs appeal to persons of every generation, but seeing as how the ukulele attracts attention from many youngsters, I designed the album to be family friendly from beginning to end. By clicking the pink button above you're contributing towards substantial art that will stimulate and nourish the mind.                                     Give and TakeI will not try to calculate the triple-digit number of hours that went into the making of Gondolele: Buoyant Ukulele Music. It's been a labor of love and a critical step for me to take in order to move forward in the realm of music making. Stretching and growing, testing myself, pushing my limits, struggling, failing, learning, resting, adapting, and moving on, have all been key components in this creative process. After spending so much time carefully listening to the audio again and again during the engineering and mastering stages of this album, I will never again be able to use my old ears to listen to recorded music as before; because now they pick out nuances as if they were ears of an engineer, noting the sounds by what it takes to create them! Besides the aforementioned investment of personal time, the following financial investments have already been made: Total Expenses for Studio Recording, Mixing, and Mastering: = $3,750. Total Costs of Collaborating with Local Artists for album cover design and creation of indie-gogo campaign video: = $800It is in this final phase I hope to muster financial support to cover the sum of $2200 to have the disc manufacturing company press the album onto compact discs. This sum includes the replication of a glass master, one thousand cds in full color packages of matte finish paper-board, a twelve page booklet of visual artwork by yours truly, and song lyrics too. You are going to receive many rewards for adding your contribution to the completion of this project! Please study the column on the right-hand side of the page and choose an option that would best suit your level of investment.If this project does not receive adequate funding then I plan to continue forward, paying out of pocket the remaining expenses for CD production, and will make good on the distribution of CDs (and additional items) to every person who shows support for the project. Read Footnote below to see what happens if the Indie-gogo campaign gets generously funded. The ImpactSome artists are obliged to balance their lives very particularly in order to generate enough income to survive without losing touch with their passions to bring new creations into the world. In my case, I've been carrying these songs and this project around for about three years. Therefore, the simple act of seeing it through to the end is going to be a relief and a great personal achievement. Even better...to see it through in the midst of encouragement from a community of supporters will be like my heart rocketing skyward on a giant firecracker exploding into a unique pattern of emotional color and shimmering gratitude. Risks & ChallengesReleasing a musical compilation without the aid of a major music label and industry backing can be risky. An avenue that many creative people don't have the patience for or experience to see it through. Taking this direction could mean putting out an enormous amount of effort while seeing little return.In the year 2000 I received my first musical instrument (an acoustic guitar) at not so early stage in my life. A definite transformation arrived with this new friend in hand. Ultimately, life fast forwarded to the present, despite many hurdles along the way like: plowing through a tumultuous upbringing, dropping high-school, wandering for years, working dead-end jobs, persisting, pursuing and attaining two college degrees, starting a business, making a living---yet, throughout these journeys I have not lost sight of channeling creativity through sound and musical instruments; nor have I ceased to quest for the joyful reward of collaborating with musicians every chance possible.Now with 18 years of musical experience, I have a secure platform on which to assemble my original recordings, performances, and collaborations. I am armed with plenty of ambition and raw material to dig up when creating future works.To say this might be too much diversion right now, but if you have time, please watch a twenty-minute informative video that will help you realize why it's extremely important to make space for present day independent musicians. Afterwards, you are going to understand at least one reason why I am not willing to dilute my music in exchange for today's commercial hype. Copy the link below to follow you-tube video: The TRUTH Why Modern Music is...https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oVME_l4IwII
Other Ways You Can HelpThank you so much for considering a contribution to this musical endeavor. Even if this project is not up your alley, please help by spreading the word to anyone you know who adores the ukulele or who may be interested in new music outside of the mainstream. Telling someone or sharing social media links at the top of the page are excellent ways to contribute. FootnoteInvesting in my own music is a lifetime endeavor. The funding that gets raised through this Indie Gogo campaign will first go to the disc manufacturing company to pay for 1000 professionally replicated and packaged CDs.Any extra funding will go into the costs of promoting this new music, creating and maintaining a music website, and releasing a couple singles in winter 2018.Future Projects: I currently have three more albums worth of original song material and regularly compose new songs. I would very much like to give attention to an emerging contemplative acoustic guitar album I am calling Ponderous Arc. The dream would be to continue releasing subsequent albums as time and resources allow. Ultimately (when cooked down enough and simmering with all the key ingredients) I hope to produce an original album that fits into the modern jazz genre.Thanks for reading and for contributing!___Jesse Michael Wilhitehttps://catchflymusic.com/

story:
Devil is Back - Exclusive Merchandise

Devil is Back is the brand new multiple chart topping Album by Oliver Sean featuring R.I.P (Real Indie Project). the album was launched on the 14th of August and hit #1 on the iTunes US & UK Top 40 Blues Charts for 14 days. It went on to break into the Official UK Album Download Charts at No.52 and hit the coveted Billboard Charts at #8 on the Blues Album Charts for the week of Aug 29, 2020. 

This album was meant to be released as a 'Digital Only' EP, however after capturing the hearts and minds of the fans and hitting multiple major charts worldwide and mainly due to popular demand from the fans, Oliver Sean and WOA Entertainment have decided to release a limited number of CD's and Vinyl of Devil is Back ft. RIP (signed by Oliver)/ and some exclusive T-shirts and Stickers to celebrate the album success.

We Have Limited Number of Merchandise available

The Merchandise available is limited in number and will be on a first come, first serve basis. There is no limit to how many one items one person can buy, so if you want to buy all the tshirts you can lol. 

  • 100 CDs - Signed by Oliver Sean
  • 100 T-Shirts 
  • 50 Laser Cut Oliver Sean logo stickers
  • Special CD or Vinyl bundles will be available, where everything above is included at discounted prices
  • We will fulfil the orders even if our funding goal isn't reached - what the fans want, they will get :-)

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign and ask your friends to support this album campaign. We do not have a major label backing this album - everything has been done DIY by the artist and we have created DIY Independent  Music History, with what has been achieved in less than 1 month since album launch.

You buying the merchandise (even a sticker) helps keep this dream alive and helps us to KEEP giving the finger to the manufactured music industry LMFAO

story:
HALLO!

My name is Moody Kablawi, I’m a Rapper, music producer and lighting designer born and raised in Haifa City. I have moved to Berlin earlier this year after being active musically and visually in our Underground Palestinian Music scene which was developing since 2010.

At the age of 15 I released my first HipHop EP and started touring with several
ensembles and projects that slowly brought me into producing my own music.

In 2017, I released my second Trip-Hop album followed by several music videos including:

☆The song “Railway” that is the first single out of my upcoming EP “Ghabash” (Blurry)☆


☆​”Ma Fi Ma’ani”☆

☆​“Mali Mal” in which I addressed my genetic eye condition called Nystagmus that was expressed in the aesthetics of the video☆

 

In the past year I have been working on developing my sound as a producer and as a MC, finding myself diving deep into the sound of Disco, Electro , Retro and Funk while touching a lot of Middle eastern elements.

Being a producer gave me a lot of freedom to explore new sounds and genres while recording and producing myself and other people, However, there
is still a barrier and that is a financial one!

My independence as an artist and to what extent I can develop myself and my music with my current resources should not be limited by financial means. For this reason I am reaching out to YOU, my followers and fans.

☆The Plan☆

The idea is to release 2 EPs this year, with 3 music videos, that reflect my latest and current artistic experiments and crafts.
The ideal first goal for the post production stages is 17K so it can be represented to you the way I dream of. For example:

  • Post Production (mixing and mastering).
  • Designing Artworks. 
  • Printing Merchandise (Stickers, Tshirt and Funky Hats).
  • 2 Music Video Productions.
  • Extra COSTS and TAXES to make this campaign happen.
  • Publicity and Press. 

Final goal would be 21K which will allow: 

  • Another Music Video. 
  • Release Shows And Tour Expenses. 


☆Other Ways You Can Help☆

Besides financial contribution, their are many ways to SUPPORT my campaign. SHARE the link with your FRIENDS and FAMILY and spread the vibe around social media.

During my campaign, i will be sharing daily OLD videos and important moments of my career’s creation around on my pages.

Another funky way to support is to show me some of your 80's funky moves by SENDING ME a video of yourself shaking on "Railway"  ^__^

SUBSCRIBE & FOLLOW to join the hype: 

  • LIKE Facebook Page
  • SUBSCRIBE Youtube Channel
  • FOLLOW Instagram Profile

Supper appreciated for your SUPPORT and Let's make my music creation happen together !
PLEASE Feel free to contact me for some DEMOS of the music and more details about my release plan.

☆THANK YOU for your attention and keep it FUNKY☆

www.moodykablawi.com

story:
Minotaurus is an ancient epic metal band founded in 1994 in Aschaffenburg, and presented their debut album as Maxi CD "The First Labyrinth". "Myth Or Reality was followed by the first long player with the song "Warrior Hearts" which was used as the title song for the eponymous German movie. All productions until the album "The Lonely Dwarf" were produced on their own. In 2013 they produced the album "The Call" which was released under the worldwide renowned German label Limb Music (former home of Rhapsody, Pagan's Mind, Ancient Bards, Dragony and others). 2016 was followed by the grand album "Insolubilis" which was produced by Rolf Munkes (guitarist of Crematory).                    

After a few local successes, the band not only acted as local support for many well-known bands such as Subway To Sally, Freedom Call, Fire Tail, and other bands of the Middle Ages Meatls. The band has been releasing a video clip for each long player since "Myth Or Reality", directed by e (h) Erlebnisfilm.

Celebrating its 25th anniversary in 2019, Minotaurus hopes to release a new music video clip, "Victims Of The Underworld", which will be released as Double EP, including the remastered first maxi CD "The First Labyrinth" tie. In order to provide our fans with the best possible product, we need your help!

As you know, music production is still a costly process, and while we have excellent partners on our way to support us, the budget is always tight - but with your help, we can ensure we get the best shots, mastering, and mastering best promotional material for our new album.

 

What you give us and what you get:

We've always been very proud to fund our album productions ourselves, but this time we'd like to turn to our fan base to help and support us to deliver an even better product than before.

 

Our total production costs include:

    Recording & Mixing & Mastering: 5.500 EUR

    Cover: 1200 EUR

    Promotional photos: 100 EUR

    Additional orchestration: 500 EUR

    Merchandise: 1,500 EUR

   CD - Release: 1000 EUR

    Video production: 2,000 EUR

    ----------------------------------------

    Total production costs: 11.400 EUR

 

What do you give us?

We hope for your contributions to reach our funding target of EUR 3,500 to help cover these costs. It is, of course, possible and encouraged to raise funds beyond this goal, as it could guarantee even better production for the recording, mixing, mastering of our planned video and more merchandising for you to enjoy.

 

What you will get:

    A brand new Minotaurus album full of epic, catchy melodic Metal songs

    Signed copies of the new album before the official release!

    Exclusive bonus tracks!

    Various t-shirt designs for heroes and heroines!

    Original costumes as well as original outfits and accessories from our video clips

    Various merchandise articles from posters to signed drum skins

    Signed guitars and a signed bass

    Be part of the experience by stating your name in the album issue or booking the band

    for a   private show!

 

With your help, we can make this album the best Minotaurus album!

 

Join our project today!

    Thank you for all your help. Best regards.

    Minotaurus

 

    PS: If you do not have a credit card or PayPal and would still like to participate in our 

    campaign, please contact minotaurusmetal@aol.com directly

 

Are you looking for more information or have a question? See the FAQ

story:
Gabriel Newlands is a young composer who mingles traditional instruments with electronic devices. His music will bring you into a state of contemplation and nostalgia. Inspired by contemporary composers like Ludovico Einaudi and Olafur Arnalds, he adds glitchy, hypnotic electronic sounds to his soft piano melodies, resulting in a timeless, cinematic vibe. Please make a contribution to help him record his debut album!

Gabriel Newlands est un jeune compositeur mélangeant instruments traditionnels et électroniques. Sa musique vous emmènera  dans un univers contemplatif et nostalgique. Inspiré de compositeurs contemporains tels que Ludovico Einaudi et Olafur Arnald, il ajoute plusieurs couches de sons éthérés et irréguliers à ses douces mélodies, donnant ainsi un résultat intemporel et hypnotisant. Contribuez à la réalisation de son premier album!

 

The money raised will help pay for studio sessions, online and physical distribution, as well as promoting the album. Even if the goal is not reached, the project will be carried out.

 
Les contributions reçues aideront à payer les sessions de studio, la distribution numérique et physique ainsi que la promotion de cet album. Même si le but n'est pas atteint, le projet sera tout de même complété.

 

Please spread the word, and don't forget to share this page with the people you like!

S'il-vous-plaît partagez la bonne nouvelle à vos amis et sur vos réseaux sociaux!

story:
Bref résumé

Je suis musicien professionnel spécialisé en interprétation de la musique ancienne sur les instruments à cordes pincées. Depuis plus de vingt ans, je m’attache au répertoire pour guitare baroque, tant en solo qu’en ensembles. J’ai joué sur plusieurs excellents instruments fabriqués à partir de modèles de guitares du 17e siècle. J’ai toujours rêvé de jouer sur un instrument original, mais ils sont extrêmement rares et la plupart sont exposés dans des musées.

J’ai récemment eu l’occasion de faire l’acquisition d’une de ces guitares auprès des réputés restaurateurs d’instruments Daniel et Françoise Sinier de Ridder, à Paris. L’instrument, d’une grande valeur patrimoniale et historique, est donc en parfait état de restauration, prêt à jouer. 

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Grâce à votre contribution, je souhaite financer un tout premier enregistrement sur la guitare. Les fonds serviront aussi à l’entretien de cet instrument incroyable et à la production de 25 concerts un peu partout au Québec, dans le but de la mettre en valeur. Je souhaite que les gens puisse l’entendre, l’admirer! 

En contrepartie d’un don de 25$ je vous offre l’enregistrement de plusieurs pièces de répertoire que je compte enregistrer à l’automne 2018 sur cette Voboam extraordinaire.

En contrepartie d’un don de 50$, en plus des enregistrements récents je vous offre un disque autographié de votre choix parmi cette sélection : Robert de visée : l’intégrale de l’œuvre pour guitare (3Cds) ; Guitare baroque : oeuves de Bach, Handel, Scarlatti ; L’intégrale des œuvres pour guitare d’Antoine Carré (2Cds)

En contrepartie d’un don de 750$ j’offre un concert privé, avec la guitare, pour vous et vos invités, chez vous !

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous êtes un diffuseur et que vous souhaitez aider, vous pouvez le faire en programmant un concert qui mette en valeur l'instrument. 

De plus, vous aiderez grandement en partageant aux autres ce projet, en utilisant les outils de partage Indiegogo!

story:
Agbara Estudio is a non-profit making organization dedicated to the teaching of Afro-Caribbean Dance, more specifically Salsa Dancing and other similar forms.  For the last two years we have organized a Salsa Festival. This festival includes workshops, conferences, dance shows and concerts. This year we have introduced an interschool dance exchange. Due to local regulations we are not allowed to charge anything to the students taking part, nor to the public watching the show. Therefore we totally depend on the generosity of any donors we can find.

Due to the high inflation in the country, hard currency goes a long way. So with your contribution, hopefully WE will go a long way too! The money will be used in the following-

-  Hiring the venue: Centro Cultural Tulio Febres Cordero in the Centre of Mérida City.

- Hiring the sound system for the show.

- Costumes for some of the students taking part.

- Hydration and a snack for the students, dancers and the musicians on the day of the concert.

- Transport and general expenses of the teachers doing the workshops.

- Prizes for the best groups in the show including annual scholarships in local dance schools.

- General logistics of the event.

This project is important because it is our mission to maintain and encourage the participation in and the enjoyment of traditional salsa dancing. We have promoted such ventures in the past but would like to expand the impact to a wider audience. Such activities are essential within a country experiencing severe economic difficulties. They help to promote a spirit of optimism where is sorely needed.  

If you are not able to give us a monetary contribution, you can always help us spreading the word and sharing this campaign with your friends. Please don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools as well!
story_txt:
Agbara Estudio is a non-profit making organization dedicated to the teaching of Afro-Caribbean Dance, more specifically Salsa Dancing and other similar forms.  For the last two years we have organized a Salsa Festival. This festival includes workshops, conferences, dance shows and concerts. This year we have introduced an interschool dance exchange. Due to local regulations we are not allowed to charge anything to the students taking part, nor to the public watching the show. Therefore we totally depend on the generosity of any donors we can find.
Due to the high inflation in the country, hard currency goes a long way. So with your contribution, hopefully WE will go a long way too! The money will be used in the following-
-  Hiring the venue: Centro Cultural Tulio Febres Cordero in the Centre of Mérida City.
- Hiring the sound system for the show.
- Costumes for some of the students taking part.
- Hydration and a snack for the students, dancers and the musicians on the day of the concert.
- Transport and general expenses of the teachers doing the workshops.
- Prizes for the best groups in the show including annual scholarships in local dance schools.
- General logistics of the event.
This project is important because it is our mission to maintain and encourage the participation in and the enjoyment of traditional salsa dancing. We have promoted such ventures in the past but would like to expand the impact to a wider audience. Such activities are essential within a country experiencing severe economic difficulties. They help to promote a spirit of optimism where is sorely needed.  
If you are not able to give us a monetary contribution, you can always help us spreading the word and sharing this campaign with your friends. Please don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools as well!

story:
Short Summary

NEW JUDY RAFAT ALBUM:  "IT`S CHRISTMAS TIME AGAIN"

Introducing the new Christmas Album from JUDY RAFAT!
 

A personal letter from JUDY about the making of this album:

The Music

This album has been in the works for almost three years! And it will be the 6th album that I have recorded. I am a jazz singer right along the lines of Ella Fitzgerald or Sarah Vaughn. We have taken all my favourite Christmas songs and set them with very jazzy arrangements  - some with string orchestra. 

 

It's a little different from the last release,  - Around About Midnight or Con Alma - A Tribute to Dizzy Gillespie. This time it is with a stronger entertaining, swinging  aspect with orchestra arrangements and with string quartet, arranged by Corey Allen with popular songs of the most beautiful Christmas songs  - some of them combined with traditional Christmas songs like Away In a Manger or O Little Town of Bethlehem.

 

This album is a dream I have had for years  and I'm very proud to present it to you.  I want to help you create in your home this Christmas a beautiful, cheery and harmonious atmosphere - spreading love, goodwill and peace in your family and also towards all people, regardless of religion, nationality or culture.

 

About Me

My name is Judy Rafat, born and raised in Canada - I lived most of that time in London, Ontario. I have been singing I think since I was born - sat with my grandfather on his knee as a small child to sing and finally studied voice - classical and jazz. I came to Germany after my studies with a rock group and toured Europe and ended up settling in Germany. I was a socially engaged folk singer singing for peace.

 

I changed to jazz after hearing the first chords from Dizzy Gillespie on CON ALMA in 1986. Shortly after, I started my studies in Vocal Jazz. I was blessed to have Dizzy Gillespie as my mentor and had the marvelous opportunity to be on tour with him to Berlin, Prag and Moscow.

I then recorded a Tribute to him - CON ALMA - in New York with all the fabulous musicians that worked with Dizzy - Kenny Barron, Rufus Reid, Mike Longo, Frank Wess, Claudio Roditi, Paquito d`Rivera, and Ignacio Berroa. 

 

Up until now I have had an international career travelling to China, Singapore, Dubai, jazz clubs in Europe and  performances with Dave Brubeck in the Gerhard Mercator University and Wynton Marsalis in Shanghai was also a highlight in my career.

 

Concept and History

"It was the night before Christmas when all through the house......" This CD has been a dream of mine for almost 3 years. The concept for the album was to record - a beautiful Christmas Album bringing people together in an atmosphere of love, good will, harmony in this cold world and a feeling of joy, excited children and belongingness in family and helping others less fortunate. 

 

I loved Christmas in Canada as a child,- the fantasy, make believe, the glistening snow  and sitting  in the middle of the night under the beautiful Christmas tree with it`s twinkling lights  waiting for Santa to wriggle down the chimney. The memories of the smell of cooking, baking, the precious stories - Scrooge and the poems and films - the decorations and the beautiful Christmas music have  always stayed in my mind. And most of all the beautiful atmosphere of love and family.

 

After doing a concert with Corey Allen, 3 years ago, we discussed it and he offered to do the arrangements for the band and for the string orchestra. 1 1/2 years later we had the concept for the album - a beautiful Christmas Album was born.

 

The songs of this album are some of my very favourite Christmas songs- most of them you have heard before but not with my voice or with these arrangements -  with soprano saxophone or clarinett or flute. And of course 4 of the tunes are with a string orchestra recorded in the Dominican Republic.

 

I hope you love this album which I am sure you will, just as much as we enjoy recording and producing it. 

 

The "IT`S CHRISTMAS TIME AGAIN" Tracklisting

1.  It`s The Most Wonderful Time of the Year

2. Santa Baby

3. The Christmas Song

4. Winter Wonderland

5. It`s Beginning to Look a Lot Like Christmas

6. O Little Town of Bethlehem

7. Away in A Manger

8. I`ll Be Home For Christmas

9. Let It Snow

10. Have Yourself a Merry Little Christmas

11. Santa Claus Is Coming to Town

 

-------------------------------------------------

Behind the Scenes & Budget

What does it take to make an album like this? Well, a lot.

--

which amounts to about 15,000€ round about! 

In this case, financially speaking, it takes even more than what this campaign goal is asking. Usually around 20 K€.

For those interested, a budget like this for a mid-level album is very common (often much more) and typically fronted by a band's label, which they have to pay back through album sales and touring. Nowadays, through streaming through Spotifiy, utube, Deezer and the many other platforms and easy illegal downloading, very little gets back to the musician.

I have decided to take the more challenging path of not signing to a label, and release my music independently under a proforma label: supermusic - they pay nothing and still get 30% of every sold CD.

That means I, alone, am responsible for funding my music, making every last detail come together, and promoting it.

 

But I've found the reward of "doing it WITH my fans" to be better than anything I could imagine. 

 

It was an easy choice for me - there was no way I was going to sacrifice my music  because I am a jazz musician . So I decided to find ways to keep my music career sustainable  - and that means teaching voice, remaining a recording artist and to heavily involve my fans in the process of creating and promoting my album (that's YOU!). 

 

I am planning next year a Tribute to Dizzy Gillespie Tour and playing at a few jazz festivals and clubs.

 

I love being transparent and want you to know the challenges I face as an independent musician, and that I take huge pride in the TOTALLY AMAZING SUPPORT jazz fans show. I think jazz fans are unlike any other fans in the entire musical genre landscape! 
 

But not only that, I also feel incredibly inspired and lucky to have fans who have supported me in the past! YOU KEEP THE MUSIC ALIVE. 


Besides picking out  the songs and keys, there are many logistics, especially when you're creating a project which involves so many people in several different countries and time zones, all using different gear, recording equipment, and procedures. 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Musicians On This Album

 

JUDY RAFAT - Vocals

Location: Germany

 

Lothar van Staa - 

Tenor-, Sopran- Saxophone, Clarinett

Location: Germany

I have been working with Lothar since 2005 and he is such a talented, sensitive player and it is a joy for me to play with him - I feel that he feels everything I sing. I just love the way he plays and am thrilled to have him on the album.

 

 

Markus Schieferdecker - Bass

Location: Germany

I have been playing with Markus for many years, at least 10, and he is one of the most prolific bass players in Germany. It is always a pleasure to play with such a great bass player who is so loving and kind and funny. Great to have you on the album Markus!

 

 

Marcus Rieck - Drums

Location: Germany

Marcus is an extremely delicate drummer and a master of the quieter playing - not ususal for drummers! that is why he is so special.

Actually it was my luck to have Marcus on this album as the drummer that usually plays with me wasn`t available. But I am thrilled in how he harmonizes with the band. Really thrilled to have him on the CD.

 

 

Corey Allen - Piano and Arrangements

Location: Los Angeles/Dominican Republic

Corey Allen from Los Angeles and now residing in Dominican Republc and who is head of the jazz Department at the University of Santo Domingo  has been a good friend of mine for many years. He wrote the arrangements  for the amazing  Manhattan Transfer and for many, many more musicians and has recorded over 30 albums. What an honour to have Corey on this album, - he is world renowned, first of all because of his unbelievable Piano playing but also because of his great ability to write fantastic arrangements which I am sure you will marvel on this album.

 

 

 

 

Other Contributors on this album

 

Tom McCauley - Mixing/Mastering of the album

Location:  Los Angeles

Tom McCauley has done with his exquiste taste, all the mixing for many famous jazz musicians such as Cheryl Bentyne  and now for me ...

 

Reinhard Kobialka - Studio Engineer

Location: Germany

This is my second album with Reihnhard in Topaz Studios in Cologne. I love the way Reinhard works - very precise and his taste is impeccable for the sound I like.

 

Zoltan Leskovar/Dagmar Strohschen - Photographers

All of the photos in the studio have been done by the amazing Zoltan Leskovar. And the cover Foto on the Album is from my wonderful friend and great photographer - Dagmar Strohschen

 

Marcus Laghanke - Video Engineer

All of the beautiful videos done in this campaign were created by Marcus. So glad to have someone so capable of portraying me and my music.

 

Veronika Caspers - Graphic Design of Cover

 

Promotion Agent - King.ink Promotion

 

Big THANK YOU to PAUL RUNGE for the financial logistics of this campaign

 

Ralph :  Virtual Assistant

Location: Philippines

"As Judy’s virtual marketing assistant, I see almost everything that goes on behind the scenes when it comes to her music , and wow there’s a lot going on!

The biggest part of this album and crowdfunding campaign is the logistics. Keeping in constant contact with  contributors is tough, but throw in coordinating music, tracks, graphics, new mixes,  and you get Judy’s brand new album.

And it still doesn’t stop there. Beyond the album itself, there is this huge crowdfunding campaign to plan and execute! 

There are lots of details to iron out, and tons of decisions to make. Part of my job is to organize the chaos and make sure all these items are taken care of.

There is a lot going on but it is very fun and rewarding to be a part of it all. Working for Judy is absolutely great because I get a very unique opportunity to work in the music industry in such an innovative way. Judy knows her stuff when it comes to singing, and it is really great to work with such a highly talented person. Her creative and visionary mindset creates a fresh atmosphere to work in, and that is something you need in any business for it to move forward and become successful.

I’m excited for this campaign and look forward to the album launch afterwards!

Let’s make sure it happens by reaching our goal."

===============================>>

 

JUDY says......"Looking back over the past couple years, it's really amazing how this has all came together. I've learned over the years that nothing of worth is ever easy.  This album is no different. 

Sometimes I reflect on where I was five years after the recording of my 5th Album  thinking, I never seem to give up hoping to find people who love what I do - SINGING JAZZ   -  I hope you will spread the news.


Yet here we are... Sometimes you must pursue your dream no matter how much self-doubt we have. 

And on a funny note - Your involvement in making this album a success is also a nice sarcastic gesture to the labels  or people who have told me I wouldn't make it on my own, or that I can't be successful with jazz! 

 

I would be absolutely honored if you decide to be a Judy Rafat supporter & help with the final completion of this album and its release very soon!

 

If we don't make the goal, it means the album will still come out, but maybe not as far as we wanted. It depends how much promotion we will be able to do.

 

==========================>

 

HOW YOU CAN BE INVOLVED:

 

Bundle of Joy 1 (Download of the Album)

 

Bundle of Joy 2 (Physical CD autographed €30)

It`s Christmas Time Again Album  plus an autographed poster of me.

 

 

Bundle of Joy 3 (Physical CD autographed €50)

Receive a Physical CD of Judy's (It's Christmas Time Again Album)
with Autograph on the cover.
Included items in this perk:
1 T-shirt with Merry Christmas from Judy Rafat

 

Bundle of Joy 4 (3 CD`s €75)

 

Receive a combination of 3 of Judy`s albums.  First the beautiful Christmas CD 
                                                         + 
Digital Download of Con Alma - Tribute to Dizzy Gillespie album
                                                         +
Digital Download of Pure Inspiration Album of Judy`s amazing Band

 

Bundle of Joy 5 (Two CD´s + 1 t-shirt +1 mug €100)

Receive  One Physical CD and one download  of Judy's (It's Christmas Time Again Album)
with Autograph on the cover. Plus 1 Mug and 1 T-shirt.

 

Bundle of Joy 6 (Ticket to a Live Concert €150)

Receive a Ticket to a Concert of Judy Rafat. Plus 1 Autographed CD, 1 Mug and 1 T-shirt.

 

Bundle of Joy 7 (Two Voice Lessons €200)

 

Receive a Two Voice Lessons (either for speakers or singers) 
Plus 1 Autographed CD.

 

Bundle of Joy 8 (An Exclusive FREE Concert €500)

 

This is going to be personal Exclusive FREE Concert in your home or in an event with JUDY either with a pianist or band (The band members are not free)

Plus 1 Autographed CD, 1 Mug and 1 Digital Download of CD.

 

Bundle of Joy 9 (Sponsor €1000)

This is going to be personal Exclusive FREE Concert in your home or in an event with JUDY either with a pianist or band (The band members are not free)

Plus 1 Autographed CD, 1 Mug and 1 Digital Download of CD.

 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN BE INVOLVED:
 

 Even if you can`t contribute Euros, you can Join the JUDY RAFAT  street team for referral prizes <== (click to go to the FB group)

SHARE this campaign every few days with your network - Look for the Share buttons at the top of this campaign

 

EMBED this campaign on your website or blog

 

Spread the word to your friends & colleagues who might enjoy  beautiful music

 

If you're a music reviewer or promoter, we have spaces for interviews! Please send a message to info@judyrafat.de with the subject line: "Interview" 

 

I look forward to you joining this beautiful community with me, You will also get to hear this album before anyone else does!

JUDY RAFAT
