story:
A Beautiful Curse has been creating music and videos for years with two releases out currently, “As It Should Be” and “A Scar Is Born” and in a few months a movie score/soundtrack is coming out, but none of these have previously been released on vinyl.  

We're now ready to change all of that with your help.

For the sake of transparency, individually we've been on a few releases over the years on cassette tapes, cds, dvds, and digital streaming.  All of which are fantastic.  But we’ve never been on wax before.

The long and the short of it is, ABC would like to change all of that.  And thankfully with the resurgence/rebirth of vinyl and of course, with your help, we can make it a reality.

This Indiegogo campaign is centered around getting vinyl made of our debut release “As It Should Be”.  A while ago I got one copy made just to see what it would be like.  Having that singular copy in my hands gives me a sense of accomplishment pride but more than that, hearing it on a turntable me realize the full depth and vibrancy of the music itself and truthfully of music's potential in general. 

There’s something to be said about physical ownership.  Having a “thing” in my  hands personally makes that collection of songs more personal and more powerful.  A tangible item with music on it means so much more personally than just a folder of files on my phone or laptop or whatever.

With all of that in mind, this indiegogo crowd funding campaign is asking for your help in order to create this tangible art piece.  You digital folks are not left out either.  Each copy of the record comes with a download code so you can have the songs (and videos and what-not) on the device of your choosing.  In fact depending on which package you choose, the amount of digital and physical “stuff” is pretty big and all intertwined with your order.  Analog and digital co-existing in one world just for you.

So please, take a look around at what we have to offer with the perks and what-not, if you’re curious about what the project sounds like feel free to look for A Beautiful Curse on any of your streaming/download platforms you like, but ultimately, please contribute to this campaign to make this vinyl release a reality.  This campaign only goes until April 8th and there are limited album copies available so don’t miss out.

Thank you SO much for checking this out and helping out.  Please spread the word about this Indiegogo campaign in any way you can, and we’ll see you on the other side.  

Love y’all.
story_txt: A Beautiful Curse has been creating music and videos for years with two releases out currently, “As It Should Be” and “A Scar Is Born” and in a few months a movie score/soundtrack is coming out, but none of these have previously been released on vinyl.  We're now ready to change all of that with your help.For the sake of transparency, individually we've been on a few releases over the years on cassette tapes, cds, dvds, and digital streaming.  All of which are fantastic.  But we’ve never been on wax before.The long and the short of it is, ABC would like to change all of that.  And thankfully with the resurgence/rebirth of vinyl and of course, with your help, we can make it a reality.This Indiegogo campaign is centered around getting vinyl made of our debut release “As It Should story:
Over the course of three incredible days in February of 1982, legendary drummer Buddy Rich filmed three pilot episodes for "The Buddy Rich Show."

Shot at the former Café Rouge, in New York’s famous Statler Hotel, “The Buddy Rich Show” featured once-in-a-lifetime performances of The Buddy Rich Band alongside Buddy’s friends and fellow jazz greats including: Ray Charles, Mel Torme, Stan Getz, Gerry Mulligan, Lionel Hampton and Woody Herman. 

Hosted by Buddy, this live performance television show showcased incredible performances from Buddy and his big band interspersed with ultra-rare outtakes and footage of Buddy chatting with his guests.  The show also captures Buddy’s raw charisma and wit along with his spectacular drumset playing on such iconic tracks as, “Westside Story,” “Birdland,” “Love for Sale” and more.

This magnificently preserved footage of The Buddy Rich Band performing live with these legendary artists has NEVER been seen.

Now, drumming educational website, DrumChannel.com and its founder, Don Lombardi are committed to making these pristine, never-before-seen video recordings available for release. However, first they need to raise funds to pay the songwriters so they can finally make this never-before-seen footage available for music fans around the world and finally fulfill Buddy’s vision of creating a show, "made by musicians -- for musicians."

Buddy Rich is without question one of the most influential and talented drummers the world has ever known and this unique tv show concept was a passion project for him. When you pre-order “The Buddy Rich Show” you’ll have exclusive access to unique content, video outtakes, updates and special content from DrumChannel.com.

Now Drumchannel.com and some of Buddy's well-known fans in the drumming community are coming together to offer some truly rare and exclusive perks including:


Vintage Buddy Rich memorabilia

Signed drum heads from Stewart Copeland, Mick Fleetwood, Chad Smith & more!

Access to an exclusive VIP event at Drumchannel studios

Buddy Rich drum sticks & snare drum cases and MORE!

 


 

THE BUDDY RICH SHOW

Show 1 – February 16, 1982

"Bugle Call Rag" - Buddy Rich Band

"Down For Double" - Mel Torme

"Walkin’ Shoes" - Gerry Mulligan, Mel Torme, Buddy Rich

"Lady Be Good" - Gerry Mulligan, Mel Torme, Buddy Rich

"West Side Story" - Buddy Rich Band

"Walk On The Water" - Gerry Mulligan, Buddy Rich

"Soon It’s Gonna Rain" - Mel Torme, Gerry Mulligan, Buddy Rich

"Birdland"- Buddy Rich Band

 

Show 2 – February 17, 1982

"Greensleeves" - Buddy Rich Band

"Woodchopper’s Ball" - Woody Herman, Buddy Rich

"Sonny Boy" - Woody Herman, Buddy Rich

"Georgia On My Mind" - Ray Charles

"I’m Busted" - Ray Charles

"Cousins" - Woody Herman, Ray Charles, Buddy Rich

"Dancing Men" - Buddy Rich Band

 

Show 3 – February 18, 1982

"Birdland" - Buddy Rich Band

"The Dolphin" - Stan Getz, Buddy Rich

"Round Midnight" - Stan Getz, Buddy Rich

"Midnight Sun" - Lionel Hampton, Buddy Rich

"Hamp’s Boogie" - Lionel Hampton, Buddy Rich

"Love For Sale" - Buddy Rich Band

story:
Hey there! Hentaii here.

I'm an Austin, TX artist, drag queen, and now, musician. I get excited just typing that. Releasing music has been a dream of mine since I started experimenting with making electronic music as a teenager, but aside from a few song demos I released to Soundcloud in 2015, I lacked the confidence to ever pursue a fully-realized release.

I've spent the last three years performing around Austin and central Texas as Hentaii, my drag persona, and I couldn't have asked for a better confidence boost. The things I used to hate about myself, like my body and femininity, have come to be the things people have embraced me for, and more importantly, the things I have come to love about myself. I finally feel like I'm ready to pursue my bigger dreams as a musician and an artist. But, I need your help.

What We Need

At this point, the EP is fully written, composed, and recorded. We need your help to finish the mixing, mastering, and commercial release of the EP.

  • $250 will pay the remainder of producer Joe Stacey's labor costs for mixing, mastering, and finishing the album. Trust me when I say, this project has been a labor of love for both myself AND Joe. This amount is far lower than what he deserves for the amount of work he's put in already.
  • $500 will go toward funding the promotional release of the EP, paying for Instagram, Facebook, and print ads as well as the distribution fees. I am releasing this EP as an independent artist (no label).
  • $1000 will go toward funding the second music video off the EP, following the release of Magnetic.
  • Approximately half of the funds we raise will go toward printing and shipping the Magnetic Hentaii shirts, which are the main perk for this campaign! These shirts aren't a way for me to profit off of my music, or even a way to make back the money I've spent thus far. They are an incentive to help fund the future of this project, and 100% of the money made will go toward funding the project.

How can you support the EP?

I'm essentially using this campaign as a place to pre-order the EP, purchase the first single, Magnetic, as well as a place to purchase the Magnetic Hentaii T-shirt.

If I don't reach 100% of the goal, you will still receive your T-shirt and downloads, and I will compromise on advertising, promotion, and music video costs.

What You Get

  • $1 contributions will grant you an immediate download of the first single from the EP, Magnetic.
  • $5 contributions will grant you an immediate download of the first single from the EP, Magnetic, as well as a download of the full EP when it releases this summer.
  • $25 contributions will grant you the above perks, as well as the exclusive Magnetic Hentaii T-shirt, designed by my friend HadesIllustration. https://www.instagram.com/hadesillustration/ 

Why support THIS music project?

This EP is an opportunity to help expand the pathways for what it means to be a drag artist. Right now, the options available boil down to either performing in bars for criminally low pay for the rest of your life, or risking your entire career, reputation, mental health, and life by throwing your towel into the ring of exploitative reality television.

I want to show that queer artists, especially drag queens, can not only make their own music, but that they can do it without using the established pathways.

As a drag queen, I created the show //sub.rosa with the desire to inspire other drag artists like myself to start their own shows, shows that matter to them, instead of waiting around to be included into the shows that already existed at the time. I really do believe that //sub.rosa played a part in the "drag boom" we are experiencing in Austin now, and I know that this project has that same potential to shake things up.

Risks & Obstacles

Unfortunately, I think the major risk to this EP is the negative opinion toward drag queens making music. Let's be honest, a lot of the music drag queens have given us in the past few years hasn't been especially thoughtful. My project is going to be immediately lumped into the category of "drag queen music" because of who I am, how I present myself, and what I do. And I want that to happen.

The major obstacle for me is going to be changing the collective conception of what it means to be a drag queen and a musician. I wrote these songs, I composed them, and I finished them with Joe Stacey's help as the lead producer. I can only hope others will see them as valid, which is why your support means so much to me.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

Follow my instagram! www.instagram.com/prayforhentaii

Share/Stream the single: https://song.link/i/1456280755

Share the video: Video of Magnetic!

Tell your friends! Share this campaign!

story:
Hi, I'm Ida Leigh Watson...IDA LEIGH WATSON! It's finally happening. I'm finally recording an album. 

After spending an entire childhood deeply involved in other people's music, I was inspired to be creative and begin writing my own songs. So at the age of 27, I finally sat down and began writing. Playing. Learning. And a few years later, all that work has led here: my debut album. 

Your contributions will cover the whole process: production, engineering, recording, hired musicians, design, photography, printing, materials, etc. And if this campaign exceeds its goal, the extra money will fund my first tour in the fall.

 Help me fund this momentous endeavor!

 

All of your contributions will go towards the following:

  • Album Creation (Production, Engineering, Hired Musicians, Mixing/Mastering, Studio Time)
  • The Visuals (Photography, Graphic Design, Printing)
  • Any extra: Fall Tour!

If my goal is not met, all funds raised will still go towards the completion of this project.

Perks include:

  • The music! (Digital, CD, LP)
  • Merchandise (t-shirts, coffee mugs, bags, etc.)
  • Shoutout in liner notes
  • VIP experiences

 

Most importantly, share this campaign!

 

Want to hear my progress? https://www.idaleighwatson.com/music

Follow me on social media! Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/idaleighwatson/ Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/idaleighwatson/

Sign up to receive email updates! https://www.idaleighwatson.com/subscribe

THANK YOU!!

ILW

story:
ISA2: Defiance

I am hard at work on the follow-up to my 2018 debut, Chimera.

ISA's sophomore album, Defiance, will be a four-act love story, told through eleven songs that follow the narrator's journey to retrieve the soul of his recently-deceased lover, Cassandra. 

Musically, Defiance is a huge step forward from Chimera in every possible dimension, and I couldn't be more excited to share it with you.  I've been describing it as "psychedelic progressive blackened death metal" but that's not exactly a genre anyone will take seriously. Realistically, the album is full of influences from across the musical spectrum. There will be numerous guest musicians (including Katie Thompson of Chiasma!), live drums*, atmospheric clean vocals, acoustic guitars, orchestral arrangements, jazzy bass chords,  stompy riffs, guitar solos, saccharine falsettos, bass melodies, psychedelic effects, crazy time signature changes, tons of synth layers, and more!

There are three demo tracks here to sample. Do keep in mind that these are pre-production demos I've recorded in my living room, but each should nonetheless prove immersive and engaging. I've even filmed a bass play-through video of Despair, shot at Stompbox Sonic in Allston, MA! 

 

Professional Production

To ensure that you can actually hear every detail I put into this album, I've enlisted the help of Colin Marston to mix and master Defiance. He's one of the best mixing engineers in death metal, and is responsible for many of my favorite releases and biggest inspirations of the last few years, including recent albums by Pyrrhon, Imperial Triumphant, Artificial Brain, Falls of Rauros, and of course, Gorguts. I am so unbelievably stoked to be working with such a legend, and I know he will do the utmost justice to my vision.  As a relatively unknown solo musician, I feel it's an incredible honor to get to work with one of my idols, but professional services aren't free.

While I am planning on recording all guitars and bass myself, and seeking out ways to keep costs down, I'm anticipating production costs for recording drums and vocals, and mixing and mastering totaling near $5,000. 

Your digital pre-order contributions will go entirely towards these production costs for Defiance.

 

What's Next?

I will be wrapping up the pre-production demos for every track on the album, hopefully by the end of the year. These not only guide me towards making each song as good as it can be, but will also give Colin a detailed representation of my vision when he goes to mix the final recordings. There are three demos to listen to above, but I'm also making the rest of them available to you as a perk!  

Once the demos are complete, I'll begin the final recordings. These will hopefully be done by next summer, and then passed on to Colin for mixing and mastering. Physical merch pre-orders will go live through Bandcamp sometime next year, once the album is finished. If all goes according to plan, Defiance will be released before the end of 2020, and this awesome album art by Alex Eckman-Lawn will be forever immortalized in print. 

If you'd like to contribute, but also want physical merch when it launches next year, I'm happy to prorate purchase of physical merch by your digital pre-order amount. Just let me know!

Please help me by sharing this campaign! The more people that my music reaches, the more merch I'll be able to create. Thanks so much in advance for your support!

story:
Summary

This crowdfunding campaign is an appeal to collaborate, financially, with Very Good for the release of their newest album, Adulthood. The album will be released on vinyl record as well as CD and digital formats.

We are a theatrical chamber-rock band based out of New York City. The person writing is Sean Cronin, and he is/I am the main reason all of this insanity happens. We've been working hard on this record for a long time, and we're very excited to share it with the world. I believe it to be quite different, quite unique to this particular group of people at this particular moment of time.

Basically, we're trying to cover both the cost the actual product (vinyl/CD/digital), and the cost of proper publicity for the album release.

The cost of pressing vinyl is quite high, but I realized that if I don't start trying to make albums that sound as amazing as possible now, it may not happen. And vinyl is what that sounds like. I suppose I may have entered my "uncompromising artist" phase.

As far as publicity costs go, many artists like myself have often felt great about the music we have recorded, only to have the boxes full of this beautiful art sit in our apartments, gathering dust (and taking up valuable NYC real-estate!). With this album, I have resolved to give it the push that I know the music deserves, which requires that I work with people who are MUCH better at public relations (PR) than I am. 

Are you picking up on the "Adulthood" theme, here? This is the real grown-up stuff.

At certain stages it can be a challenge to make the art AND generate the finance necessary to make the art. IF we can reach these goals, simply put it means that we can release this record in a way that will perpetuate the cycle of creation, and we can keep making more albums and concentrating on the work we do, instead of how to pay off our credit cards, etc...

I want this album to be something that generates new pathways of possibility for myself and the other amazing artists involved to share what we have to offer, and to do so unimpeded by the limitations of our finance. Separate from this project, that's what I want to see happening with people's creations.

If you share this belief, and happen to be interested in what we're doing as a group, please consider helping us reach our goal!

What We Need & What You Get

The specific costs are as follows:

300 Records = $2484

500 CDs = $795

Publicist = $3600

Paying band (for release show) = $1800 (8 band members @ $200 + 4 guests @ $50)

Mixing/mastering = $1100

Paying band for recording sessions = $2000 (8 band members @ $200 + 6 guests @ $50)

Cost of making campaign = $200

Advertising = $250

Rehearsal Space = $200

Venue = $100

Two music videos = $1400 

Set work for performance = $200

Total = $14,129

 

Rewards

We have many different and unique rewards to offer you in exchange for your help!

(Over) $20 donation:

 - Very Good Glasses

 

$25 donation: 

 - Very Good glasses

 - CD recording 

 

$50 donation: 

 - Very Good Glasses

 - Vinyl record (with download code)

 

$100 donation: 

 - Very Good Glasses

 - Vinyl record (with download code)

 - a vegan home-cooked meal here at my house OR a high-quality print of the album art (painted by Betsy Levine)

 

$250 donation: 

 - Very Good Glasses

 - Vinyl record (with download code)

 - 10 second stop-motion animation with a theme of your choosing to be used on istagram or wherever (completed by Christmas-time by Sean).

 

$500 donation: 

 - Very Good Glasses

 - Vinyl Record (with download code)

 - 8 hr day of session work as a bass player  

OR 

 - 2 ten second claymations with a theme of your choosing (by xmas holidays)

 

$1000 donation: 

 - Very Good Glasses

 - Vinyl record (with download code)

 - 30 minute Ten-hand massage with specialized ambient music written just for you.

OR

 - A musical piece especially by myself, Sean Cronin, written using the words from a recording I will make of you speaking.

 

IF WE DON'T REACH OUR GOAL... the album still gets released on CD and vinyl, the show still happens, the PR campaign still flies, the band still gets paid for the show. Everything is basically as it would be, except that Sean has to get very very creative in non-artistic ways for next while in order to pay himself back all the money he has spent/will spend. 

Anyway, thank you from the bottom of my little weirdo heart for even taking a moment to consider donating to this campaign. I know that not everyone can show their support in the form of energy known as money and if you want to do so in any other way, it's also appreciated (such as: sharing on social media, hugging in real life, buying the album after it comes out, coming out to our shows, hugs, just being really truly authentically yourself and doing your best work, and hugging me or other people). I know it's difficult to wade through all the information and "advertising" in this virtual realm, so even the fact that you're checking this out, and aware of what I'm doing and interested in is BEAUTIFUL and I'm very grateful for this.

I hope your journeys lead you to illumination and expansion and that you allow yourself to be the beautiful weirdo you are, if only in certain circumstances. Like starting a band. Or making an album.

Very Good.

 

VIDEO by Sergio Carrasco

 

Album credits:

Written and produced by Sean Cronin

 

Sean Cronin - Lead Vocals, Bass, Guitar, Piano, Banjolele, Percussion

Adam Brisbin - Vocals, Guitar, Drums

Evan Arntzen - Vocals, Saxophone, Clarinet, Percussion

Kate Foster - Vocals

Nathan Ellman-Bell - Drums

Pete Lanctot - Violin, Viola

Jared Engel - Banjo, Plectrum Resophonic Guitar, Bass, Tuba

Andrew Millar - Drums

“Light’s Refrain” also features:

Ginger Dolden - Violin

Tammy Scheffer, Katie Lee, Sivan Arbel, Lily Henley- Vocals

“Adulthood” also features 

Ned Goold - Saxophone solo

Joe McDonough - Trombone

 

Recorded by Adam Brisbin, Sean Cronin, and Pete Lanctot (“Light’s Refrain”) at 9 Parkside Court, Brooklyn NY

Mixed by Adam Brisbin

Mastered by Dan Millice

 

Painting by Betsy Levine (original photograph by Katie Lee)

Lettering and design by Martin Reisle

 

all songs copyright 2019
story_txt:
Summary
This crowdfunding campaign is an appeal to collaborate, financially, with Very Good for the release of their newest album, Adulthood. The album will be released on vinyl record as well as CD and digital formats.
We are a theatrical chamber-rock band based out of New York City. The person writing is Sean Cronin, and he is/I am the main reason all of this insanity happens. We've been working hard on this record for a long time, and we're very excited to share it with the world. I believe it to be quite different, quite unique to this particular group of people at this particular moment of time.
Basically, we're trying to cover both the cost the actual product (vinyl/CD/digital), and the cost of proper publicity for the album release.
The cost of pressing vinyl is quite high, but I realized that if I don't start trying to make albums that sound as amazing as possible now, it may not happen. And vinyl is what that sounds like. I suppose I may have entered my "uncompromising artist" phase.
As far as publicity costs go, many artists like myself have often felt great about the music we have recorded, only to have the boxes full of this beautiful art sit in our apartments, gathering dust (and taking up valuable NYC real-estate!). With this album, I have resolved to give it the push that I know the music deserves, which requires that I work with people who are MUCH better at public relations (PR) than I am. 
Are you picking up on the "Adulthood" theme, here? This is the real grown-up stuff.
At certain stages it can be a challenge to make the art AND generate the finance necessary to make the art. IF we can reach these goals, simply put it means that we can release this record in a way that will perpetuate the cycle of creation, and we can keep making more albums and concentrating on the work we do, instead of how to pay off our credit cards, etc...
I want this album to be something that generates new pathways of possibility for myself and the other amazing artists involved to share what we have to offer, and to do so unimpeded by the limitations of our finance. Separate from this project, that's what I want to see happening with people's creations.
If you share this belief, and happen to be interested in what we're doing as a group, please consider helping us reach our goal!

What We Need & What You Get
The specific costs are as follows:
300 Records = $2484
500 CDs = $795
Publicist = $3600
Paying band (for release show) = $1800 (8 band members @ $200 + 4 guests @ $50)
Mixing/mastering = $1100
Paying band for recording sessions = $2000 (8 band members @ $200 + 6 guests @ $50)
Cost of making campaign = $200
Advertising = $250
Rehearsal Space = $200
Venue = $100
Two music videos = $1400 
Set work for performance = $200
Total = $14,129

story:
Short Summary

UPDATE! Keep it coming!... note: a number of people have found it easier to donate via my fiscal sponsor link and a couple gave cash.  Right now, therefore, the actual donated amount is about $1150!... If you are here, use this page!... Thanks!! Happy to exceed goal overall... set it a little low anyways!...

My name is Christopher Kaufman.  I have dedicated my life to the creation and presentation of new music and art.  For this purpose I founded CHIRON Performing Arts in 1991, and have enjoyed years of working with wonderful artists of all disciplines and presenting their work and my own.

The event for which I request your support is a landmark event for CHIRON - The New York Premiere of Eugene O’Brien’s ‘Algebra of Night’ - for Voice, Piano Quartet and the words of New York Poets. This music is a masterpiece from an important American composer.  Eugene O’Brien has influenced the lives and work of a generation of composers, through his music and his work as a teacher.

He was, in fact, my teacher in my formative years just after high school when I attended the Cleveland Institute of Music. His approach was to guide me on my path as an artist with gentleness and powerful support, which serves me to this day.  We will also present two world premieres of my own music and a newly furbished version of my environmental work, Hudson Valley Music.

We are featuring a collection of highly respected world-class musicians with international reputations. Your support helps us pay them!... as well as hall rental costs and the like.

They are:
Clara Osowski - mezzo soprano, Gregory Fulkerson - violin, Taka Kigawa - piano, Robert Dick - flute(s), Daniel Rieppel - piano, Monica Bauchwitz - violin and members of the String Orchestra of New York City.

What We Need & What You Get

We need help paying for our artists, hall rental costs, marketing and travel. Clara Osowski and co-director Daniel Rieppel are traveling here from Minnesota to join us here.

Each musician has an independent contract for participation, some use agents, others are regular CHIRON artists. Needless to say the total far exceeds the amount we are going for in this campaign. We received an independent donation which helps, but there is a ways to go.

Your contribution - at any level - will help immensely!  I did an indiegogo campaign a few years back for equipment to perform my environmental works far and wide... I use them often!

There is no way overstate both the importance of this event to our work and community and our appreciation for your support.

We have perks!... you’ll see them on our page.

OUR PERKS: Christopher Kaufman will prepare an album of the concert and deliver it to you via ‘we transfer’. Tickets are offered. Kaufman’s highly original album of his environmental works where he creates piece with natural sounds mixed with live performance. One such will be on the concert - Hudson Valley Music - but there many more. All such albums delivered on line.

If we do not reach the stated goal... the funds are still used for the project.

The Impact

The Mission of CHIRON Performing Arts is to present the evolutionary visions of artists via powerful and exciting performances by world-class musicians. It has also been to bring the arts from the Ivory Tower to the Community. We’ve been doing that for quite a while now, since 1991.

I am proud to say that via CHIRON, I have presented the work of hundreds of Artists of all disciplines. We have held chamber concerts all over New York, including radio shows and collaborations with symphony orchestras.

For two years, recently,  I put my two concert series types, CHIRON and The Phantastic Theater (my concert series presenting new music and art to family-based audiences), into one, titled The CHIRON Festival for the Arts and Environment. For this I had guests such as Arunima Roy - a member of Jane Goodall’s National Youth Council. I featured environmental pieces on these events. There is a great deal of information about these events on our website, including videos, press and music players. We have a long track record to investigate if you wish!

It is our belief that the arts should demonstrate the complete human intelligence and thus participate in the evolution of humankind. We attempt to participate in this process in a natural way, by focusing on our love of music and engaging imagination as much as we can.

Please join us... offer support through this campaign... come to the concert... join email list so we can keep you abreast of our activities and future events!

Risks & Challenges

Putting together an innovative, enthralling and meaningful program comes naturally to us. The artists involved are extremely talented and ready to go.  The only limiting factor to our work for is financial. This is why we reach out to you for support.

Our qualifications and experience is quite profound. I achieved my doctorate in music composition in 1991, and studied with a number of world-class composers... including Gene O’Brien.  You can find out much more about me at my home site - www.soundartus.com. Co-Director Daniel Rieppel has been a champion of New Music for many years. He is a beloved teacher in his own right and conducts the SWMinnesota Orchestra. 

Our featured guest Artist, Eugene O'Brien - composer, has a list of accomplishments and awards which would take the rest of these pages to list.  Many can be seen on our promotional video! Suffice it to say, he is an important American Composer, Artist and Teacher and it is our greatest honor to present his music.  Especially the New York Premiere of this piece which features the words of New York Poets.  It is an historic occasion.

Our Musicians are out of this world. Gregory Fulkerson toured world-wide with the revival of Glass’s ‘Einstein on the Beach’, and performs Don Erb’s Violin Sonata on a regular basis. Robert Dick is perhaps the premiere new music flutist and composer on planet Earth. Taka Kigawa is internationally known for his super dynamic performances of the most difficult works as well as his sensitive performances of familiar ones.  Monica Bauchwitz is well-known as a leading violinist and concert producer in NYC and, last but not least, Clara Osowski is a premiere singer of the finest stripe hailing from the artistic heartland of our country, Minneapolis. Minnesota.

Come hear them perform! Please help us pay them!

Other Ways You Can Help

These campaigns have positive effects beyond financial assistance. They force one to reach out and communicate dreams and plans, to put everything into words... to push one's work out into the universe... often with unforeseen rewards.  We look forward to these!

Please, at the least, come to the event and see/hear it for yourself. We will accept support at that time as well :)... in order to help create next year’s events. Help put the word out. Invite friends, share links and facebook posts when you see them.  Use indiegogo SHARE TOOLS!

Thank you so very much!  - CHIRON Performing Arts

story:
LET'S CREATE UNITY THROUGH MUSIC TOGETHER! 


In these crazy times we're living in, there are many divisions on one hand and many things that unite us on the other! Vanisha and I have a vision for a more positive future that involves us coming together with shared purpose.

We create music that brings people together and connects them with a deeper part of themselves! I use music to heal, inspire and uplift. I even relate to music as a spiritual practice (Nada Yoga)

Music has inspired and influenced social and political movements throughout the world. It has led me to my spiritual path and has helped shaped my views and moral compass. I'm sure it does this for everyone.

I was going to release this campaign in March. Then COVID happened. Now, is the time - this project cannot wait any longer! Vanisha of Sing for your Soul is joining me on this mission!

We believe we all have our role in constructing the world that is to come. Our role is to share music combined with our knowledge of healing and transforming the mind. We’re bringing positive uplifting messages and visions to listeners in a way that's catchy, fun and quite frankly, banging! 

What we will create together
Our combined efforts will produce an ALBUM, with high quality audio, recording, mixing and mastering. This will be available online and as a CD. All pledges will receive the first single before anyone else. You can get the album before anyone else.
I aim to release the album by my next birthday (Jan 9th 2021). 

Your pledges will assist in paying a fair wage to the fantastic musicians who will be involved in the creation of this album.

We will be producing promotional material - All of the material we have produced so far has been produced on a very low budget and often has used borrowed equipment. You will see some high quality music videos and will be able to follow me every step of the way. You will know that you have contributed to making this happen.
 

What will the pledges go toward?​

Your pledges will cover a range of things:

  • Album production: recording studio time, equipment costs, mixing, mastering and musician hire.
  • Music video production: hire of film maker.
  • Promotion: Content creation for various online platforms, hiring professional marketing strategist and developing online campaign.
  • Distribution: Digital and physical distribution costs.


What you will get
EVERY PLEDGE YOU MAKE COMES WITH REWARDS. If you are pledging extra to support this project and are not interested in a specific reward, then please let us know as you pledge.

Thanks for your love and support! Please pledge the highest amount that makes sense to you and LET'S MAKE THIS HAPPEN!

story:
Broken Strings & New Beginnings

 

Hi there! I'm Ben Turner, and I'm a musician from Wexford, in the sunny south east of Ireland.

 

At the age of nineteen, I packed my bags and left the peaceful countryside of Co. Wexford for the hustle and bustle of Dublin. I began busking on the street corners of Temple Bar. It was there that I developed my love for performing, and began to properly develop my voice and style. After a year, I left Ireland to see where the music would take me. Since then, I've been lucky enough to busk my way across more than ten countries, and played many beautiful gigs along the way.

 

Street Songs

Busking has been an amazing way to see the world. I've observed countless smiling and crying faces, embraces and breakups, love and grief. I've played for travellers, business people, the homeless and a thousand other people along the way. I've had heartfelt conversations with strangers, that would have never happened had I not been playing. It's incredibly humbling every time someone approaches me to thank me for my music, and I don't take it lightly. All these experiences make their way into a notebook eventually, and with a bit of luck they grow into songs. I've sold my songs on homemade CDs for years, but the more I thought about the people who found some kind of solace in my music, the more I wanted to create something worthy of them. At the end of 2019, I decided it was time to book a studio, and record my first full length album.

 

 

Big Red Button

I've been working on the album in the Black Gate Studio in Galway City. Joining me are a group of friends and fantastic musicians, who have helped to bring the sketches in my notebooks to life.

 

Bass:  Sam Wright (My Fellow Sponges, Tracy Bruen, Anna Mullarkey)

Drums: Adam Downey (Tracy Bruen, Bury Me With My Money, The Rubber Wellies) & Dave Shaughnessy (My Fellow Sponges, Anna Mullarkey)

Strings: Neil Fitzgibbon (D'bize)

Keys: Dave Mongan (The Weightless Astronauts)

Recording & Mixing: Liam King (The Black Gate Studios)

 

Nuts & Bolts

 

 I've always financed my touring, recording, booking and other expenses myself. However, a project of this size is too much for me to finish on my own.

Making a record as an independent artist is expensive, and I need your help to bring this project from the three quarter stage, to a finished record. The album is almost finished, but there's still quite a bit to go.

I've set up this campaign to pay for the final recording, mixing and mastering of the album. The money will also go towards getting the album printed and pressed on CD and vinyl, as well as some exclusive merchandise. Here's how it breaks down:

 

-Mixing/Mastering: 4000

-Printing/Duplication of CDs and Vinyls: 2500

-Merch: 300

-Further Running Costs: 1000

-Postage: 200

=8000

(Not including 5% IndieGogo service fee & 3% payment processing fee)

 

This album has been a long time coming, but now I feel it's the time to let it spread its wings.

I've been really blessed to play for so many of you, and I owe it to you to release the best record possible. With your help, we can give it the push it needs to be the best that it can be.

 

Rewards

I want to give something back in return for your generosity!

There are lots of perks to choose from when you make your pledge. As well as CDs and vinyls, there's exclusive merch like t-shirts, tote bags, badges, stickers, handwritten lyrics, lessons and lots more. Just have a look around and see what catches your eye!

 

Let's Do This

 

I'm so excited to the get this record of the ground. It really feels like the start of something bigger, and I'm so glad that I can bring you with me on this journey.

Any support you can afford to give this project is greatly appreciated. If you can't afford to donate, that's fine! You can help a lot by sharing this page with any people as you can, and building a community in the process.

To all of you that have braved the weather to watch me busk, bought me a coffee, reached out for a chat, left a note, come to a gig or simply shared a kind word, you have my deepest gratitude.

You have allowed me to carry on sharing music around the world, and taught me so much about life, kindness and the immense beauty of the human spirit.

I can't wait to share these songs with you.

 

Thank you x

 

Links

YouTube: https://youtu.be/Na00iI6l0hA

Stream/Buy: https://benturner1.bandcamp.com/releases?fbclid...

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/benturner.music/

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/benturnermusicofficial
story_txt:
Broken Strings & New Beginnings Hi there! I'm Ben Turner, and I'm a musician from Wexford, in the sunny south east of Ireland.
 
At the age of nineteen, I packed my bags and left the peaceful countryside of Co. Wexford for the hustle and bustle of Dublin. I began busking on the street corners of Temple Bar. It was there that I developed my love for performing, and began to properly develop my voice and style. After a year, I left Ireland to see where the music would take me. Since then, I've been lucky enough to busk my way across more than ten countries, and played many beautiful gigs along the way.

 
Street Songs
Busking has been an amazing way to see the world. I've observed countless smiling and crying faces, embraces and breakups, love and grief. I've played for travellers, business people, the homeless and a thousand other people along the way. I've had heartfelt conversations with strangers, that would have never happened had I not been playing. It's incredibly humbling every time someone approaches me to thank me for my music, and I don't take it lightly. All these experiences make their way into a notebook eventually, and with a bit of luck they grow into songs. I've sold my songs on homemade CDs for years, but the more I thought about the people who found some kind of solace in my music, the more I wanted to create something worthy of them. At the end of 2019, I decided it was time to book a studio, and record my first full length album.
 

 
Big Red Button
I've been working on the album in the Black Gate Studio in Galway City. Joining me are a group of friends and fantastic musicians, who have helped to bring the sketches in my notebooks to life.
 
Bass:  Sam Wright (My Fellow Sponges, Tracy Bruen, Anna Mullarkey)
Drums: Adam Downey (Tracy Bruen, Bury Me With My Money, The Rubber Wellies) & Dave Shaughnessy (My Fellow Sponges, Anna Mullarkey)
Strings: Neil Fitzgibbon (D'bize)
Keys: Dave Mongan (The Weightless Astronauts)
Recording & Mixing: Liam King (The Black Gate Studios)
 
Nuts & Bolts
 
 I've always financed my touring, recording, booking and other expenses myself. However, a project of this size is too much for me to finish on my own.
Making a record as an independent artist is expensive, and I need your help to bring this project from the three quarter stage, to a finished record. The album is almost finished, but there's still quite a bit to go.
I've set up this campaign to pay for the final recording, mixing and mastering of the album. The money will also go towards getting the album printed and pressed on CD and vinyl, as well as some exclusive merchandise. Here's how it breaks down:
 
-Mixing/Mastering: 4000-Printing/Duplication of CDs and Vinyls: 2500-Merch: 300-Further Running Costs: 1000-Postage: 200=8000(Not including 5% IndieGogo service fee & 3% payment processing fee) This album has been a long time coming, but now I feel it's the time to let it spread its wings.I've been really blessed to play for so many of you, and I owe it to you to release the best record possible. With your help, we can give it the push it needs to be the best that it can be. RewardsI want to give something back in return for your generosity!There are lots of perks to choose from when you make your pledge. As well as CDs and vinyls, there's exclusive merch like t-shirts, tote bags, badges, stickers, handwritten lyrics, lessons and lots more. Just have a look around and see what catches your eye! Let's Do This I'm so excited to the get this record of the ground. It really feels like the start of something bigger, and I'm so glad that I can bring you with me on this journey.Any support you can afford to give this project is greatly appreciated. If you can't afford to donate, that's fine! You can help a lot by sharing this page with any people as you can, and building a community in the process.To all of you that have braved the weather to watch me busk, bought me a coffee, reached out for a chat, left a note, come to a gig or simply shared a kind word, you have my deepest gratitude.You have allowed me to carry on sharing music around the world, and taught me so much about life, kindness and the immense beauty of the human spirit.I can't wait to share these songs with you. Thank you x LinksYouTube: https://youtu.be/Na00iI6l0hAStream/Buy: https://benturner1.bandcamp.com/releases?fbclid...Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/benturner.music/Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/benturnermusicofficial

story:
Hello lovely people,  

I am finally making my first solo record! While this is both a very exciting and extremely nerve-wracking announcement to make, it unfortunately must be made via a crowdfunding platform. I only use the word "unfortunately" because these are hard times for all, or most of us, and also because asking for money makes me truly uncomfortable. However, what makes me feel a bit better is the fact that the majority of the money I raise here will be going directly toward paying other creative people for helping me make this album happen, and happen how I've really wanted it to happen for years now, in a professional studio, hiring talented friends to join me, and hopefully having a little left over to get it out to all of you and wherever else I can get it in the universe once it is completed. 

I'm sure most of you have heard every version of a musician explaining how expensive it is to make an album and make it right, so I'll spare you another one and instead just say that between my own personal savings and the generosity of very close friends, I already have just barely enough raised to afford the actual In studio time, so genuinely the reason I am doing this campaign is to afford to pay the artists who will be playing on the record with me, helping me produce it, and as I said hopefully paying someone to help get it on all the proper streaming platforms and into the ether etc... 

I am really excited to share these songs with you all and to make sure everyone who helps me make them is shown the love they deserve. 

Again these times are tough and wild but us artists gotta keep at it anyways.

Much love and thanks!

-mws

story:
Short Summary

Hi Everyone! I've decided to embark on this journey (..don't stop believing) and started recording new music in this crazy times we are living.  For those who know me, I've been making music all my life and probably will never stop. I have written a lot of new songs and as an artist I feel the need to put them out there, specially ONE SONG THAT TALKS ABOUT INEQUALITY AND LACK OF JUSTICE in this times, because I still believe music can help to change the world and make us better. Thanks to this platform you can help us achieve that. I have already started recording but I really need your help to finish this record, any contribution would be greatly appreciated !!!

Our goal is to raise about $8,000 to finish the record

All your contributions will go towards studio cost, mixing, mastering, fabrication, distribution and you will also help other fellow musicians that I will hire to record with me.

If you help, you will get a signed copy, picture and other goodies!!!

Please share this with your friends maybe someone else can help too!

Thank you very much for your support!!!!!

Love,

DAMIAN

story:
Summary

Many of you have known me from the time when I was a guitarist/ singer songwriter. What you may not know is that those days ended long ago while I was living in New Orleans and Focal Dystonia affected my left hand leaving me unable to play guitar.

To combat the frustration and ward off depression I began exploring composing. Eventually composing became my passion and I started on a long road of self study and private lessons which eventually bore fruit with an award winning orchestral work and performances of my music in the U.S, Mexico, Cuba and throughout Central America.

When 2020 began I was looking forward to a promising year ahead with various performances of my music in Latin America, the U.S. and Europe. Needless to say all of these performances were canceled and this year looks to be similar. That is why I have decided to record a favorite work of mine and what has brought me here to ask for your help.

A composer’s life is rather isolated if the composer is unable to perform on her or his instrument. There is no inspirational interplay with other musicians, no jam sessions, no rehearsals and no concerts or gigs. There is just the solitude of sitting in a room with your keyboard trying to give birth to new music that people will hopefully not only enjoy, but also will be moved by. However if that music is never performed then those creations are stillborn laying lifeless on sheets of paper.

 

The objective of this recording is 3 fold:

1. A composer needs exposure without that he /she has no  career. This recording will allow me to present my music to radio stations throughout North America and Europe. Airplay on these stations will give me the exposure I desperately need right now.

2. It will allow me to present a quality live recording of my work to professional musicians when talking about future projects or commissions.

3. It will be the first of a series of compositions for Clarinet, Cello, Piano trio that take their influence from both the jazz and classical world.

 

Expense Breakdown

Studio time: recording and mixing                                  23%         $250

Musicians rehearsal, recording time                              60%        $750

Musician travel stipend, Indiegogo %, Misc. costs    17%         $250

Total    ______________________________________________   $1250

 

The Musicians

Guy Yehuda is recognized as one of the most outstanding and unique talents on the international concert stage. Hailed by composer John Corigliano as “One of the most awe-inspiring clarinetists today.”  

Mr. Yehuda has toured extensively in Europe, North America, and Israel. As principal clarinetist, Mr. Yehuda has performed with the Lucerne Contemporary Festival Orchestra, Chicago Civic Orchestra, Spoleto Festival Orchestra, Haifa Symphony Orchestra, and Cincinnati Chamber Orchestra, among others, as well as guest clarinetist with the Israel Philharmonic, Chicago Symphony Orchestra and the Jacksonville Symphony Orchestra

Yu-Lien The has performed throughout the US, Europe and Southeast-Asia, including appearances as a soloist with the Nordwestdeutsche Philharmonie, the Kammerorchester Hannover, and the Baroque Orchestra L'Arco. Other notable performances include a two-piano recital with Lori Sims of Messiaen’s “Visions de l’Amen” in 2008 and a lecture-recital of “The Other Diabelli-Variations” in 2012, both at the Gilmore International Keyboard Festival in Kalamazoo, Michigan. 

A prizewinner of the 12th International Piano Competition Viotti-Valsesia (Italy) and the Deutsche Musikwettbewerb, she was admitted to the National Concert Podium for Young Artists (Germany)

Abraham Feder has been the Assistant Principal Cello for the Detroit Symphony Orchestra since 2018. Prior to his appointment, he was a member of the Dallas Symphony Orchestra. During the summer of 2018, he served as the Assistant Principal Cellist of the Santa Fe Opera. Abraham began his orchestral career as Principal Cellist of the Sarasota Orchestra and Cellist of the Sarasota String Quartet from 2008-2016.

Abraham has been featured as a soloist with the Sarasota Orchestra, Duluth Superior Symphony Orchestra, Orchestra of the Americas, and the Chicago Youth Symphony Orchestra. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you are unable to donate at this time you can still help out by spreading the word. One way to do that is by using the Indiegogo share tools!  Thank you for spreading the word!

story:
Our Story

Passaggio Oper is an emerging opera company dedicated to bridging the gap and breaking the distance between the audience and the performers by making opera relatable, current, and real. Our artists consist of extremely talented emerging young professionals who are on the pathway or passageway to a professional career and who have come together with the shared love for beautiful music in order to bring that music to life on stage to modern and diverse audiences. Our idea was forged in Schöneberg, Berlin at the start of 2016, with the goal of combining quality, passion, and sincerity to create an authentic opera experience while making opera accessible to everyone. 

Because of your support, we were able to put on six full operas with orchestra: Mozart's Le Nozze di Figaro, at the ehemaliges stummfilmkino Delphi Theater Berlin in May 2016, Puccini's La Boheme, at the Brotfabrik Berlin in October 2016, R. Strauss's Ariadne auf Naxos at the Pfefferberg Theater Berlin in April 2017, Mozart's Don Giovanni at the Pfefferberg Theater Berlin in October 2017, Offenbach's Les Contes d'Hoffmann at the Pfefferberg Theater in June 2018, and then Puccini's La Boheme revival at the Pfefferberg Theater in November 2018.  Because of the success of our previous six operas which were only made possible because of YOU, we are now working on our SEVENTH opera, and FIRST virtual opera, Gianni Schicchi by Giacomo Puccini. 

Puccini's Gianni Schicchi is a hilarious story of greed and selfishness, ending with a satisfying deception that has you rooting for the "villain".  When a family zoom call starts with a sudden on-screen death, things quickly escalate to chaos as the family tries to change the will of the deceased in order to best serve themselves.  They have no idea what hits them when Gianni Schicchi joins the call, and things go from bad to worse in this quirky, slightly dark comedy. 

There are so many different types of conflicts in the news today. From cancelled culture, to Q-anon believers, to a battle between the left and the right wings, it’s hard for all these different sides to see eye-to-eye. It’s even more difficult when it’s your own relatives that you don’t agree with. The internet is abuzz with stories of family zoom calls going south very quickly in situations just like this. Our aim when presenting “Gianni Schicchi” is to showcase that no one side or belief is above another. If we don’t work together to find a solution, we can’t achieve anything. Or in the case of the Donati family in Gianni Schicchi, if they don’t work together, they are left wide open and unsuspecting when a deceptive con-man comes along…Join Passaggio Oper's unique zoom call via youtube, coming to you in May 2021!  We are so excited to put on this hilarious and beautiful "zoom" opera, and now more than ever we need YOUR help once again! 

You can check out our website here to learn more about our team and get more information about our seventh opera: www.passaggio-oper.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

This is where we need your help.  To put on Gianni Schicchi, we will need to raise about $4,000.  In previous operas, there were so many costs involved including the venue, pianist, orchestra, rehearsal spaces, costumes, marketing material, and the set.  Because of this pandemic however, the costs we need to cover are a bit different.  Although we still need to raise money for the costumes, props, marketing, and conductor, for all of us performers it feels like Corona has taken away our careers, our livelihood and even our passion.  Therefore, the majority of your donations will go straight to the artists who have been struggling because of this pandemic and cancelled culture.  Your generous donations will help sustain our performers through this pandemic.  Together we will keep the arts alive and will not let a pandemic take away what we all love the most!  

Here is an exact breakdown of what we are trying to raise for Gianni Schicchi:

Costumes and Props: $250

Pianist/conductor fee : $300

Posters and marketing materials: $150

Artist fee: $300 per performer (11 performers x $300 = $3,300)

Total Cost: $4,000

Every donation you give gets you a special perk-from a personal mention on our social media sites, a digital audio CD of Gianni Schicchi, to a digital video of the opera and a ticket for our online performance!  Plus, anyone who donates will get their name printed on our website and digital program. The perk you get depends on the amount you donate.  You can see which donation gets you which perk on the right side of this page! 

 

The Impact

Our mission is to create performance opportunities for ourselves and fellow singers in a setting we can be proud of and our audiences can be moved by, while upholding the quality and integrity of this beautiful art form.

By donating, you will help us keep the arts alive, because for so many of us it feels as if the pandemic has taken that away.  With your help, we will bring motivation, passion, and opera back to this pandemic-ridden world. Together, art will not be silenced!  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, or if you want to help us even more, you can also help by sharing our campaign and posting this link on all the social networking websites like Facebook, Instagram, Google +, Twitter, and even e-mail! We will appreciate every little thing you do!

Thank you for everything and for being our biggest support!

story:
Hey guys! 

I'm Karissa! I'm a songwriter, musician, singer, and worship leader in Memphis, TN and I am releasing my very first 6-song EP this year! This record consists of songs I've written breathed from the Word of God, words and revelations He's given me, all mixed with personal life experiences. I have the BEST team working with me who all love the Lord and are pretty phenomenal creatives and musicians. 

This project is a dream of mine and an avenue for me to share God's and my heart with the world! I can't wait for you all to hear it SOON. 

However, this project is no simple nor small task so I'm asking for your help...If you would like donate to help with the costs of this EP which includes the costs of studio time, musicians, and my producer, you can donate right HERE on my indiegogo page. 

If you can't support me financially, it's alright! I still want you along for the beautiful ride God is taking me on! Follow me, pray for me, listen to the music when it comes out, and SHARE this page with your family and friends who may be able and willing to donate. 

I have the best supporters ever from my hometown in Iowa to my current city, Memphis, and in countries across the world. I love you all so much! 

Thank you! 

More to come...

I have the BEST team working with me who all love the Lord and are pretty phenomenal creatives and musicians. This project is a dream of mine and an avenue for me to share God's and my heart with the world! I can't wait for you all to hear it SOON. However, this project is no simple nor small task so I'm asking for your help...If you would like donate to help with the costs of this EP which includes the costs of studio time, musicians, and my producer, you can donate right HERE on my indiegogo page. If you can't support me financially, it's alright! I still want you along for the beautiful ride God is taking me on! Follow me, pray for me, listen to the music when it comes out, and SHARE this page with your family and friends who may be able and willing to donate. I have the best supporters ever from my hometown in Iowa to my current city, Memphis, and in countries across the world. I love you all so much! Thank you! More to come...

story:
Our Goal - Pressing Defence Mechanisms to Vinyl

 

[After a tumultuous 2020, Bruise Pristine emerges in 2021 as Second Idol.]

 


 

We are excited to unleash our EP Defence Mechanisms and want to bring it to you in April 2021, on vinyl.  

 

The 5-track EP explores concepts of power and control, ambition and listlessness, political frustration, queerness and gender, all fuelled with a relentless vengeance. Defence Mechanisms sees us take on an aggressive and emotive sound layered with elements of shoegaze and post-punk, parcelled together in our moody and grungy alt-rock sound.

 

We want to bring our latest creation to you - music lovers and our fans, but we need a little help.

 

Support That We Need

We are seeking to raise $2,000 to help us cover the cost of pressing 100 10” 5-track EPs (total cost approx. $2,500).

 

Releasing an EP on vinyl has long been an ambition of ours that has been unattainable due to our independent status and lack of financial capital

 

In the instance that we do not hit our goal, all funds raised will still contribute towards funding the pressing of the EP.

 

Supporters - What You Get!

Depending on how you choose to support us in this venture you will get any of or a combination of the following:

  • First access to listening to Defence Mechanisms
  • An exclusive zine made by Kate, Theia and Maxine that takes you behind the scenes of the band and creating the EP with writing, art and photography.
  • 10” vinyl EP Defence Mechanisms
  • Stickers
  • Limited run t-shirt.
  • Private performance (limited to Sydney Metropolitan and Greater Sydney areas in a covid-safe environment)

 

In detail:

Paper Pack:

  • Zine
  • Sticker
     

Digi Pack:

  • Digital download of Defence Mechanisms
  • Zine
  • Sticker
     

Vinyl Pack 1:

  • 10" Vinyl EP of Defence Mechanisms
  • Digital download
  • Zine
  • Sticker
     

Vinyl Pack 2:

  • Limited edition t-shirt
  • 10" Vinyl EP of Defence Mechanisms
  • Digital download
  • Zine
  • Sticker
     

Private Performance

  • Vinyl Pack 2
  • Private performance

 

---

Your Impact

Pressing our music to vinyl has long been a dream of ours, but one we have not been able to achieve due to financial constraints. Your support will enable us to see this goal fulfilled, as well as get our music out to our fans and audiophiles. 

 

Your contribution will help to elevate our career, provide tangible music to our fans, help pave the way for greater visibility of queer, women, and gender diverse musicians, and aid us in promoting challenging alternative rock within the Sydney and Australian music scenes. 

 

If All Else Fails… (aka risks & challenges)

We are an indie band in the literal sense of the word (not the genre!); we’re 100% independent and self-managed. Committing to setting this goal is daunting! We understand that there is a possibility that we may not hit our goal of $2,000, but we remain committed to pulling together funds to see through our endgame of pressing Defence Mechanisms to vinyl. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We’re living in tough times and we don’t want you to extend yourselves financially where it’s simply not possible. If you want to help us beyond the financial, here’s what you can do:

  • SHARE our campaign on your socials
  • Tell your friends
  • Follow us on our socials
  • Stream our music and add our tracks to playlists
  • Take a look at purchasing our remaining stock from the Bruise Pristine Bandcamp: https://bruisepristine.bandcamp.com/

story:
Zuby's NEW ALBUM is here

Over the last several months, I've written and recorded a powerful, inspirational, and provocative new album called WORD OF ZUBY.

WORD OF ZUBY is my sixth album and my first music project in over two years. It's also my most important album to date.

Since releasing 'Perseverance' at the beginning of 2019, I've gained hundreds of thousands of new followers, appeared on some of the biggest podcasts in the world (including 'The Joe Rogan Experience'), and exposed millions of new people to my message through social media, interviews, and TV appearances.

Now, it's time to bring it back to the MUSIC.

 

I am a 100% INDEPENDENT artist.

I've never signed to a record label, nor even had a manager. That means I can do what I want, artistically and business-wise, without having to answer to 'the music industry'. But it also means I don't have access to label funding, record advances, nor many mainstream promotional outlets.

It's you, my fans and supporters, that make everything possible.

By backing this project, you are directly helping me to fund the independent release and promotion of WORD OF ZUBY. With your contribution, we can reach more people and help shift the culture in a positive direction.


On this album, I've collaborated with amazingly talented artists and producers from the UK, USA, Canada, and Europe. I'm proud of every single song.

Tracklist:

  1. Real
  2. Devil May Cry
  3. Moments (feat. YONAS) 
  4. OK Dude
  5. Legacy (feat. Stephen Smitley & Eric July)
  6. Underrated (feat. Mac Lethal & Shao Dow)
  7. Hallelujah (feat. Bryson Gray)
  8. Live It Up (feat. Reverie)
  9. Breathe
  10. No Lamborghini (feat. Tyrone & Warbz)
  11. Anarchy (feat. An0maly)
  12. Marvelous (feat. Ruslan)
  13. Only a Man

 

What You'll Get - The Perks

You will be one of the first people in the world to hear my new album.

You will also get access to:

  • signed CDs
  • limited edition vinyl (2 x 12")
  • ultra-rare art prints signed by ZUBY & MVDEX
     

Exclusive CD Digipak​

  • Exclusive 'Word of Zuby' CD digipak with booklet and original artwork by MVDEX
  • Only the first run of 'Word of Zuby' CDs will have this packaging
  • Signed copies available
     

Missed out on Zuby's previous albums? Double up or quadruple up with a bundle.


Limited Edition Vinyl

  • 'Word of Zuby' 2 x 12" vinyl album with original artwork by MVDEX
  • Limited edition purple colour vinyl discs
  • Only 500 of these will be made. Individually signed by Zuby
  • This is the first Zuby album to be available on vinyl

 

Collector's Edition Art Print

  • Ultra rare, 18" x 24" Matte paper heavyweight print. Signed by Zuby and MVDEX 
  • Inspired by the reality of objectivism, MVDEX creates artwork for the worthy individuals and artists that preserve the great motor of the world and manifest the pursuit of excellence.
  • "This tribute to Zuby immortalizes the clarity of a free man's courage to stand up against the mob." - MVDEX
  • Collector's item for top backers - Only 30 made

 

 

The more successful this campaign is, the more cool and creative stuff we can do with this album, and the more people I can reach and inspire!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please SHARE this campaign on social media!
  • Buy my music and merchandise from teamzuby.com
  • Subscribe to my Patreon


THANK YOU! #teamzuby

story:
OVERVIEW:

Now through the end of June, Dark Water Rising is teaming up with IndieGogo to try to raise $20,000 towards our new album.  The band's sophomore release (Grace & Grit: Chapter I) helped capture the 2014 Native American Music Award for "Best Inspirational Recording" and capped off another era of music for DWR. The upcoming record will encompass two years of new material with an edgier, more rockin' sound than before. We are calling the album "Walnut Branch" in honor of our band house in Chapel Hill - a secluded haven of late night practices, rigorous recording sessions, and beautiful mornings writing songs on the back porch. For two years we have heard people ask "When is the new album coming out?" Well, the time has finally come, but we need your help to make it happen!


So WHO is DWR and WHY should I care?

Dark Water Rising is a 5 pc. band formed in Robeson County, NC with Native American roots intertwining with the sounds of Southern soul and rock.

Today, Dark Water Rising is Charly Lowry (American Idol, Season 3, 2004), Aaron Locklear, Emily Musolino (Berklee School of Music, 12'), Corey Locklear, and Zack Hargett of North Carolina. 

Click Here for Dark Water Rising’s Show Schedule and Bio

THE PLAN:

Recording/Mixing: 

Our plan is to buy our own top of the line recording equipment and record the album in house rather than having a very limited amount of time in a more expensive studio with stricter time constraints. We believe this DIY approach will capture our performance better and give the listener yet another perspective in comparison to our previous albums. We are fortunate to have a professionally trained audio engineer, Emily Musolino as one of our frontwomen, so the mix quality will be top notch! Here is a short list of the gear we need, which will cost just over $7,500.

Antelope Audio Orion 32 Recording Interface

MP32  Microphone Preamp 

16 Mogami 25ft mic cables

Microphones:

Neumann TLM 103

AKG C414 Stereo Pair 

Mastering:

Mastering is the difference between a sharpie-covered home demo you get on the street outside of Walmart and a professional record! We are hiring the nationally recognized genius Brent Lambert of The Kitchen to do his mastering magic on our upcoming album. He is the creme de la creme and as such he charges for the best work! Mastering costs for the album will be about $1500.

Cd + DVD Manufacturing/Packaging:

We are hiring Discmakers to print 500 copies of the new record which will cost us $2,000.

Merch: 

We want everybody to be decked out in the coolest DWR gear! Sweet custom-designed T-shirts run about $1,000 for a run of 100 and stickers cost $300 for 1000.

Crafts: Our wonderful friend Lywanda Locklear is a wizard of arts and crafts, creating custom made dreamcatchers, jewelry, boxes and anything else you can think of out of pine needles, stones and other found items. Her work is truly extraordinary and will be featured as one of our perks! 

Public Relations:

Also along with releasing the album, we will be hiring a publicist to help market and get the word out about the release on a more professional level.  This will cost around $4,000/month.  

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Tell anyone and everyone you know about this project! We’ve compiled a list of prizes for certain donations that we call the 12 campaign levels which include digital downloads, advanced copies of the album, special request covers dedicated to you, your name in the CD liner credits…and the list goes on!  Donate what you can!! 

READY, SET, GO! 

Thank you so much for your love and support and for tweeting, instagramming, texting and telling everyone you know about this project! We are counting on you to make this album a success!

ClICK HERE TO FUND DWR’s CD PROJECT NOW!

story:
Greetings Everyone,


My name is Larry Ewings, aka Jupiter 7.  I am an Emcee, Producer, and youth worker from the Bay Area.  I've been an independent hip-hop artist since 2003.  My rap career started back in 95' while I was in high school in Salinas, CA.  What started off as a dream and something I did for fun, became a reality in 2004 when I released my first professional EP.  At that time, I was living in East Oakland, just graduated from college, and was working as a youth director.  I was broke, living in a dorm room, doing shows for free, and trying to play a positive role in my community.  Since these humble beginnings,  I have independently released over six full length albums and have performed with some of the best local and national artists.  I am excited to introduce my newest project and hope you can help me with this campaign.

My new album RETROSPECT is the second full length project with Belarus producer Mistapool.  The theme behind the project is to use past life moments, snapshots of time, that could be used for material to fuel each song.  Retrospect is the most developed project that I've ever worked on in which each track has been carefully crafted to convey a type of feeling or message.  It's been four years since I released any music due to the birth of my son Lyric (who's 2 years old now), the passing of my father (March 2015), and my current job working with at-risk youth (Since 2011). My goal as an artist has always been to reach people on a personal level and to create music that universally everyone can listen to.  As an independent artist, it's extremely difficult to get the push and coverage (money and promotion) that signed artists receive without being part of a major record label.  The benefit of being an indie artist is there is no label controlling what the music sounds like, content to engage the listener with, and what image is portrayed.  In essence, you are more likely to get the real and unfiltered creativity of the artist... not what the record label sells you.  With that said, I can't do this on my own.  You are the lifeline to what I do and where the music goes.  My goal at the end of the day is to create music that will positively effect you as a person, us as a community, and hip-hop as a culture.   

With your help, when we reach our goal, here is what we will be able to accomplish:

  • Print between 2,000 to 5,000 CD's to be distributed FREE of charge at every show and event until the inventory is gone ($1700-$3200)
  • Help create a professional music video to highlight the lead single off the album titled "Do That," which depicts the negative and positive influences that hip-hop has on our culture ($1000-$1500)
  • Contribute towards a West Coast Tour that is essential to promote for the new album (TBD)
  • Assist in the costs for promotional and incentive items including:  t-shirts, posters, stickers, graphic design work, etc (TBD)
  • Cover recording costs including studio time plus mixing and mastering ($1000-$1500)
  • Contribute towards creating a rhyme book geared towards teaching life skills to at-risk youth and spiritual themes to discipleship groups (TBD)
  • Promote local music
  • Support an independent artist creating positive music

If we happen to not reach our goal, whatever proceeds are made would go towards the purchase of the CD's to be distributed for FREE... then promotional items if the cost is covered.  

Check out the perks associated with your giving.  I wanted to make sure it was worth your time and effort.  I also understand that not everyone can give financially.  If you can help me promote this project to your friends, family, and strangers, I will throw in some cool perks for you as well.  Just email me personally and we can work something out.  Each supporter who gives $20 or more will automatically get a Free Download of 2 secret tracks from Retrospect.   

Thanks again for stopping by and hopefully I'll see you on the other side.  Peace and Retrospect!


- J7

j7hiphop@gmail.com
facebook.com/j7hiphop
twitter.com/j7hiphop
reverbnation.com/jupiter7
jupiter7.bandcamp.com

story:
We are Black Cedar...

...with Steve Lin on guitar, Kris Palmer on wood flute and alto flute, and Nancy Kim on cello. With this unique instrumentation, we nurture the compositions of new works by composers like David Smith, Durwynne Hsieh and Garrett Shatzer. We discover overlooked musical creations, such as Chinary Ung's Luminous Spirals, Klaus Hinrich Stahmer’s Debussyana written in 1983, and Nathan Kolosko’s Hungarian Trio, written in 2012. And, we re-imagine favorite gems, such as Astor Piazzolla’s Tanti Anni Prima, and the old Appalachian folk tune, The House Carpenter.

We explore the path less trod...

...by performing these works and others throughout California, plus live on-air radio concerts on KKUP 91.5 in San Jose, KALW 91.7 in San Francisco, and KWMR 90.5 in Marin County. But, don't take our word for it. Read what the press is saying about us here...and here!

It's not just art for art's sake...

...but also about enriching the lives of others by sharing this music in ongoing free concerts for developmentally disabled adults in the East Bay Area of Northern California. In April 2012, the members of the disabled community at the Arc of Alameda County presented Black Cedar with one of their own paintings as a thank you to us for our free chamber music concerts there:

The flute, cello, and guitar combo is rare...

...due to the diversity of these three instruments: a wind instrument, a bowed-string orchestral instrument, and a plucked-string instrument. Black Cedar is the only ensemble strictly devoted to this instrument combination, which has landed us a 2014 Musical Grant and affiliate sponsorship from San Francisco Friends of Chamber Music. Their support helps us to begin bringing these works to chamber music fans, but we still need your support to reach an even wider audience.

You can help us...

...record, produce, and release our debut album that will bring to life Nathan Kolosko’s Hungarian Trio, Klaus Hinrich Stahmer’s Debussyana, Dusan Bogdanovic's Over the Edge, and entirely new works by Garrett Shatzer, Durwynne Hsieh, and David Smith - all three commissioned by Black Cedar. None of these works have been commercially recorded, and your donation will give them the audience they deserve.

Roughly 250 hours...

...can go into composing a new work of chamber music, says Garrett Shatzer:

And, when composers write music, they relinquish a part of themselves not only to the musicians who interpret their creation but also to the audience that receives the finished product. Durwynne Hsieh often finds himself telling a story through his music, even if he is not sure where that story will lead:

Music comes to life when the triangle is complete...

...through the mind that imagines it, the performers who bring it to life, and the humans who hear and experience it:

If music is not heard, it does not exist. Help us deliver these fine works of art to the audience they so richly deserve.

You can help us with...

THE $3,000 TOTAL COMMISSIONING FEES FOR OUR COMPOSERS.

After 250 hours of composition time, a $1,000 commission to a composer means an hourly rate of only $4. Mama, don't let your babies grow up to be composers.

THE $5,000 ESTIMATED COST TO PRODUCE THIS ALBUM WITH VGO RECORDINGS.

Vince Go is an amazing recording engineer who is generously offering us a very low fee for our first album. There are multiple steps involved with creating the final product:

  • Recording the music
  • Editing and Mixing the sounds
  • Mastering the final selections
  • Creating the album art work and the graphic design
  • Replicating and duplicating all of those compact discs

Once the product is ready to go, Black Cedar will cover the costs of marketing, promotion, and advertising with our own ticket sales and concert proceeds.

Or simply help us spread the word...

...by sharing our campaign on Facebook and Twitter!

Piazzolla’s Tanti Anni Prima, and the
old Appalachian folk tune, The House Carpenter.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Roshanda Ayanna Womack. I am a singer and song writer from Flint, Michigan and this is “The Next Big Step” for me in music ministry.

 It's time to take this ministry national!

In order to make this happen, my song “Superman” needs to be professionally remixed and mastered by a professional producer. I will also need to hire a marketing firm to create a national radio marketing campaign. Hopefully, this will get my song on radio stations around the country and create opportunities for me to preform as well.

I need your support in making this next step a reality. I'm asking you to make a donation from the heart to help me cover the cost of a producer, studio time, travel expenses, plus the marketing and promotion of this song. I believe that God gave me this song and has called me to take it to the world. I believe it will encourage fellow Christians and will also touch those who may never step foot into the church. Please partner with me as we take the next big step!

All funds collected will be used exclusively to help me reach my goal. Thank you in advance for your generosity, and your faith in me and the God I serve. I will continue to keep you updated on my progress.

“Dreams become reality, one step at a time”

Peace and Love,

Shani Womack
