story:
We've come a long way since our humble beginnings as a celtic folk trio in Valencia, Spain. We have traveled all over Europe, picking up ideas and musicians, making friends and developing our sound... Solana has grown into a big multinational family. We've had the pleasure of playing a range of venues, from tiny intimate acoustic gigs to full-on dancy festival shows... and we couldn't have done it without you!

It's our audiences, fans, families, friends and fellow musicians who inspire us to carry on playing, creating and sharing. Massive thanks to everyone who has supported us on this journey - you are as much a part of this story as we are!

The next chapter is now beginning! This will be our biggest undertaking to date.. A full-length album of completely original material, featuring guest musicians from across Europe, released on CD and for the first time vinyl!

If you like the sound of that, please get involved! Every contribution helps, no matter how great or small. Check out the perks on the right; we don't want to charge extortionately just for this campaign so we've kept the prices to what they would be if you came to see us at a gig... and even if you are really skint don't worry, you can help: share this campaign and spread the word, let's reach as many people as possible!

THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING OUR MUSIC!

As we discovered last time, recording and producing an album can be very expensive. We want this album to sound great, so the funds from this campaign will be spend on the best possible studio, equipment and expertise. We have some money saved but we are going to need a lot more to be able to make this dream a reality. Here's a rough breakdown of what everything will cost:

  • Studio time: £1500
  • Mixing: £500
  • Mastering: £300
  • CD duplication: £1500
  • Vinyl pressing: £1000

There will of course be more expenses, like T-shirt production, video shooting, promotion etc. so the more we raise on this campaign the less we'll have to concentrate on all of that and the better the music will be!

We will be going into the studio in September but we won't release the album until April next year to give us time to properly promote the launch as well as organise and send out all of the rewards! However, all backers of this project will receive a pre-release digital download, so you'll get to hear it first!

Please don't hesitate to get in contact if you have any questions. You can find out more about us on our website and social media pages:

Website

Facebook

Twitter

Youtube


THANKYOU Y MUCHAS GRACIAS!

story:
More About Us

Angie Kopshy, MM, MT-BC, is the founder and Co-Director of Portland Music Therapy. Angie is co-chair of the Government Relations Task Force in Oregon, Reimbursement Representative for the Western Region Chapter of the American Music Therapy Association, President Elect of the Oregon Association for Music Therapy and adjunct faculty in the Music Therapy Department at Pacific University. Angie is also a singer and songwriter with the band Stoneface Honey.

Jo Alexis has spent the last 25 years writing, recording, and performing and has 12 albums to her name, including one CD for kids. One of her career highlights was getting to sing with Peter Yarrow of Peter, Paul and Mary.  She’s co-written with Peter Fox, Paul O'Connor and Stevie Blacke (plays with Miley Cyrus).  Currently her trio, Happy For No Reason, is recording their new CD. Her dance music project, Deep Tissue & Jo Alexis, just released a video of their single, "I Can Feel That.”

Kate Harris, MT-BC, is the Co-Director of Portland Music Therapy. She is Secretary of the Oregon Association for Music Therapy and a clinical supervisor of music therapy students at Pacific University. Kate is also a singer and bassist with the band, Stoneface Honey.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $2850 to cover the costs of recording, mixing and mastering the album. Your donations will also cover the costs of creating a physical version of the album. 
  • The album includes 15 songs:

Good Morning, Feelings Always Change, Thank you for music, Music Makes Me Happy,  La, La, La, Balloons, Bubbles, Relaxation Song, Up and Down, You've Got to Sing, Doomba, The Drum Song, The Letter Song, The Hello Song, Goodbye in Many Languages, I Fell Into

  • Check out our perks in the right hand column. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Can't contribute? You can still help by making some noise about our campaign.
  • Make it easy on yourself by using the Indiegogo share tools!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? You can still help by making some noise about our campaign.
Make it easy on yourself by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
After seeing the murder of Philando Castile live on Facebook, I felt compelled to finish a song I started after the massacre at Pulse Nightclub in Orlando. 
The song moved ME so much that I used a mixing session for another song to record it immediately. 

I'm due to release the song in the next two weeks.

In order to give it its proper detail and promotion, I'd like to shoot the video for it during the next 3 weeks. I've been in contact with a videographer. He is charging $500 with additional set up fees. I'm soliciting your help to get it his out.

story:
Due to record with Devil Sold His Soul guitarist Jonny (Bandit Studios), we have three thumping, long, and epic prog metal tracks ready to record, and the aim is to make this the best release to date. 

The three songs we are recording, represent us at the top of our game, we can't wait to share these tunes with you!

Stone Circle

story:
Friends, Family, Supporters!

As many of you know, I’ve been working on my second CD project, Strange Place, for years now. In that time, I’ve been singing all over NYC and NJ as a solo artist and as part of groups.  I released my first CD, a live recording entitled “The Song Is Mine” back in 2002 (check it out on Amazon.com) and since then, have wanted to do a studio project where I could express through music, some of what it was like to live and work in New York City.  I know a million people have tackled that same theme, but  the combination of music and lyrics on Strange Place (some of my original work as well as carefully chosen covers), will allow you to share my particular take on the experience. 

I’ve been fortunate to work with so many talented people on this: Musicians from NYC and New Jersey, my co-producer Kevin Jasper, music director James Followell  with whom I co-wrote two of the songs; Videographer Reid Carrescia,  Asbury Park artist Larry Porter..the list goes on.  The project has been started and stopped and started again many times, but this time it's really happening!  

I’ve spent a lot of hours back in the studio, re-recording and re-working the tracks. It’s all sounding  and feeling wonderful.  But I need your help to bring this thing home.  Please take a look at the two videos on this site. In one, I'm making my plea for your dollars, and the other is a video of the first track on Strange Place; an excerpt from Elton John's "Mona Lisas and Mad Hatters".  It's short, but it gives you an idea of the overall musical palette of this CD.

Here’s the nitty gritty:  I’ve already invested just under $15,000 and I know I can finish this with $8,000 more. There are 13 tracks on the CD and I’ve got 8 that are 90% finished. The other 4 need to be recorded and I’ve got all of that lined up.  That $8,000 will go toward the recording,  mixing and mastering of those 4 tracks as well as the production of the actual CD, including the packaging and a couple of shows to release it. I'll be all over Facebook as well with updates and more 30 second sound clips from the tracks.  If you can’t donate any money, then please pass the campaign link to whoever you think might be able to help out.

I know this is an ambitious goal. But I’m dreaming big here. You have to ask for what you need, right?  $8,000 is 300 people donating $25.00 each. That doesn’t seem impossible to me. And if you donate $25.00, you'll be getting a CD when it comes out!  So many people have invested their time and talent on this. I want to honor that by finishing it and getting it out there into the world.  I want it to be heard.  This year! I know that I can get this done with $8,000. Please check it out and if you like what you see and hear, make a contribution. We've got 60 days to make this happen.   Help me finish this. I truly believe you’ll enjoy it.

story:
The Pop Record

In February of 2014, Justin and Harry set out to make their craziest record yet. Most of their work up until that point had been experimental in nature, but they decided it was time to create the pop record they had always talked about. And to up the ante, they decided to write AND record the album in just 28 days as a response to the Recording Project Month (RPM) Challenge. Miraculously, through sleepless nights, occasionally unproductive sessions, hangry disagreements, and the near destruction of their friendship, they emerged with an oddly compelling, highly eclectic selection of pop tunes that they now consider some of their finest work. 

Despite the overall success of the project, the short time frame of the sessions meant there were a few flaws on the record. The first step will be to correct those problems, and to then remix the album in a professional studio before having it sent out to be mastered for vinyl. 

The original version of the Pop Record can be heard here: https://paintedrecords.bandcamp.com/album/hartley-the-jubb-present-a-pop-record

The complete box set

Additionally, they have been digging in the vaults to find all of the previously unheard recordings they have made over the last ten years of working together. These will all be assembled on to a hand painted USB drive, the perfect compliment to the official Painted Records catalogue USB drive. 

Take a listen to some of our work here: https://paintedrecords.bandcamp.com
